title: Remote Environmental Consultant
description:
***HireLatam is a premier recruitment agency that connects exceptional talent in Latin America with outstanding opportunities in the United States.*** ***With a proven track record and a commitment to excellence, we're your trusted partner in the pursuit of career success. Our extensive network, personalized approach, and supportive guidance ensure that you're in the best hands to find your next job opportunity.***

  

**Job Title: Environmental Consultant (100% Work from Home)**

Our client l is a fast-growing environmental consulting company located in the Southeastern United States. They work with large companies across the United States providing cutting edge solutions to their environmental and sustainability challenges.


**Job Summary:**

They are seeking a passionate and detail-oriented environmental consultant to join their team and make an immediate impact!


**Responsibilities:**

* Must be fluent in English with the ability to interface with Clients virtually or via email.
* Must be an excellent writer with the ability to write reports from start to finish using template field notes provided by the field personnel.
* Managing multi-media projects for individual and multi-facility clients across the United States.
* SPCC Plans and FRPs; SWPPPs and stormwater compliance; wastewater permitting and compliance; RCRA Hazardous Waste Generator compliance, Contingency Plans, and Biennial Reporting; EPCRA Tier II and TRI Reporting; agency communications and ongoing environmental compliance support such as auditing and EMS development.
* EPCRA reporting (Tier II and TRI), GHG mandatory reporting, and ongoing compliance management.

**Requirements**

* Previous experience working in a similar role for a US business
* Excellent English level both written and spoken
* Familiarity with Environmental Consulting
* Must be located in Latin America

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Engineering or similar field (Geology, Biology, etc.)
* Air permit applications (PSD, NNSR, Title V, Synthetic Minor/FESOP, True Minor), permit submittal components (emissions calculations/inventories, BACT/LAER/RACT determinations, air dispersion modeling [AERMOD, CALPUFF], regulatory applicability, air permitting assessments and notifications, ongoing compliance reports (ACCs, semiannual reports, emissions inventories/statements),

**Benefits:**

* Salary: $1750 USD / month
* Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and contribute to a rapidly growing company
* Collaborative and supportive work environment
* Professional development opportunities to enhance your skills and knowledge
**Application Disclaimer: Please Read Before Proceeding**

*To ensure a fair evaluation process, please submit all required information on the application form. Kindly note that resumes and recordings must be in* ***English*** *;* ***any other language will lead to disqualification*** *. Also, ensure your* ***voice/video recording lasts at least 30 seconds*** *. Applications* ***without a voice/video recording will be disqualified.***

*If you apply for more than one position, we will only consider your application for the first job you applied for. However, if you do not qualify for the first position but meet the requirements for another, we can consider you for the relevant role. To streamline the process and ensure fair consideration,* ***we kindly request that you apply to a maximum of three jobs*** *and that you only apply to jobs that you truly qualify for based on the stated requirements and qualifications.*

*We value your interest and look forward to reviewing your application. Thank you.*

title: Part-Time Structural Engineer
description:
CP Engineers, Architecture & Environmental Services, a multi-discipline engineering consulting firm with offices in northern New Jersey and Northeastern Pennsylvania, is seeking a part-time Structural Engineer to join our team. With over forty years of experience, CP provides a wide range of services including site/civil, water/wastewater, municipal, MEP, and environmental engineering. CP was named one of NJBiz's Best Places to Work in 2023, and also the TOP engineering firm in New Jersey according to NJBiz's readers rankings. We have received a 5-Star rating from employees on Glassdoor.

**Job Description**

* 10-30 hours of work per week depending on candidate preference
* $50-75 per hour depending on experience
* Design structural elements for projects
* Develop drawings and specifications (CAD proficiency a bonus, but not required)
* Perform site visits when and where required
* Review photos and site visit inspection notes with staff to develop reports and memoranda
* Mentor engineers with less experience in the practice of structural engineering
* Manage structural projects

CP Engineers is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. In 2016, CP was recognized by NJBIZ as one of NJ’s Best Places to Work. CP has also been the recipient of several awards from a variety of trade associations. At CP Engineers, our employees are more than just assets; they are an integral part of our family.

**Requirements**

* 7 years structural engineering experience
* New Jersey PE License, or the requisite experience to attain one following hire
* Ability to obtain licensing in other states
* Ability to work collaboratively with other disciplines

**Benefits**

* Remote work - aside from client site visits.
* Support for employee work/life balance.
* Training and development processes.
* Quality benefits including medical, dental and vision coverage.
* 401(k) match, fully vested
* Employee satisfaction: we have an 85% employee retention rate in the last 15 years. Please see our Glassdoor page.

title: Civil Engineer - Water Resources
description:
Craving projects that blend environmental savvy with community impact? Then join our dynamic team of civil engineers in the Inland Northwest!

  



We're not just designing infrastructure – we're reimagining it. From revitalizing downtowns with low impact stormwater solutions and new pedestrian paths to restoring the habitats of endangered species alongside conservationists, we tackle diverse challenges with creativity and purpose. Just think of transforming and restoring the surrounding habitats of rivers and streams.

  



We need team members who lead with vision, problem-solve, and champion our Core Values. All while building trust, fostering collaboration, and having fun along the way.

  



The future of the Inland Northwest’s streams and rivers is bright, and we need you to help make projects across the region successful. Are you ready to join the team?

  



This is more than just a job. It's a chance to be a trailblazer, an environmental champion, and an agent of positive change. Let's build something extraordinary, together.

  


**About You**



Our ideal candidate can envision the steps needed to accomplish and delegate civil engineering tasks. They think creatively and outside the box. We're hoping to find a supportive leader who prefers team success over individual glory.

  



We’re looking for someone with:


* 3 to 5+ years’ experience in civil engineering including open channel hydraulics, hydraulic modeling, and stream restoration
* Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering
* SRH-2D modeling or HEC-RAS modeling experience
* Strong work ethic, sense of humor, and desire for team success
* Ability to prioritize multiple tasks, and ability to lead others as the task lead
* The ability to meet and work with diverse clients and bring in new work

  



To thrive in this position, you may also have these qualifications:


* Experience with bridge scour calculations, bank stabilization, design of large woody material (LWM), and fish passage.
* Experience delivering projects for state transportation departments (WSDOT or ITD) and local agencies.
* Licensed Professional Engineer in the State of Washington or able to obtain within six months
* Familiar with GIS, AutoCAD Civil 3D, Bentley InRoads and OpenRoads
* WSDOT Fish Passage and Stream Restoration Design Certification

  


**About the Role**



In this position, you’ll work with a highly collaborative team to:


* Lead fieldwork to assess stream conditions, stream bed material composition, embankment stability, and lateral migration potential
* Determine riverine and tidal hydrology
* Perform hydraulic analyses and design
* Design large woody material (LWM) structures
* Evaluates LWM design stability with and without anchor systems
* Perform floodplain, floodway, zero rise, scour analysis, and other hydraulic analyses
* Support design-bid-build, design-build, and progressive design-build pursuits
* Mentor young engineers and technical staff

  


**Location**



This position will support our Spokane office either in-person or remotely from the Inland Northwest. Occasional travel may be required to project sites in eastern and central Washington, Idaho, Montana, and Oregon.

  


**About Osborn**



Osborn Consulting is an employee-owned consulting firm providing civil engineering, landscape architecture, and urban design on public projects across Washington state. The power of these public projects surrounds our daily lives, from the sidewalks we stroll to visit our neighborhood park, to the confidence in knowing our homes are safe from flooding when heavy rain comes. Our team develops strong foundations of trust with cities, counties, and agencies to achieve more resilient and more sustainable communities.

  



We have grown strategically over the last 20 years from a firm of one to a team of more than 100 motivated, hard-working, and creative individuals. Working for Osborn provides you the chance to learn new skills, follow your passions, and have fun along the way!

  


**What We Offer**


* Competitive pay, medical and dental insurance, a 401K plan with matching, PTO/holiday pay, health and fitness stipend, commute support, and profit sharing.
* A collaborative and fun environment with idea-sharing, learning, and curiosity.
* Training and mentoring.
* Opportunities for growth within the company.

  


**What We Value**



Our new team member will be someone who aligns with our core values of Professionalism & Responsibility, Collaboration & Creativity, Health & Well-Being, Laughter & Fun, Relationships & Respect, Growth & Exploration.

  


**Our Diversity and Inclusion**



OCI is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture.

  



If you are an individual with a disability and need assistance completing the online application, please call 425-451-4009. Please leave a message and a member of our People Operations team will return your call within three business days. Alternatively, an email may be sent to hr@osbornconsulting.com. “Applicant Accommodation” should be included in the subject line of the email. Please note that this phone number and email are only for those individuals who would like to request an accommodation to apply for a job.

  



Osborn participates in the Electronic Employment Eligibility Verification Program.

title: Environmental Engineer - Air Quality Permitting and Compliance
description:
What would it feel like to be part of a company guided by engaged and empowered employee-owners? To have the encouragement to run with innovative ideas? To know your opinion is valued and your voice is heard? Wouldn't you love to work in an atmosphere of transparency, respect, and accountability?

  

  

**Then you belong at SEH.**


SEH is currently searching for a talented Air Quality Engineer to join our team!


The SEH Environmental Team of scientists and engineers restores balance to our world through their work to protect our land, air and water resources. The type of work you do may be in the field of air quality, environmental assessments, remediation, compliance, planning and permitting. The work of the team varies from transforming polluted land parcels into community assets, restoring damaged waterways, reimagining solid waste management strategies or assisting our clients through complex regulatory compliance and permitting processes. No day is ever the same, but our goal of a cleaner, healthier planet remains steadfast.


**Selling Points:**


* Our ESOP provides you an opportunity to own part of the company – **100% of our profits are re-invested in our Employee Owners!**
* SEH supports you living your best life! We offer flexible work arrangements and schedules, so you have options that work for you.
* We want you to have options to celebrate the holidays important to you and your family through our flexible paid holiday program.
* Our Paid Family Leave benefit allows you to be there for the people you love - whether it’s the family you were born into or the family you chose


**What you will be doing:**


* Technical lead for air permitting, air dispersion modeling, and environmental compliance projects.
* Develop air dispersion modeling approaches to demonstrate compliance with federal and state ambient air quality standards, and inhalation risk evaluations. Responsibilities need not include running the models.
* Lead a project team
* Assist with business development activities including preparing cost estimates, writing scopes of work, and communicating with clients.
* Develop project approaches in conjunction with client
* May be required to prepare complex air emission calculations.
* May be required to perform air quality engineering analysis such as Best Available Control Technology analysis or air emission control evaluations.
* Assign duties to project team, answer questions, and monitor progress
* Maintain project schedule and assures that deadlines are met
* Checks accuracy of completed work and is responsible for ensuring QA/QC procedures are followed
* Maintain close relationship with client during project execution
* May be required to maintain client contact after project is completed
* Work with state and federal regulatory agency staff
* Manage, mentor, and work with staff as needed to provide a positive team environment
* Maintain an understanding of relevant state and federal environmental regulations and guidance documents through active participation in continuing education programs and professional associations


**Required Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in chemical, environmental engineering, meteorology or other related engineering or science field of study
* Minimum of two (2) years previous experience with air quality permitting and compliance projects
* Understanding of air permitting approaches for major sources, area sources and sources eligible for Registration Permits.
* Understanding of air dispersion modeling.
* Understanding of state and federal air quality regulatory programs such as BACT, RACT, NESHAPs, and NSPS.
* Experience with conducting on-site visits
* Overnight travel or periods of on-site service may be required


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Licensed as a Professional Engineer in the States of Wisconsin or Minnesota or the ability to obtain registration in either State within six (6) months of employment.
* Understanding of Prevention of Significant Deterioration permitting, compliance and avoidance.
* Experience managing a project team and the ability to coach and mentor technical staff
* Experience with air dispersion modeling software.
* Eight (8) or more years previous experience with air pollution control system evaluations.
* Strong relationships with WDNR or MPCA air permitting and compliance staff.
* Experience participating in public meetings.
* Experience presenting proposals and leading client discussions.


**Who we are**


Better Places. Clean Water. Renewing Infrastructure. Improving Mobility. Together with clients, we’re simplifying the world’s most complex challenges. And we’ve been doing this since 1927. SEH is employee-owned and our 900+ engineers, architects, planners, scientists and a wide array of professionals unite behind our core purpose of Building a Better World for All of Us®. You’ll find our employee-owners located across the U.S. and evidence of our work in nearly every state.


Base compensation is expected to be in the range of $90,000 and $115,000 based on skill set and experience. Check out our full benefits package at, SEH Hiring Journey


**The selected candidate must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. without requiring visa sponsorship now or in the future. We are unable to provide or take over sponsorship of an employment visa for this role.**


For confidential consideration, apply online or send your resume and salary requirements via fax to 651.490.2138. Please refer to the job title if you choose to fax.  

  

Short Elliott Hendrickson Inc. is committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees according to all applicable equal opportunity and affirmative action laws, directives and regulations of federal, state and local governing bodies and agencies. In keeping with this commitment, it is the policy of Short Elliott Hendrickson Inc. to base all employment decisions only on valid job requirements without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, genetic information, marital status, familial status, status with regard to public assistance, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or status as a covered veteran. Women and minorities encouraged to apply.


**Notice to Third Party Agencies:** SEH does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters, staffing services, or other employment agencies. If a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed Service Agreement by SEH’s Director of Talent Attraction expressly requesting recruitment/staffing services for specific position(s), SEH reserves the right to pursue and hire these candidates without any financial obligation to the recruiter, employment agency, or other staffing service. In such cases, any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers or other business leaders, are deemed to be the property of SEH.


#LI-DNI

title: W/WW Professional Engineer
description:
**Position: Water/Wastewater Professional Engineer**  

  

  

**About Us:**  

  

  

We are a leading W/WW firm dedicated to providing innovative solutions for water and wastewater management. With a strong commitment to sustainability and a passion for addressing environmental challenges, we are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Water/Wastewater Professional Engineer to join our team.  

  

  

**Job Description:**  

  

  

We are looking for an experienced Water/Wastewater Professional Engineer to play a key role in our engineering team. In this position, you will be responsible for planning, designing, and overseeing water and wastewater projects. Your expertise in this field will be essential in ensuring the delivery of high-quality, environmentally responsible, and efficient solutions to our clients.  

  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

  

* **Project Management:** Lead and manage water and wastewater projects from concept through design, permitting, and construction, ensuring they are completed on time and within budget.


* **Design and Engineering:** Develop and review engineering plans, specifications, and designs for water treatment, distribution, wastewater collection, and treatment systems.


* **Regulatory Compliance:** Ensure that all projects adhere to local, state, and federal regulations, obtaining necessary permits and approvals.


* **Client Collaboration:** Work closely with clients to understand their needs and provide technical expertise and guidance, maintaining strong client relationships.


* **Team Leadership:** Mentor and lead a team of engineers and technical staff, providing direction and support to meet project objectives.


* **Quality Control:** Implement and maintain quality control measures to ensure the highest standard of engineering work.


* **Innovation:** Stay updated on industry best practices, emerging technologies, and sustainability trends to propose innovative solutions.


* **Budget and Resource Management:** Manage project budgets, allocate resources efficiently, and track expenses to maximize profitability.



  

**Qualifications:**  

  

* Bachelor's degree in Civil or Environmental Engineering, with a Professional Engineer (PE) license.
* 10 years of experience in water and wastewater engineering and project management.
* Strong knowledge of water and wastewater systems, processes, and regulations.
* Proficiency in engineering software and tools such as AutoCAD, HEC-RAS, and hydraulic modeling.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration with clients and team members.
* Demonstrated leadership and team management abilities.
* Commitment to environmental sustainability and responsible engineering practices.

  

  

This is a remote position.

title: Civil Engineer, PE - Remote
description:
**Civil Engineer, PE - Remote**

Discover your full potential. At Tetra Tech, we are collaborating with industry-leading experts for a sustainable future for our world. We combine consulting and engineering with advanced analytics and technology to solve the world’s most complex challenges. Our innovation hubs across the globe will enable you to share ideas and best practices while growing your professional network. Wherever you are in your career journey, you will benefit from working with world-class engineers, scientists, and technical specialists.

Apply today and join the company that is Leading with Science®. This is a REMOTE opportunity.

Tetra Tech's High-Performance Building is hiring a Civil Engineer. The successful candidate for this position will be responsible for providing civil engineering design. Typical projects include a wide variety of federal, industrial and commercial projects involving site layout and design, stormwater management, green infrastructure and water/wastewater collection and conveyance systems.

**Your Responsibilities will Include:**

* Working with project teams to create land development plans for our commercial, industrial and federal clients.
* Modeling water systems, design pump stations, force main sizing, and water tower designs.
* Performing water resources engineering and modeling for surface water management systems and stormwater collection/conveyance systems.
* Planning and designing water/wastewater/stormwater treatment, facilities/distribution/conveyance, pumping, and storage facilities projects;
* Producing green infrastructure and low-impact development stormwater design and hydraulic analysis.

**Required Qualifications**:

* Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering (or a related field).
* Professional Engineer license.
* 7+ years of experience.
* Experience in stormwater, water system and pump station hydraulic modeling.
* Experience and knowledge in commercial or industrial site development.
* Experience in Autodesk Storm and Sanitary Analysis.
* Proficiency in AutoCAD/Civil 3D.
* Position open to U.S. citizens or lawful permanent residents.

About Tetra Tech:

Tetra Tech combines the resources of a global, multibillion-dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in more than 550 locations around the world. Our reputation rests on the technical expertise and dedication of our employees—27,000 associates working together to provide smart, scalable solutions for challenging projects. We are proud to be home to leading technical experts in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development.

Explore our open positions at https://www.tetratech.com/careers. Follow us on social media to learn more about our people, culture, and opportunities:

LinkedIn: @TetraTechCareers

Twitter: @TetraTechJobs

Facebook: @TetraTechCareers

**Tetra Tech** is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity, inclusion, and equity are among Tetra Tech’s core values. Throughout our history, the company has prioritized equitable inclusion of all people. All qualified candidates will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, military or veteran status, gender, age, disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, genetic information and any other characteristics protected by the law. We invite resumes from all interested parties. Please visit our website at www.tetratech.com to see the array of diverse services and exciting projects we are currently working on.

Tetra Tech is a VEVRAA federal contractor and we request priority referral of veterans for available positions.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

**Please no phone calls or agencies.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Application Question(s):

* Do you possess 7+ years of Civil Engineering experience?

Work Location: Remote

title: Entry- to Mid-Level Water/Wastewater Engineer
description:
Eastern Research Group, Inc. (ERG) is a research and consulting firm that provides a wide range of support to federal, state, and commercial clients. ERG offers multidisciplinary teams with nationally recognized skills in engineering, science, economics, public health, informational technology, and communications. We hire people with the best minds and then provide them with a vibrant and flexible environment in which to develop their careers. The qualified individual must be highly motivated with the skills to prioritize, perform, and communicate effectively in a fast-paced environment.  

ERG is looking for talented, motivated individuals to join our growing water and wastewater engineering practice. You will have the opportunity to work with US EPA, States, and other agencies to address today’s most pressing water quality, resource, and infrastructure challenges.
### **Job Description:**

* Developing regulations to control industrial wastewater discharges of PFAS and other emerging contaminants that impact human health and the environment
* Providing technical assistance to small, underserved water and wastewater utilities across the country to access funding and design, build, and maintain sustainable, resilient water infrastructure systems and provide clean water to their communities
* Assessing and promoting innovative water and wastewater treatment technologies and developing resources to reduce barriers to adoption
* Evaluating the design, costs, and environmental impacts of potential water and wastewater infrastructure projects
* Overseeing project construction and ensuring compliance with Federal and State water and wastewater infrastructure grants and loans
* Supporting wastewater-based surveillance programs to facilitate Covid-19 and future public health response efforts

### **Qualifications and Skills:**

* Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Civil or Environmental Engineering or related disciplines
* Minimum GPA of 3.0 (college transcripts required)
* 0 to 5 years of experience
* Strong writing and communication skills
* Proficiency in using spreadsheets and other software programs to compile, analyze, and present data
* Strong time management skills and the ability to work on multiple projects in a dynamic work environment
* Excellent attention to detail and critical thinking, and the ability to develop quality client-ready deliverables
* Team player and motivator with the ability to foster cooperation
* Ability and interest in traveling

### **Ideal Candidates will have:**

* Understanding of water and/or wastewater treatment
* Familiarity with environmental regulations and permitting requirements.
* Technical writing experience


ERG offers competitive salaries and excellent benefits, including health and dental insurance, life insurance, long-term disability, educational benefits, FSAs, a generous 401k plan, profit sharing, an EAP, 11-20 paid vacation days per year, 10 paid holidays per year, 56 hours or more of sick leave (based on the state you work in) per year (pro-rated for part-time) and more. The salary range for all positions depends on the years and type of experience.

ERG is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable EEOC and affirmative action regulations. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. As such, successful candidates must be committed to working with diverse and inclusive teams.

Please be aware, the only authentic corporate domain for ERG is https://www.erg.com. ERG may, on occasion, screen applicants via telephone or video interviews via Skype, Teams, GoToMeeting, or another type of video platform. However, any candidate extended a job offer might be asked to meet in person with an ERG employee before providing confidential personal information associated with new employment.

If you’re a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access ERG’s online application process as a result of your disability. To request accommodation, please contact Human Resources via email at Resumes-Lex@erg.com or call (781) 674-7293.

As ERG is a friendly, flexible, inclusive environment and has clients who are committed to making the world a better place, ERGers are incredibly dedicated. We promote and recognize principles of fairness, equity, and social justice in the work we do, the partnerships we foster, and the culture we value both within and outside of our organization.

title: Project Manager/Civil or Environmental Engineer
description:
SC&A is seeking an experienced Project Manager with a civil or environmental engineering background. Candidates must be US Citizens, live in the United States, and have at least 10 years of experience with at least five years of experience managing projects with a budget of more than $5 million. The ideal candidate should have an M.S. in Civil or Environmental Engineering and have a P.E. Experience should include the planning, design, and construction oversight of lead pipe replacement and experience with emerging contaminants such as PFAS. The proposed candidate should have a demonstrated ability to effectively manage, coordinate, and communicate progress and any problems on the financial aspects of the work.


Additional Responsibilities:

* Participate in site visits, data collection, and investigations regarding environmental topics.
* Review technical/program documents and applications.
* Perform environmental calculations based on provided methodologies.
* Communicate with regulators on compliance issues
* Interact with clients
* Up to 30% travel required


Requirements

* US Citizen
* Ability to handle information confidentially


SC&A is an employee-owned company with headquarters in Arlington, VA and offices in Chapel Hill, NC and Germantown, MD. The company provides environmental and energy consulting services to the federal government, other government agencies, and commercial clients.


Our employees enjoy a work culture that promotes teamwork and a focus on client satisfaction.


SC&A benefits include medical, dental, short and long-term disability, basic personal accident insurance, access to a 529 saving plan, and basic life insurance. New full-time employees accrue a minimum of 15 days of paid time off (PTO) per year (number of days is dependent on years of experience) and the company recognizes 11 holidays. Employees are eligible for a 401K and a profit-sharing plan that typically provides an amount equal to 5% of your salary directly into your 401K account. The company benefits are effective on your first day of employment.

***SC&A does not accept third-party applications or agency inquiries. Phone calls are not accepted for any position.*** *Job descriptions are not intended as and do not create employment contracts. SC&A maintains its status as an at-will employer. Employees can be terminated for any reason not prohibited by law. Candidates are required to pass a background screening prior to employment.*

title: Project Engineer - Remote
description:
**What is the Opportunity?**


At Ovivo, we offer you the opportunity to expand your skills and professional experience while collaborating with worldwide experts in water treatment. As a Project Engineer with the PFAS Solutions team, you are responsible for managing the technical aspects of assigned projects, performing the engineering and design work required within the budget allocated to meet the requirements of customer specifications.

  

The role is based in our Salt Lake City Office and will enjoy our hybrid working model.


Expected domestic travel is 10-40%.

 **What is the role?**

* Manage the mechanical technical aspects within a multi-disciplinary team for the development and commercialization of effective and safe products for the treatment of per-and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS).
* Establish appropriate design methods, sizing, and costing programs in coordination with other engineer disciplines.
* Check calculations, models, layouts, detailed drawings, specifications, and instructions prepared by drafters/designers and other engineers.
* Ability to read and understand fabrication, erection, and standard engineering drawings.
* Communicate directly with the customer together with the project manager to resolve technical issues.
* Direct the execution of design project and provide technical support to shop and field start-up services.
* Document and update design procedures on a regular basis.
* Advises project engineers, project managers and/ or other managers on project status.
* Conducts quality control and quality assurance tests and ensures designs are compliant with the clients' technical requirements and budget(s).
* Assists in marketing business opportunities with key clients and development of responses to RFP/RFQs.
Travels to the project site to conduct project-related tasks; provides timely responses to managers and clients on project tasks  
* 

  

**Does this sound like you?**

* Bachelor's degree in Civil and Environmental, Mechanical, Industrial, Chemical or Process Engineering from an accredited university.
* 8-10+ years of engineering-related experience in water/wastewater industry.
* Professional Engineering Registration preferred (CPEng, RPEQ, or equivalent).
* Knowledge of electrical, instrumentation, SCADA, structural and architectural discipline along with working knowledge of AutoCAD.
* Ability to apply advanced mathematical equations to complex situations.

 **Don't meet every single requirement? If you carry a strong sense of ownership and teamwork in everything you do, we'd like to hear from you any way.**

 **Why work at Ovivo?**

* Medical, Dental and Vision benefits
* 401k Match
* Company paid life insurance along with company paid short and long-term disability
* 11 paid holidays
* Three weeks of PTO to start (hire date determines number of PTO hours for the first year)
* Roll over of 40 PTO hours to the following year
* Sixteen personal hours (hire date determines number of personal hours for the first year)
* Days off between Christmas Eve and New Year's Day - paid by the company with no impact to PTO balance.
* Profit sharing

  

At Ovivo we are committed to providing working environments where everyone is included and treated fairly and with respect.


Dive in - Apply Today! Let's change the future of water together.

 **About Ovivo**


Ovivo is a global provider of equipment, technology, and systems producing among the purest water and treating some of the most challenging wastewater in the industry. Ovivo is a powerful global brand with renowned trademarks, possessing more than 150 years of expertise and references in water treatment, supported by its proprietary products, advanced technologies, and extensive system integration knowhow. Ovivo delivers conventional to highly technological water treatment solutions for the industrial and municipal markets and leverages its large installed base of equipment around the world to offer parts and services to its customers. Ovivo is dedicated to innovation in an industry that is in constant evolution and offers water treatment solutions that are cost-effective, energy-efficient, and environmentally sustainable.


Visit our website to learn more about Ovivo: https://careers.ovivowater.com/

  

#LI-Hybrid

title: Fuels Engineer (Hybrid/ Remote)
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION  

Description**

The Civil and Environmental Practice seeks an enthusiastic and motivated Mechanical Engineer to join our growing and high performing Fuel System and Environmental Compliance Team based in Virginia Beach, VA. Responsibilities will include planning, executing, and documenting environmental compliance projects related to the storage and distribution of petroleum, oils, and lubricant (POL) facilities and infrastructure for a well-established client. This includes inventories, inspections and management plans for Petroleum Storage Tanks (PSTs) and related spill response and prevention activities and plans such as development of Spill Prevention Control and Countermeasures (SPCC) plans.


You will work as part of a multi-disciplinary, collaborative engineering team, with staff located in the Virginia Beach office and in other Michael Baker offices located across the United States (US). In addition, you will have several opportunities to travel across the US (including Alaska, Hawaii and territories) as well as internationally (including Europe, Asia and Africa) to various Department of Defense installations.


The successful candidate will be a motivated self-starter who displays a passion for solving complex problems for our clients, interacting in a team environment, and meeting established project requirements. Michael Baker is committed to the growth of our internal personnel and we support this with world class learning and development. Within the Fuel System and Environmental Compliance Team, the candidate will be mentored by seasoned project and program managers and have opportunities for career advancement. In addition, the successful candidate will have the personal satisfaction of completing activities to protect the environment we live in for our clients while protecting our military mission. As a company, We Make a Difference.


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

* Supports a Project Team of engineers in planning, executing, and documenting environmental engineering projects.
* Prepares complex engineering studies supporting environmental engineering, planning, compliance, site evaluations, and corrective actions; prepares corrective action designs and specifications.
* Manages multiple complex technical projects as the primary task manager.
* Evaluates and develops technical scopes of work and cost estimates for unique project requirements.
* Evaluates the applicability of state and federal environmental regulations.
* Prepares documents for regulatory agencies to obtain required permits.
* Communicates with Project Team on technical and administrative requirements.
* Schedules and attends internal meetings as necessary and documents key decisions and action items.
* Prepares for site visits by evaluating project scopes of work and coordinating site work activities with onsite personnel and vendors.
* Completes site visits by traveling to sites to meet with clients and initiate, oversee, document, and troubleshoot the execution of environmental compliance work.
* Following site visits evaluates vendor reports of site work and prepare technical reports documenting the project scopes of work.
* Completes project technical requirements within established budgets and schedules.
* Performs quality assurance activities.
* Completes continuing education and training to maintain professional expertise and credentials.

**PROFESSIONAL REQUIREMENTS**

* Bachelor of Science in Mechanical/ Civil Engineering or equivalent.
* 4 - 8 years of increasingly responsible engineering experience.
* Professional Engineer (P.E.) license required, or ability to obtain within 6-months.
* Experience in Department of Defense civil and environmental engineering and/or environmental compliance is REQUIRED, including bulk fuel storage and delivery system design or military service station fuel system design and construction as well as development of SPCC plans.
* Certification in tank and/or piping inspection (such as STI SP001/API 653/API 570) is also REQUIRED.
* Excellent technical writing and communications skills. Excellent skills in Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe Acrobat. Proficient skills in AutoCAD will also be considered.
* Site visits may require the ability to traverse uneven terrain wearing PPE(Personal Protection Equipment) and carrying light equipment necessary for data collection and reporting.
* Travel is required for this position and the individual must be legally authorized to work in the U.S., with a valid U.S. passport and eligible for security clearance. Travel requirements for this position are between 25-50% of the work schedule and include domestic destination and international destinations.

**COMPENSATION**

The approximate compensation range for this position is $94,000-$141,000. This compensation range is a good faith estimate for the position at the time of posting. Actual compensation is dependent upon factors such as education, qualifications, experience, skillset, and physical work location.


  
ABOUT US  

Michael Baker International, a leading provider of engineering and consulting services, including design, planning, architectural, environmental, construction and program management, has been solving some of the world’s most complex infrastructure challenges for more than 80 years with a legacy of expertise, experience, innovation and integrity.
  

  

Based in Pittsburgh and with nearly 100 offices nationwide, we partner with clients on everything from roads, bridges, tunnels, mass transit, and airports, to water treatment plants, arctic oil pipelines, environmental restoration and specialized overseas construction. We serve as a trusted adviser to the communities we serve, making them safer, more accessible, more sustainable and more prosperous.
  

  

We provide visionary leadership in facilitating transformational change for our clients. Our work delivers differentiating innovations and dedicated experts who challenge the status quo and share a world of diverse experience and an impassioned entrepreneurial spirit. We deliver quality of life.
  

  

We Make a Difference.
  

  

Michael Baker International is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. Michael Baker International provides equal employment opportunity for all persons, in all facets of employment. Michael Baker International maintains a drug-free workplace and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing and background checks. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply for any open position for which they feel they are qualified and all will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status or any other legally protected status.

title: Lead Engineer – Nuclear Plant Thermal-Hydraulic Analysis (Remote Eligible, U.S)
description:
**Job Description Summary**
===========================


This role contributes to company objectives in the fields of reactor nuclear thermal-hydraulic analysis and methods. This role is intended for a rapidly developing subject matter expert in the areas core and plant thermal-hydraulic analysis, specifically the methodology behind and analysis of hydrodynamic loads and moisture carryover prediction/evaluation. It integrates and develops thermal-hydraulic technologies, application methodologies, and supporting processes that meet business needs across the organization. This includes software development, documentation and validation, user training, and customer interfacing.  

  

This role is within the Thermal & Fluids Analysis team, which is responsible for the development, maintenance, and technical consultation of thermal-hydraulic engineering computer codes, correlations, and methodologies related to Boiling Water Reactor (BWR), Pressurized Water Reactors (PWR), and advanced/fast reactors and their fuel.**Job Description**
===================

**Essential Responsibilities**

* Responsible for leading the technical development, accuracy and uncertainty qualification, testing, verification, regulatory licensing, and maintenance of analytical methods required for evaluation of steady-state and transient core/fuel performance of nuclear reactors.
* Work within an approved regulatory framework for nuclear software quality assurance for engineering computer programs.
* Prepare, document and present technical data to internal and external customers.
* Contribute to and lead team process improvements to drive speed and simplification.
* Communicate with internal/external users of the methods through support, documentation, and training.
* Ensure work is performed with high quality in accordance with NRC rules and regulations, customer requirements, and business quality assurance standards.
* Drive a team culture based on team work, integrity, candor, transparency, and execution on commitments.
* Effectively communicate and coordinate activities with other team members on engineering/technical issues.
* Assist and provide support to the team technical leader and functional manager to plan, status and execute projects.
* Support teams working in various time zones globally.
* Support the interface with various regulatory agencies (NRC, DOE, etc.) as appropriate.
* Honest and straightforward with a high level of personal integrity.
* Detail oriented and accountable for results.
* Strong interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to work in a team.
* Displays a strong drive for continuous improvement.
* Displays an engaging, can-do, optimistic attitude.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Strong analytical capabilities, problem solving skills, and process skills.

**Required Qualifications**

* M.S. degree from an accredited university or college in nuclear engineering, physics, mathematics, or a closely related technical discipline
* Four or more years of cumulative, relevant engineering experience

**Eligibility Requirements**

* The preferred work location for this role is at the GEH Headquarters in Wilmington, NC; but highly qualified **(US based)** remote candidates will be considered.
* Comfortable with less than 10% travel

**Desired Characteristics**

* Ph.D. in computational methods, thermal-hydraulics, nuclear engineering, or a closely related discipline.
* Prior experience with thermal-hydraulic methods (GOTHIC, TRACG, COBRAG, ISCOR, etc.)
* Prior experience with computational fluid dynamics (CFD) using ANSYS-Fluent or similar.
* Experience with software Commercial Grade Dedication in accordance with NQA-1.
* Programming experience with Fortran, C#, and Python.
* Working knowledge of nuclear reactor core licensing, technical specifications, safety margin bases, code methodology licensing, and related federal regulations.
* Publication of technical articles and/or patent applications.
* Demonstrated ability to make decisions with speed and accuracy based on the best available information.
* Exceptional organization skills.
* Legacy of delivering on commitments; tenacious, with a proven track record of overcoming obstacles; ability to achieve stretch targets.
* Strong external focus; clear and demonstrated understanding of nuclear industry and/or energy industry.
* Six Sigma Green Belt, Black Belt, or equivalent quality certification.


The salary range for this position is $86k - 122k. The specific salary offered to a candidate may be influenced by a variety of factors including the candidate’s experience, their education, and the work location. In addition, this position is eligible for a performance bonus.


Available health and welfare benefits include healthcare, prescription drug, dental, and vision coverage; savings account options (such as a Health Care Flexible Savings Account, Health Reimbursement Account, Limited Purpose Flexible Spending Account, and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account); and an employee assistance program. Additional benefits include a defined contribution 401(k) plan, employee life insurance, optional dependent life insurance, employee accidental death or dismemberment insurance coverage, salary continuance program benefits for disability, optional long-term disability, pre-tax transportation/commuter program, paid holidays, paid time off, parental leave, a layoff plan for salaried employees, tuition reimbursement program, use of Cariloop, adoption assistance, optional identity theft prevention insurance, optional personal legal assistance, and optional personal excess liability insurance.


#LI-DY1 #LI-Remote

*This role requires access to U.S. export-controlled information. If applicable, final offers will be contingent on ability to obtain authorization for access to U.S. export-controlled information from the U.S. Government.*

**Additional Information**
==========================


GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

title: Environmental Chemist
description:
**Quala** is North America’s largest independent network of tank cleaning, maintenance, and industrial services offering comprehensive inspections, testing, and repairs for the chemical, food, and transportation industries. We service a variety of bulk containers, including: Tank Trailers, IBC/ Totes containers, ISO containers, Railcars, Roll-off containers, and FRAC Tanks.


The Chemist will be responsible for evaluating and ensuring compliance with all federal, state, and local EHS regulations, laws and ordinances and will be responsible for assisting all locations nationwide.


**This position may be based out of one of these locations: Tampa, FL, Chattanooga, TN or Houston, TX** **with the possibility of working remote once comfortable in the role. Training will take place in Houston, TX for 1-2 weeks.**


**Salary range $55,000 - $65,000 per year based on experience.**


**Position Responsibilities**


* Conduct regulatory research, prepare technical interpretations, and make recommendations based on Quala's operations and activities.
* Evaluate Safety Data Sheets (SDS) and Technical Data Sheets (TDS) for regulatory compliance and add into OpenBravo as needed.
* Prepare cleaning and heating procedures for new materials using the SDS and/or TDS.
* Prepare annual reports including State Air, TIER II, Hazardous Waste, and Wastewater reports.
* Apply EHS regulations and prepare clear, direct operating procedures and work instructions as they apply to our operations and activities.
* Provide technical assistance and consultation to facilities for compliance with Federal, State, and Local environmental laws, regulations and ordinances.
* Monitor Waste Tracking to include EPA Hazardous Waste Determinations, Waste Tracking in OpenBravo (OB), tracking 90-day Waste Storage limits and processing out drums from OB.
* Travel to 1-2 branches per quarter.


**Minimum Qualifications**


* Bachelor’s degree in chemistry, chemical engineering, environmental science, environmental engineering, or a related field.
* 1-3 years of relevant experience in industrial environments, consulting, or a government regulatory agency.
* Familiarity with federal and state EHS regulations and experience preparing technical interpretations.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal and analytical skills, and strong writing capabilities, especially with writing clear, concise procedures and working instructions.
* Strong MS Office computer skills required.
* Ability to multi-task and maintain flexibility. Also, work independently with minimal supervision.


**Quala Benefits**


* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
* 401k with generous employer match
* PTO
* Paid Holidays
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Parental Leave

title: Senior Water Engineer
description:
Parametrix, a 100% employee-owned AEC company, is committed to outstanding project work for our Community Building, Environmental, Transportation and Water clients in our local communities.


Parametrix is committed to sustainable water solutions. As a leader in the water industry, we strive to address water challenges through leading-edge technologies and environmentally friendly practices. We are seeking a dedicated water professional to join our team as a **SENIOR WATER ENGINEER** and contribute to the overall success of the organization.


This position joins us in Arizona, where we have an established client base with local municipalities, water purveyors and utilities and tribes. This position will work remotely from your home and travel occasionally for client connection, team integration and to connect with our broader water team in support of the water division’s key initiatives.

**Focus of the Position**

**You are an experienced water engineer who can provide:**


Water Waste/Water Designs: Support the design process, including the creation of plans, drawings, and specifications for water infrastructure projects.


Client Interface: Collaborate with clients to understand their needs, provide updates on project progress, and address any concerns or issues that may arise during the design phase.


Collaboration: Connect with other Parametrix engineers and designers in the development and execution of water-related projects. This may include assigning tasks, providing guidance, and meeting project deadlines.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in civil or environmental engineering or a related field.
* Professional Engineering License in Arizona or ability to obtain.
* 6+ years of progressive water/wastewater planning, design, and construction experience.
* Strong understanding of design software tools for the water industry, including Revit and Civil 3D.
* Strategic problem solver and strong communicator.

 **What we offer:**

**Fun, Friendly and Innovative Professional Team:** A technically diverse and dedicated team of 750 employee-owners who are engaged and committed to their clients and communities.

**Employee Ownership and Competitive Compensation/Generous Benefits:** We are 100% Employee-Owned, where 100% of employees are equitably awarded share, in direct proportion to salary. Parametrix offers competitive market compensation. We have a well-rounded benefits package which includes medical/dental/vision insurance, generous vacation/sick/wellness leave accruals, Employee Stock Ownership (financial profit sharing), and an employee-owned culture which values diversity, equity, and inclusion.

**Base salary for this position is in the range of $110,000-140,000+**. Compensation will be determined based on education, experience, location, and role. For all positions we conduct an equity review. Employee-owners are all eligible for performance-based bonuses based on key contributions. Salaries are reviewed at least once annually as part of our compensation program. We are transparent in our salary discussions and look forward to sharing more about our compensation structure and the value of being an employee-owner.

**Work/Life Balance and Flexibility and an Inclusive Culture**


To find out more and apply, please visit www.parametrix.com


www.parametrix.com


PARAMETRIX


Let's create tomorrow, together


Inclusion is a core value of Parametrix, and we are committed to a diverse workforce. It is our company policy and culture to provide equal opportunity to all persons based on ability and fitness to perform job duties regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status and all other characteristics protected by law.

title: Civil (Water Resources/ Land Development)/ Environmental Engineer
description:
**Civil/Design Engineering Consulting firm is seeking an 1- 5 year experienced Civil (Land development and water resources) or Environmental Engineer to support our operation based in the Dover, DE area.** 

Civil/Design Engineering Consulting firm is seeking a Civil Engineer to assist in growing their operation based in Dover, DE. Experience in land development design and permitting is considered a plus. Candidates will be expected to prepare design and permitting packages to support land development and wastewater activities in DE and surrounding states. Ideal candidates will have a B.S. in Civil, Environmental Engineering or Engineering Technology and licensure (or are on track to securing licensure in six months). While not required, knowledge of supporting software packages (e.g., AutoCAD/Civil 3D, HydroCAD, PondPack, StormCAD, Hydraflow Storm Sewers, etc.) is considered a plus. Candidates may work remotely from a three-hour radius of our office in Dover, DE.

Candidate will be expected to prepare existing site surveys and exhibits that document, evaluate, and recommend solutions for civil engineering projects; Prepare presentation documents for use in client meetings and public hearings; Prepare detailed construction drawings and specifications; Provide third party reviews of plans and specifications; Provide contract administration services during construction to ensure compliance with plans and specifications; Prepare engineering computations and design reports; Perform related duties as assigned or required to meet company goals and objectives.

Candidate should be a critical thinker, be willing to learn through trial and error, be self-motivated and willing to put forth the full effort towards the task at hand. Candidate should have a strong desire to grow and advance as an engineer on path toward licensure. Candidate should be a detail-oriented person who takes pride in their work.

Salary is commensurate of experience. **The firm offers a competitive wage and benefit package including 401k.**

title: Sr. Principal Engineer - Environmental Regulatory Affairs
description:
**Job Purpose**  

By creating, maintaining and analyzing complex regulatory compliance models, the Senior Engineer, Environmental Regulatory Affairs uses specialized, expert knowledge to provide strategic guidance to AH leaders and executives to inform and influence decisions on future environmental compliance strategies.  


**Key Accountabilities**
* Modeling: develop and maintain key regulatory compliance models, and expand model capabilities as necessary
* Modeling: simulate business impacts from rulemaking at the Federal level for Greenhouse Gas (GHG), Corporate Average Fuel Economy (CAFE) and criteria emissions (NMOG+NOx)
* Modeling: simulate business impacts from rulemaking at the state level for Zero Emission Vehicles (ZEV) and Greenhouse Gas (GHG) rulemaking
* Strategic analysis: review sales plan to ensure emissions compliance and suggest innovative and alternative strategies to remain in compliance
* Strategic analysis: utilize specialized understanding of future federal and state regulatory direction and Honda product portfolio to influence long-range strategic planning, including support for internal environmental strategy communication to executives, R&D, Sales & Production Planning, Auto Strategy, and Product Planning
* Credit management: ensure credit margin is maintained while suggesting strategies to maximize credit sales and minimize credit purchases
* Credit management: create, maintain, and update credit models (ZEV, GHG, CAFE and NMOG+NOx), and expand model capabilities as necessary

  


**Qualifications, Experience & Skills**  


**Education**
* B.S. Degree in Engineering or related discipline

  


**Minimum Experience**
* Robust and specialized understanding of the automotive environment- and energy-related regulations, including GHG, CAFE, ZEV (ACC I and ACC II), and criteria emissions programs
* Robust and specialized understanding of how regulations and laws are created, developed, approved and implemented
* Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel, including the ability to design, develop, and maintain sophisticated, interactive spreadsheet models with a high level of accuracy and significant attention to detail
* Minimum 10 years of relevant work experience
* Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook)

  


**Other Job-Specific Skills**
* Strategic mindset in applying expert knowledge toward credit optimization and fleet compliance (reducing cost, maintaining compliance with margin)
* Strong ability to distill and graphically communicate complex analytical findings
* Ability to clearly and effectively propose and communicate new concepts to executives for evaluation
* Ability to develop concise and easily understood PowerPoint presentations
* Ability to create and update models in Excel to reflect the regulatory landscape
* Familiarity with automotive fuel efficiency, emissions control, and vehicle electrification technologies
* Understanding of the automotive industry, including vehicle electrification markets and products
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Knowledge of Honda products is a plus

  


**Key Performance Indicators**
* Quarterly review of sales plan to ensure compliance (including BIM) with timely and effective communication to cross-functional teams, management, and executives
* Ad hoc - Internal correlation with R&D, NAAS, Seihan, Finance, Sales & Production Planning, and Product Planning as needed to ensure accurate, up-to-date analyses
* Maintain adequate credit margin (minimize credit purchase, maximize credit sales opportunities for ZEV, GHG, CAFE and criteria emissions credits)

  


*Honda is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor.*

title: Fuels Associate Engineer I - (Hybrid/Remote)

This includes inventories, inspections and management plans for Petroleum Storage Tanks (PSTs) and related spill response and prevention activities and plans such as development of Spill Prevention Control and Countermeasures (SPCC) plans.

description:

title: Environmental Project Engineer
description:
**Position:** Project Engineer  

**Location:** Pleasant Hill, CA  

  

At Apex Companies, we're on a mission to grow and expand in the environmental consulting and engineering industry. We're seeking highly motivated individuals with a strong work ethic to join our dynamic team. If you're eager to grow professionally and want to work with a company that invests in your development, Apex may be the perfect fit for you.  

  

**Why Apex?**  

We're not just any environmental consulting firm – we're a passionate force dedicated to excellence. With record-breaking sales, an impressive client retention rate, strategic acquisitions, and an unwavering commitment to our mission, Apex is among the fastest-growing firms in the US environmental sector. Our dedication to excellence has earned us numerous awards for project success, and we're poised for even greater growth. Join us and grow along with the best in the industry.  

  

**Your Responsibilities as a Project Engineer:**

* Conduct and manage environmental investigations, soil and groundwater remediation, soil gas and indoor air evaluations, etc., for a variety of clients with complex technical and regulatory issues
* Meet with clients and regulatory agencies, including the US Environmental Protection Agency, the Department of Toxic and Substances Control, the Regional Water Quality Control Board and local Environmental Health agencies.
* Write and review remedial documents and reports such as feasibility studies, remedial and/or corrective action plans, remedial design documents, remedial progress and completion reports, etc.
* Design and negotiate remedial solutions for contaminated soil and ground water
* Coordinate the investigation of field work for client projects including scheduling and oversight of utility locating, excavation, and drilling firms
* Meet or exceed client’s scope, budget, and schedule expectations
* Evaluate sample results and develop tables and figures for technical reports
* Write and review proposals
* Mentor, train, and oversee scientific staff and ensure quality work product
* Ensure project work is completed safely while maintaining quality and integrity of work and data
* Actively develop your own career growth

  

**Why you'll love working for us:*** Flexible work-arrangement
* Company-subsidized medical and dental.
* Company-paid life, short, and long-term disability.
* Paid Time Off and Holidays.
* 401k match, tuition assistance, and more.
* Cross-training and the ability to work on a variety of projects.
* Performance-based bonuses or other incentives.
* Working with the best and brightest in the industry.
* 1,000+ employee national firm with 50+ locations across the US.

title: Environmental Advisor
description:
Requisition ID: 22598
Location:
Houston, US, 77056 Westminster, US, 80021 Remote, US, 032794 - B
As our Environmental Advisor, based in Houston, TX, Westminster, CO, or remotely within the Renewables department, you will be instrumental in navigating the complex landscape of environmental permitting and land use entitlement for renewable energy projects across the US and Canada. Your journey with us will span from the initial greenfield due diligence right through to the commencement of construction, embodying a commitment to environmental stewardship and compliance. Each day, you will lead the charge in safeguarding our projects’ alignment with environmental regulations and standards, engaging in detailed planning, execution, and monitoring of permitting processes.

  


Reporting to the Environmental Director, your role is critical in weaving the fabric of our environmental strategy, ensuring that it integrates seamlessly with our broader mission for sustainable energy development. By managing projects schedules, budgets, and consultant partnerships, you will not only influence the success of our renewable projects but also assist in maintaining compliance during their construction and operational phases. Your expertise will also extend to representing ENGIE in regulatory meetings and public forums, advocating for environmental excellence and sustainable practices within the industry.

  


* Lead and manage the environmental permitting, entitlement, and compliance requirements for wind, solar and battery storage projects
* Develop and manage project schedules and budgets as part of the development process
* Responsible for the entire process of scoping, contracting, and managing consultants for permitting, as well as environmental and regulatory services, ensuring comprehensive management and coordination
* Oversee the implementation of environmental surveys including, but not limited to: biological and vegetation resources, wetland and stream delineations, cultural resources, and Phase I Environmental Site Assessments
* Maintain files of all environmental approvals, environmental documentation sent to regulatory authorities, audit reports, and other key environmental compliance data
* Assist with the environmental audit program of renewable facilities and provide training on pertinent environmental legislation, rules, and practices to employees.
* Ensure compliance with all applicable environmental and permitting requirements for renewable projects during construction and operational phases
* Provide support for project origination submittals, power purchase agreements and project sale and acquisition processes and associated due diligence efforts
* Represent the company in meetings with regulators, and provide subject matter expertise in various public forums, including public hearings, landowner meetings, and industry association events
* Assist in developing environmental reporting documentation as requested by the headquarters office in Parris, France

  


**What You’ll Bring**


* Bachelor’s degree in Natural Resources, Environmental Sciences, Environmental Engineering, Environmental Policy, or a similar area of concentration
* Minimum of seven (7) years of renewable energy permitting and compliance experience or similar experience within the energy or environmental industries
* Experience working with US and Canadian Federal, State/Provincial, and local government laws and policies related to aquatic and terrestrial environments and land use entitlements for renewable energy development
* Familiarity with the Endangered Species Act, Clean Water Act, National Historic Preservation Act, and the National Environment Policy Act, and strategies for compliance
* Strong project management skills, with the capability to organize and manage multiple projects, processes, and tasks simultaneously
* Superior communication skills, both verbal and written, and the ability to engage effectively with internal and external stakeholders
* Prior involvement in projects in WECC/CASIO, on federal lands or with the Bureau of Land Management (BLM) is a plus

  




**Additional Details**


* This position is based in Houston, TX or our Westminster, CO offices; eligible for remote opportunities if the candidate resides within 2 hours of a major airport
* Must be available to travel domestically / internationally up to 20% of the time and with the need for some overnight trips
* Must possess a valid U.S. driver’s license/clean driving record
* Must be willing and able to comply with ENGIE’s policy with respect to COVID vaccination and testing
* Must be willing and able to comply with all ENGIE ethics and safety policies

  




**Compensation**


**Salary Range:** $96,100 – $147,660 USD annually

  

In addition to base pay, this position is eligible for a competitive bonus / incentive plan.

  


Your Talent Acquisition Partner can share more specific information regarding the benefits or the salary for the position based on the work location

  


At ENGIE, we take your well-being seriously. Our comprehensive benefits package includes options for medical, dental, vision, life insurance, employer-paid short-term and long-term disability insurance, ESPP, generous paid time off including wellness days, holidays and leave programs. We also help you plan for retirement by offering a 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan with a company match. But that's not all – we're dedicated to the health and happiness of your entire family, offering supplemental benefits for full time employees that enhance emotional and physical well-being through all stages of life from family forming to caregiver benefits. Explore our benefits package to see how we can support you. Learn more.

  


**Why ENGIE?**


ENGIE North America isn’t just participating in the Zero-Carbon Transition, we’re leading it! Join us as we develop energy that is renewable, efficient, and accessible to everyone.

  

At ENGIE, our goal is to support, promote, and thrive on diversity, equity, and inclusion. We do so for the benefit of our employees, customers, products and services, and community. ENGIE is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace, and we are firmly committed to creating an equitable and inclusive environment for all employees.

  

We are committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected status.

  

If you need assistance with this application or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at ENGIENA-ENGIEHR@engie.com. This email address is reserved for individuals with disabilities in need of assistance and is not a means of inquiry regarding positions or application status.

  

We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment visa for this role at any time.

  


The safety of our employees is our number one priority. All employees at ENGIE have both a duty and the authority to STOP WORK if unsafe acts are observed.

title: Environmental Compliance Manager
description:
HORNE is a professional services firm founded on a cornerstone of public accounting. As a top 25 business advisory firm, our 2,000+ team members serve clients from offices and project locations across the nation and Puerto Rico. Our Government Services practice is at the forefront of economic recovery programs nationwide with one of the most experienced and innovative teams anywhere. Our team provides program and project management, compliance, grant management, subject matter expertise and disaster recovery solutions needed to help government agencies affect positive change.

HORNE's Government Services focus area is searching for a qualified Environmental Compliance Manager to assist with the implementation of environmental projects associated with federal grants and programs related to disaster recovery, specifically for Environmental Review Records and evaluations for funding for a HUD CDBG Program. The position is for an energetic person who will be working on multiple projects simultaneously.

**How you impact HORNE and our clients…**

* Work in a team setting that implements strategies, processes, and solutions.
* Support in preparing, reviewing and managing environmental studies and documentation under the National Environmental Policy Act and HUD environmental procedures for the Community Development Block Grant Disaster Recovery projects (DR & MI).
* Research and identify possible environmental concerns and recommend mitigation measures.
* Prepare and/or review technical correspondence, technical reports, work plans, and project specifications.
* Discuss and advise with internal senior scientist and principals on environmental issues and permitting issues.
* Communicate effectively and work with regulators and other stakeholders with or on behalf of the client to further project delivery and success.
* Responsible for working within the provisions, regulations, and guidelines for best quality assurance.

**HORNE is looking for…**

**Supervisor/Senior Manager level:**

* A bachelor’s degree in one of the environmental sciences (Biology, Geology, Environmental, Earth Sciences, Coastal, Wetlands Biologist) or environmental engineering.
* 10+ years’ relevant work experience (master’s degree counts as 1 year of experience).
* Experience preparing NEPA compliant Environmental Impact Statements, Environmental Assessments and Categorical Exclusions.
* Working knowledge of CDBG or similar federally funded program(s).
* Experience coordinating with regulatory agencies, stakeholders and subrecipients.
* Fundamental understanding of procedural requirements including consultation, permitting, public engagement, and compliance monitoring.
* Experience drafting policies and procedures, public notices, memorandums of understanding/agreement and other environmental documentation.
* Experience in disaster recovery or emergency management setting is preferred.
* Proficiency with MS Office, Adobe Pro, virtual meeting services and similar software programs.
* GIS and data management/system of record experience is a plus.
* Ability to analyze environmental documents, recommend courses of action to solve problems, meet client needs, expectations, and shifting priorities/timelines.
* Ability to perform duties accurately and independently and to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
* Effective written and oral communication skills.
* Problem-solving and results-driven.

**HORNE Values…**

* A forward thinking, anticipatory professional driven by a passion to pursue your full potential and dreams.
* A work environment that promotes collaboration, consistency, and community service to empower people.
* An inclusive culture that promotes career/life integration and invests in developing people in areas of focused expertise.

**HORNE Offers…**

* An unrivaled distinctive, special culture that values collaboration, innovation, and positive energy which HORNE calls “Deliver with Care.”
* A team of professionals grounded in strong, personal relationships and a sense of belonging to a common purpose for adding value and making a difference.
* A dedicated team of individuals from diverse backgrounds working together to leave our clients better than we found them.
* “Fearless Unrivaled Flexibility” – It’s about results, not the hours you work.

The firm you’ll be joining is a decidedly different business advisory firm. HORNE goes beyond traditional accounting to collaborate, advise, and align with clients to transform rapid change and uncertainties into opportunities for growth and profitability.

We are a team that focuses on reaching our full potential, rewards high performance, and prioritizes leadership development for every team member. HORNE emphasizes health and personal development through our multiple wellness programs, and we pride ourselves on offering "unrivaled flexibility". Despite our size, HORNE takes time to recognize, support, and celebrate one another's successes, working together for the highest good. Come join us at team HORNE!

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)
