description:
**What we are looking for**


We are seeking a Project Engineer or above interested in SCS’s Sustainable Materials Management (SMM) practice area. Our SMM practice involves studies and designs relating to related solid waste management transfer and processing facilities and operations. You should embrace teamwork, be experienced in consulting engineering, and have the desire to grow professionally. The location of the position is flexible but must be near an existing SCS office and be hybrid. You will work on a broad range of projects that require office and fieldwork.


**How you can make an impact**


* Coordinate with clients, regulators, contractors, and subcontractors
* Assist with business development activities that include meeting with clients and potential clients, preparing proposals, attending conferences, etc.
* Apply knowledge of engineering and scientific principles and practices in solid waste and SMM projects. Project examples include includes recyclables and mixed waste processing, transfer stations, anaerobic digester and compost facilities, permitting, and construction. Prepare engineering calculations, drawings, reports, and permit applications.
* Make independent decisions on engineering or scientific problems and methods.
* Complete office-based tasks, including: Report writing, creating site plans and facility diagrams, preparing permit applications, engineering plans and specifications, engineering and financial analyses, completing bid letting documents, etc.
* Assist in training and mentoring junior staff.


**Qualifications**


* Bachelor’s degree in Civil, Mechanical or Environmental Engineering required.
* Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in the fields of Civil Engineering, Mechanical, or Environmental Engineering required. Experience in the solid waste industry, particularly in the SMM practice area preferred, but not required.
* Professional Engineering license required.
* Valid driver’s license with a driving record in good standing required.

title: Environmental Engineer
description:
Does this position interest you? You should apply – even if you don’t match every single requirement! We're known as an auto glass company. That's the focus of what we do. But beyond the glass, we're so much more. We'll help you build a fulfilling career and encourage you to have a life. Let us be the best place you'll ever work.
Does this position interest you? You should apply – even if you don’t match every single requirement! We're known as an auto glass company. That's the focus of what we do. But beyond the glass, we're so much more. We'll help you build a fulfilling career and encourage you to have a life. Let us be the best place you'll ever work.
A Brief Overview  

Safelite Auto Glass is hiring an Environmental Engineer to oversee environmental strategies, action plans, and policies. The role includes ensuring environmental law compliance, managing RCRA and Hazardous Materials processes, and reporting on environmental performance. The engineer will also perform impact assessments to minimize environmental risks and collaborate with different business units to establish eco-friendly operations and training procedures. Candidates should have at least five years of experience in environmental engineering or management, including familiarity with environmental regulations across various states. Leadership skills and the ability to drive change are essential. The engineer will assist in identifying and evaluating environmental impacts from technology or policy decisions, estimate and evaluate environmental consequences of programs, and report findings on environmental consequences policies and technologies. They should be able to research and understand environmental requirements, perform technical and mathematical analyses, and work directly with customer safety officers and facility management. Familiarity with OSHA and EPA safety requirements is expected.
What you will do* Develop and implement environmental training strategies and action plans, to ensure compliance and environmental stewardship.
* Coordinate all aspects of RCRA, Hazardous and Regulated wastes, processes and reporting.
* Identify Air Emissions, Stormwater, SWPP and NPDES applicability across US locations.
* Implement auditing and inspection processes to ensure environmental compliance with federal and state legislation.
* Develop leading and lagging KPIs to analyze environmental compliance, spend trends and opportunities to reduce environmental footprint for internal and external clients; and any legally required regulatory bodies.
* Carry out impact assessments to identify, assess and reduce an organization’s environmental risks.
* Performs other duties as assigned
* Complies with all policies and standards


Education Qualifications* Bachelor's Degree: A bachelor’s degree in an environmentally related discipline such as environmental management, project management, natural resource management, environmental engineering, environmental policy or a related field. Required


Experience Qualifications* 4-6 years Experience directly related to environmental engineering or management.


Skills and Abilities* Ensure operations are environmentally friendly and compliant.
* Work with multiple functions throughout the business to create processes and trainings.
* Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
* Environmental certifications are a benefit.


Our people are passionate about what they do, the product they sell, and the customers they serve. If you're looking for an opportunity to be a part of a work family that values collaboration, innovation and dedication, we're the right company for you.

title: Beverage/Water Quality Engineer II - 100% Remote
description:
At Niagara, we’re looking for Team Members who want to be part of achieving our mission to provide our customers the highest quality most affordable bottled water.


Consider applying here, if you want to:

* Work in an entrepreneurial and dynamic environment with a chance to make an impact.
* Develop lasting relationships with great people.
* Have the opportunity to build a satisfying career.


We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages for our Team Members.


Beverage/Water Quality Engineer II - 100% Remote
The Quality Engineer II will be responsible for the Beverage Quality, Water Quality, and Sanitation Quality Systems. The Quality Engineer will create and maintain Quality Assurance (QA) standard operating procedures, work with management representatives at all manufacturing plants, communicate quality system changes, create training work instructions, and collaborate closely with plant teams and department managers to ensure the system supports overall company goals.

**Essential Functions**

* Quality Process Improvement – Performs quality focused engineering duties in the development and application of quality tools, methods, and systems that result in continual product quality improvements. Participates in the Quality Assurance functions within the manufacturing division by assisting in developing, implementing and administering quality specifications, test methodologies, and sampling plans for product and process.
* Project Work – Works with various Quality and Manufacturing representatives on developing and completing project requests to improve quality throughout the Niagara network.
* Data Collection and Analysis – Collects, analyzes, and presents Quality data for trending and for the development of Quality Performance Indicators. Applies statistical process control (SPC) methods for analyzing data to evaluate the current process and process changes. Develops new approaches to solve problems identified during quality assurance activities.
* Communication – Communicates significant issues or developments identified during quality assurance activities and provide recommended process improvements to management.
* CI and Lean - Drives lean manufacturing and continuous improvement principles throughout the organization using value stream mapping and other lean tools.
* Training – Participates in and conducts ongoing training in the areas of Quality Assurance, lean manufacturing and Six Sigma. Assists in new plant start-ups, new line installs, performing training and standardization for new QA teams.
* Lead beverage project rollouts, this could include new beverage scale-ups, rollouts or implementations. Identify and resolve any outstanding engineering problems associated with running a new beverage product. Create new beverage specification documents to detail how new products should be produced/processed in order to ensure appropriate quality levels throughout production.
* Lean Six Sigma (LSS) Projects – Ability to lead LSS projects across multiple plants and departments. Understand LSS methodologies to drive continuous efforts to improve process efficiencies and reduce waste. A focus on achieving measureable and quantifiable financial returns for the company.
* New Plant Start-ups – This position will participate extensively with New Plant Start-ups. They will be an on-site resource for these start-ups providing training, and expertise to the plant staff. This will also include new line start-ups where necessary.
* **Travel**
	+ **50% - on average travels 2 weeks out of the month**

* *Please note this job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive list of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without prior notice.*

**Qualifications**

* Minimum Qualifications:
	+ 2 Years – Experience in Quality Engineering
	+ 2 Years – Experience in Plant Level QA


***\\*experience may include a combination of work experience and education***

* Travel
	+ **50% - on average travels 2 weeks out of the month**

* Preferred Qualifications:
	+ 4 Years – Experience in Quality Engineering
	+ 4 Years – Experience in SQL, ODBC, and PLC Programming
	+ 2 Years – Experience in Plant Quality Manager
	+ 2 Years – Experience in Beverage Quality
* ***experience may include a combination of work experience and education***

**Competencies**


Proficiency in, but not limited to:

* Experience and knowledge of Lean Manufacturing and Six Sigma methodology principles.
* Experience with statistical process control software.
* Experience in manufacturing plants and knowledge of plant processes.
* Demonstrated skill with information systems and technology trends.
* Ability to communicate effectively with different levels of personal.
* Ability to lead projects to completion and work effectively without direct supervision
* Familiarity with the following:
	+ Reverse Osmosis
	+ Beverage Batching Operations
	+ Beverage CIP and Sanitation Operations
	+ Bottle Water Production
	+ PET Blow molding
	+ Plastic Injection
	+ General Microbiology Practices
	+ Chemical Analysis Techniques

**Education**

* Minimum Required:
	+ Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Food Science, Chemistry or Science related field
* Preferred:
	+ Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (Chemical), Food Science or Science related field

title: Water Resources Engineer
description:
Founded in 1993 and headquartered in McLean, VA, Solv is a small business that supports the mission of government clients by providing sustainable solutions based on sound engineering, science, economic, and management principles. Solv has an immediate need for a **Water Resources Engineer** to provide full-time support and project management for water resources engineering planning/design review, environmental assessment, watershed planning and other environmental and resilience efforts of federal clients in the Washington, DC metropolitan area and other locations nationwide.

Candidates should have 5+ years of experience aligning with several of the following areas of expertise:

· Licensed Professional Engineer in at least one state;

· Experience in planning and/or design of water resources projects including hydrologic and hydraulic modeling, flood elevation/profile determinations, sizing, and proportioning of dams and spillway systems, levees (dikes), and floodplain management including experience with the National Flood Insurance (NFIP) regulations **OR** experience in planning and/or design of irrigation projects.

· Familiarity with National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA) environmental assessments (EAs) and environmental impact statements (EISs);

· Developing interdisciplinary watershed plans and planning reports;

· Technical expertise in one or more of the following laws or programs: NEPA, Clean Water Act (CWA); National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP); or other related laws;

· Providing technical advice and training for water resources engineering, design, and/or planning;

· Understanding economic investigations and reports within environmental planning documents;

· Reviewing engineering assessments; assuring quality of technical reviews; and attention to detail of project deliverables; and

· Coordinating the planning or technical review of water supply, flood damage reduction, agricultural water supply, irrigation, and ecosystem restoration projects.

Ideal candidates will have experience integrating interdisciplinary considerations into environmental assessment documents, or water resource and conservation practice planning and policy documents. She/He will be familiar with environmental planning in accordance with federal laws, regulations and other federal agency-specific programmatic practices. She/He will have experience coordinating with interdisciplinary teams to accomplish technically and programmatically sound environmental assessment and planning documents, reviews, and reports. Experience with project management for federal government projects related to water resources engineering/planning is a plus. Experience working with the Natural Resource Conservation Service, Bureau of Reclamation, or the Army Corps of Engineers is a plus. Familiarity with USACE or NRCS modeling software (e.g., HEC-RAS, SITES, or WinDAM) is a plus.

Candidates must have a BS in Engineering (Civil, Agricultural, Biosystems, Biological, Environmental, or Structural preferably with an environmental concentration) from an ABET accredited university. An MS degree is preferred. All candidates must possess outstanding oral and written communications skills.

Solv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

title: Senior Civil / Environmental Engineer
description:
What would it feel like to be part of a company guided by engaged and empowered employee-owners? To have the encouragement to run with innovative ideas? To know your opinion is valued and your voice is heard? Wouldn't you love to work in an atmosphere of transparency, respect, and accountability?

  

  

**Then you belong at SEH.**


SEH is currently searching for a talented Engineer to join our team!


A career with SEH in Water Resources means you’re a part of creating a more climate resilient planet by designing and implementing future-friendly water systems. From innovative water quality improvements to master drainage systems, to large-scale hydraulic structures and urban watercourse rehabilitation, we create the best way for water to flow. Be part of an award-winning team who creates and delivers strategic solutions that get surface water where it needs to be.


**Selling Points:**


* Our ESOP provides you an opportunity to own part of the company – 100% of our profits are re-invested in our Employee Owners!
* SEH supports you living your best life! We offer flexible work arrangements and schedules, so you have options that work for you.
* We want you to have options to celebrate the holidays important to you and your family through our flexible paid holiday program.
* Our Paid Family Leave benefit allows you to be there for the people you love - whether it’s the family you were born into or the family you chose


**What you will be doing:**


* Managing and providing technical support on storm and sanitary sewer hydraulic application projects involving field data collection, analysis, design, and construction implementation.
* Development and implementation of storm/sanitary sewer monitoring and modeling, field data interpretation, storm/sanitary sewer design and construction oversight on surface water, inflow/infiltration, and asset inventory projects.
* Developing and maintaining close relationships with clients throughout the development of projects and after completion.


**Required Qualifications:**


* Bachelor of Science Degree in Civil or Environmental Engineering or related field
* Licensed Professional Engineer in the State of Minnesota or the ability of obtaining within six months
* Eight or more years of related engineering experience
* Background in sanitary and/or storm sewer hydraulics
* Storm water/sanitary modeling experience particularly with SWMM software applications
* Ability to interpret engineering plans and specifications
* Good team building and communication skills
* A desire and ability to interact with clients


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Experience developing client proposals for engineering services
* Established relationships with clients or potential clients


Who we are


Better Places. Clean Water. Renewing Infrastructure. Improving Mobility. Together with clients, we’re simplifying the world’s most complex challenges. And we’ve been doing this since 1927. SEH is employee-owned and our 900+ engineers, architects, planners, scientists and a wide array of professionals unite behind our core purpose of Building a Better World for All of Us®. You’ll find our employee-owners located across the U.S. and evidence of our work in nearly every state.


Base compensation is expected to be in the range of $125,000 and $135,000 based on skill set and experience. Check out our full benefits package at, SEH Hiring Journey


**The selected candidate must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. without requiring visa sponsorship now or in the future. We are unable to provide or take over sponsorship of an employment visa for this role.**


For confidential consideration, apply online or send your resume and salary requirements via fax to 651.490.2138. Please refer to the job title if you choose to fax.  

  

Short Elliott Hendrickson Inc. is committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees according to all applicable equal opportunity and affirmative action laws, directives and regulations of federal, state and local governing bodies and agencies. In keeping with this commitment, it is the policy of Short Elliott Hendrickson Inc. to base all employment decisions only on valid job requirements without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, genetic information, marital status, familial status, status with regard to public assistance, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or status as a covered veteran. Women and minorities encouraged to apply.


**Notice to Third Party Agencies:** SEH does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters, staffing services, or other employment agencies. If a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed Service Agreement by SEH’s Director of Talent Attraction expressly requesting recruitment/staffing services for specific position(s), SEH reserves the right to pursue and hire these candidates without any financial obligation to the recruiter, employment agency, or other staffing service. In such cases, any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers or other business leaders, are deemed to be the property of SEH.

title: Project Coastal Engineer
description:
Do you like to solve problems in an engaging, collaborative, team environment? Are you excited about discovery, technical innovation, and achievement? Does working in a flexible culture with professional growth opportunities, a family friendly vibe, and smart, caring colleagues make for a great day? If so, consider an employment opportunity at Foth and join these members who enjoy their employment experience.  

The scientists and engineers of Foth Environment Solutions take on complex projects across many markets, including manufacturing, mining, solid waste, utilities, and coastal infrastructure. Informed by decades of experience and today’s best practices, we solve critical problems and add value in each of the markets we serve.  

Foth Environment Solutions has a long track record of exceptional results. Whether the goal is asset realization, navigating regulations, ensuring safety, reducing costs, or gaining a competitive edge, we are ready for the challenge.  

At Foth, we're not just engineers. We're a team of problem-solvers, innovators, and forward-thinkers. We're currently on the lookout for a Coastal Engineer who's not only passionate about coastal and waterfront engineering but also eager to lead, learn, and grow with us. This role is based in the scenic **Newport, RI or Marion, MA** - hubs for some of our most exciting and impactful projects; or potentially remote for the right candidate.
### **Primary Responsibilities**

* **Lead with Expertise:** Take the helm as the technical lead on diverse waterfront and coastal projects, guiding design and execution with your knowledge and creativity.
* **Innovate and Implement:** Stay ahead of the curve by identifying and implementing cutting-edge design and engineering technologies that set new industry standards.
* **Analyze and Design:** Use your skills to perform intricate calculations and structural analyses, crafting and reviewing design drawings for a variety of marine infrastructure projects.
* **Drive Projects to Success:** Collaborate with Project Managers to oversee project lifecycles, ensuring budgets, schedules, and quality standards are met.
* **Craft and Contribute:** Develop comprehensive construction documents and contribute to Foth's growing technical library in coastal engineering.
* **Engage and Expand:** Play a pivotal role in client relations and business development, from crafting compelling proposals to nurturing lasting relationships.

### **Required Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Civil, Structural, or Coastal Engineering with an emphasis in geotechnical engineering, coastal engineering, or related engineering degree
* 5+ years of coastal engineering experience in the areas of feasibility, design, and/or construction management
* Engineer in Training certificate
* Previous experience developing construction documents, including plans and specifications
* Prior experience with wave analysis

### **Preferred Qualifications**

* A Master's Degree in Civil, Structural, or Coastal Engineering with an emphasis in geotechnical engineering, coastal engineering, or related engineering degree
* 10+ years of experience, particularly in an engineering consultancy focused on coastal or environmental projects.
* Previous experience integrating engineering with environmental sciences and working with regulators on coastal projects.
* Experience with Optimoor software program


All Foth Companies are equal opportunity employers and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law. All locations are tobacco-free.
**About Foth**
Foth, the largest engineering and science consulting firm headquartered in Wisconsin, employs more than 650 members and operates in 28 locations to provide our national and international clients with convenient, personal services.

Our dynamic science and engineering teams at Foth are organized into business units – Environment Solutions, Infrastructure Solutions, and Production Solutions – each comprised of extraordinary talent embodying decades of knowledge and specialized expertise. We bring our 80 year history of success and interdisciplinary knowledge to every client we serve, understanding their business, providing trusted advice, and developing customized, innovative solutions with remarkable energy and ingenuity.

Foth provides engineers, scientists, and other talented professionals an award-winning employment experience, including flexibility to balance work and life. We take on our clients’ toughest challenges which provides meaningful project assignments working alongside creative and dedicated team members.

Foth’s commitment to our members is demonstrated by annually reinvesting 5% of professional fee revenues in professional development activities. Our work environment is professional, collaborative, and fun. Each day, we work together in a unified, values-based culture, helping our clients’ achieve their goals and improving the world we live in.

Join our team and experience the Foth difference!

title: Controls Engineer (Southern California)
Staff Water/Wastewater Engineer
description:
**Country:**

United States of America**Location:**

CAM64: NOR Westboro One Research Drive, Westborough, MA, 01581 USA**Staff Water/Wastewater Engineer**

**About the Water/Wastewater Engineering Group**


NORESCO develops and delivers upgrades to utility client facilities that are intended to save operating costs or increase operating revenue. We deliver these upgrades that can take many forms, in a Progressive Design Build environment, with long-term operating performance guarantees. We can also provide long-term operations and maintenance for our clients.


Our water/wastewater engineers provide the specialized skills and experience associated with water and wastewater treatment plants and distribution and collection systems. NORESCO is product and technology agnostic. We are able and willing to make upgrades in any area of the water or wastewater realm. We have considered or delivered upgrades including pumping, aeration, controls, digestion, biosolids drying, renewable natural gas, and cogeneration.


This individual will be responsible for conceptual development and design of these upgrades. Specifically, the engineer will provide technical support and leadership as a part of teams consisting of both in-house staff and consulting engineers, overseeing the design process and scope, preparing design deliverables, providing QA/QC of documents, and participating in technical customer meetings.

**About the role**


This remote position is for an experienced water/wastewater treatment engineer. Engineers are engaged in multiple projects from opportunity identification, sales support, initial concept development, project design, construction, commissioning, performance testing, and into operations and monitoring of long-term key performance indicators.

**Role Responsibilities:**

* Performing and/or monitoring all engineering aspects of water/wastewater projects from the concept stage through detailed design, construction, and commissioning in a collaborative Design/Build process which leverages NORESCO technical expertise with external engineering, vendor, and subcontractor partners and consultants.
* Actively participate in design review meetings and charrettes both internal and with the customer and their advisors.
* Lead and/or perform engineering activities during project development including: site investigations, data collection, preparation of conceptual design documents, preparation for pricing-level design documents, and final design and permitting.
* Support project pricing effort in partnership with the NORESCO construction department; Bid packages, subcontractor qualification, subcontractor bid-walks, use of third-party consultants, bid reviews, value engineering, evaluation of life cycle and long-term service agreements, etc.
* Support project team during construction, commissioning, and performance phases to resolve design issues, document as-built conditions, and ensure performance objectives are met.
* Support sales and development groups to prospect clients, audit customer facilities, participate in sales presentations, and develop technical write-ups for competitive proposal responses.
* Evaluate facility upgrades through equipment or system modeling and analysis.

**Required Experience**

* Bachelor's Degree
* 5 + years of engineering experience
* 20% -30% travel

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Eligible for Professional Engineer licensure
* Bachelor’s Degree in Civil, Environmental, Mechanical, Chemical Engineering, or other relevant field.
* Water/Wastewater industry experience
* Excellent communication and engineering skills.
* Advanced knowledge of one or more facets of engineering; design principles, technologies, unit processes, markets, design guides, and standards.
* Desire to build and maintain respectful and inclusive working relationships with individual project team members to foster an environment of cooperation and productivity.
* Keen attention to detail and ability to identify errors, concerns, or ambiguities in documents.

title: Batch Systems Engineer
description:
**Role description:** 

The Batch Systems Engineer is responsible for all the glass batch processes in Ardagh Glass Packaging -NA from incoming raw materials to batch feeding into the furnace. This role will reside within the Glass Technology team and support the company's 12 operating facilities. This position will be responsible for batch house auditing, troubleshooting, ongoing improvement projects, and design of existing and future batch house operations in North American facilities.

**Responsibilities:** 

* Audit existing batch house operations
* Determine batch house timings and capabilities
* Identify bottlenecks and improvements in projects
* Develop and oversee major repairs/projects in the batch house area for improved operation
* Create and audit both new and existing TOP's and SOP's for batch house operation
* Collaborate with the plants and corporate Glass Technology, batch and furnace, and project management teams on batch house improvements
* Develop catalogs of critical parts and systems
* Develop maintenance programs in the FIIX system for integral parts of the batch house systems
* Develop programs to minimize batch house downtime
* Develop and mentor plant personnel
* Work with the Environmental Engineering team on the optimization of existing emissions-decreasing systems
* Work with 3rd party vendors and communicate on project milestones

**Minimum skills / qualifications:** 

* Bachelor's degree in material science, mechanical engineering, or a related field
* Five (5) years of experience in operational engineering or batch house design
* Knowledge in raw material unloading, storage, weigh systems, and conveyance
* Knowledge of mechanical and electrical batch house systems
* Ability to perform detailed batch house audits
* Effective project management skills
* Knowledge and deep understanding of control systems
* Ability to work in a servant leadership capacity
* Ability to travel up to 75%

**Preferred skills / qualifications:** 

* Master's degree in material science, mechanical engineering, or a related field
* PMP certificate
* Ten (10) years of experience in operational engineering or batch house design

**About Ardagh Group**  
Ardagh Glass Packaging is a global leader in glass packaging solutions, producing packaging for the world’s leading brands. We trace our roots all the way back to the Irish Glass Bottle Company, founded in 1932. Since then, we have grown rapidly to a team of more than 20,000 people with revenues of over $9 billion. Today we have a presence across Europe, Africa, and North America.

* Did you know that Ardagh produce many of the beverage cans and bottles you drink your favorite beverages from?
* Did you know we produce metal and glass packaging which are permanent materials, meaning they can be infinitely recycled without any loss of quality?
* Did you know we produce more than 160 million containers per day?

Ardagh is passionate about sustainability and have a reputation for innovation. We push the boundaries of what’s possible, pioneering new production methods, new design techniques and new ways to recycle and save energy. Our aim is to reduce any negative environmental impact while remaining economically sustainable and socially responsible. We believe that the success of our business depends on the success of our people. We strive to create working environments where our employees feel valued, can work to their full potential, and where their achievements are celebrated. Here at Ardagh, we offer exciting and rewarding opportunities for talented and creative people. If you have ambition and want to make an impact with your career, come and join our team, you’ll enjoy the journey!

**Benefits Offered**

* Medical, prescription, dental and vision plans
* Health Savings Account (HSA) and Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
* Life insurance
* 401(k) retirement plan with company match and an employer retirement contribution
* Paid holidays, floating days and vacation
* Short- and Long-Term Disability (STD/LTD)
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Tuition reimbursement program
* Professional and personal development opportunities through Employee Resource Groups
* Benefits available from day 1 of employment
* Flexible and hybrid working hours

Ardagh Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other basis prohibited by federal, state, and local law.

Ardagh Group complies with federal, state, and local disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. Contact Clare McHugh (clare.mchugh@ardaghgroup.com) if a reasonable accommodation is needed.

title: Civil Drainage Engineer - Transportation Infrastructure
description:
In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!
When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.
**Job Description:**

**Civil Drainage Engineer – USA / Remote**

**Opportunity :**

Would you enjoy being involved on a wide variety of civil engineering tasks on small to large scale, transportation projects? **Parsons** is now hiring a **Civil** **Drainage Engineer** for design-build and design-bid-build projects located around the USA to support various state and Federal **road and highway projects ..** 

**This role can be based anywhere in the USA, and allows for a remote based work situation , or the ability to work from a local Parsons office on a hybrid basis , if desired.**

Parsons extensive experience in this field, combined with your engineering knowledge, will propel your career forward with opportunity for advancement with top performance. We need our engineers to be versatile, enthusiastic to work in highly flexible, team-oriented environment and who have exceptional communication, analytical and management skills.


In this role: you will be engaged in engineering drainage and irrigation designs, hydraulic systems modeling, and drainage calculations. You will review construction details, as well as erosion control drawings. Perform quantity calculations and produce/check engineering analytical data and related information to assure the design and any technical reports are accurate. Deliver critical design components regarding project scope, and experience supporting any state DOT projects is essential.  



**Responsibilities :**

* Independently develops and/or supervises the creation of engineering products that meet customer quality requirements. This includes defining the problem, establishing the work scope, preparing the budget and schedule, planning the work, providing technical direction, and reporting the work status.
* **Will perform drainage and culvert systems design for various State DOT road and highway projects around the USA.**
* Typical products may include detailed calculations, drawings, procurement documents, design and installation packages, proposal evaluations, technical reports, and detailed analyses.
* Provides support for other engineering activities as required. May supervise one or more subordinates and provide input regarding performance.
* May be assigned to a project or organizational team, or as a lead engineer for a specific discipline on a small to intermediate-size project.
* Provides input and technical guidance to CAD Designer/Drafters, Designers, and lower-level Engineers working on the same project.

***Qualifications*** *:*

* *4-year degree in Civil Engineering (or a related field) is required.*
* ***3 years or more of related work experience with road & highway drainage design , preferably with state DOT projects***
* *Proficiency in utilizing CAD and other PC software packages typically associated with engineering is required. Experience with Microstation and/or Autocad Civil 3D is essential*
* ***Experience supporting any state DOT projects is preferred, but experience with drainage systems design for land development projects is considered*** *. Experience obtaining canal and storm water permits is a plus*
* *Combination of Experience with hydraulic modeling programs of HEC-RAS, HEC-HMS, HY-8, Bentley InRoads Storm & Sanitary, Bentley StormCAD, Aquaveo Watershed Modeling System (WMS), NRCS WinTR-55, Bentley FlowMaster, FHWA Hydraulic Toolbox, and EPA Storm Water Management Model (SWMM) is essential.*

**Minimum Clearance Required to Start:**

Not Applicable/None
This position is part of our Critical Infrastructure team.
For more than 75 years, our experts have designed and delivered the critical infrastructure that connects and protects communities around the world. We work in diverse, collaborative teams, both within the company and with our partners and customers, to plan, design, build, and modernize infrastructure. We take special pride in projects and solutions that improve communities as well as people’s quality of life by promoting economic growth, enhancing mobility, and increasing sustainability and resiliency. Powered by our people, we provide the imagination necessary to support our customers’ visions—and to help them see new possibilities.
Salary Range:


$59,300.00 - $119,700.00
We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!
The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates.


This position will be posted for a minimum of 3 days and will continue to be posted for an average of 30 days until a qualified applicant is selected or the position has been cancelled.
Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.
We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

title: Core Thermal Hydraulic Engineer
description:
**What You’ve Accomplished**



You have completed a BS in Nuclear Engineering, or a related degree (e.g., physics with nuclear concentration). You may have also obtained an advanced degree in similar fields. You have worked in an engineering role for at least 5 years and are ready to join Framatome and help deliver clean, safe energy and advance nuclear technology.

  


**Who You Are**



Your actions, behaviors, and decisions are made in a manner consistent with our Core Values: https://www.framatome.com/en/jobseekers/our-values/



You may have also acquired the following skills:


* You have demonstrated experience in pressurized water reactor (PWR) or boiling water reactor (BWR) thermal-hydraulics engineering.
* You have experience with nuclear industry systems, subchannel codes (e.g. VIPRE or COBRA), or other software-development/method codes.
* You have worked on engineering workstation computers and within LINUX operating environments. You have some computer programming/software capabilities and experience in FORTRAN, C/C++, or PYTHON.
* You display positive and effective team interaction skills and value positive peer relationships.
* You have developed effective written and oral communication skills.

  


**Your Opportunity**



This full-time role is about making an impact on people’s lives and the future of clean energy. You will leverage your skills and experience to be part of an innovative team and make a difference for our customers. As a Core Thermal Hydraulic Engineer in Lynchburg, VA (remote work will also be considered), you will be part of the proven team in the PWR Core Design & Safety Analysis Department in the Fuel Business Unit. Your work will include preparing and applying nuclear reactor thermal-hydraulic principles and models for plant safety analyses. You will be involved in the preparation of engineering documentation, supporting regular customer interactions, and work with related engineering disciplines to resolve complex technical issues to produce high quality solutions. The department also supports analyses of advanced reactor designs and small modular reactor concepts. This position requires occasional travel. Together we will enable clean, safe, and economical low-carbon energy to meet the global ambition for a better tomorrow.

  


**Who We Are**



Framatome is an international leader in nuclear energy recognized for its innovative solutions and value-added technologies for the global nuclear fleet. More than 2,000 dedicated U.S. Framatome employees work every day to supply ever cleaner, safer, and more economical low-carbon energy for our communities and world. As well as supporting new nuclear builds, advancing new technology and advancing nuclear energy in the U.S. and abroad. Like you, we want a brighter future.

  



See how the Fuel Business Unit contributes to this future: https://www.framatome.com/en/expertise/design-and-fuel-manufacturing/

  



Discover Lynchburg, Virginia: https://www.opportunitylynchburg.com/

  


**Your Total Rewards Package**



The range of base salary for the position is between $95,000 - $129,000, and may also include annual incentives, performance bonuses and benefits. Please note that the base salary range is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies and work location.

  



Framatome offers a broad employee benefits portfolio as a key component of your total rewards. This includes:



Multiple medical plans; dental and vision plans; Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment; long- and short-term disability; optional plans including dependent life, accident, critical illness and hospital indemnity insurance; retirement savings plans (401k) with employer match; paid time off including up to 3 weeks of vacation, 8 days of sick leave, and 13 paid holidays; education reimbursement; adoption assistance; employee assistance programs; opportunities for professional development.

  



Positions within Framatome may require access to proprietary information that is subject to U.S. export control regulations. As such, the Company must ensure that any hires for these job openings fully comply with all US regulations. Foreign national applicants that are citizens or residents of countries not included on the Department of Energy’s Generally Authorized Destinations list may not be eligible for immediate need positions. See list here: https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-10/chapter-III/part-810/appendix-Appendix%20A%20to%20Part%20810

  



Framatome is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

title: Senior Stormwater Environmental Scientist/Engineer (SME)
description:
At **APTIM**, we come to work each day knowing that we are making an impact on the world. Our work spans from safeguarding and maintaining critical infrastructure to helping communities recover from natural disasters, from empowering our armed forces and first responders to reducing carbon and energy use, and from making cities more resilient against the threats of climate change to restoring contaminated ecological systems.

**Job Overview:**

APTIM is seeking a Senior Environmental Scientist/Engineer who will be responsible for the planning, development, management, and implementation of storm water pollution prevention projects throughout the United States. The candidate will be responsible for leading industrial stormwater support activities that include but are not limited to: Preparing and implementing Stormwater Pollution Prevention Plans (SWPPs), overseeing monitoring, sampling and inspections performed by field staff, supporting the preparation and submittal of permit applications to regulatory agencies, performing regulatory technical reviews, and conducting periodic field audits. The candidate will specialize in storm water management, erosion and sediment pollution control, and water quality compliance.

**What you can expect from APTIM:**

* Work that is worthy of your time and talent
* Respect and flexibility to provide adequate work/life balance
* Unwavering determination to deliver quality products to our clients and communities
* A voice in making our company better
* Investment into your personal and professional development

**Key Responsibilities/Accountabilities:**

* Provide technical expertise on storm water services for clients within the power, retail, transportation, state and local government, heavy industry and solid waste sectors.
* Plan, organize and administer permitting, inspection, monitoring and data management for industrial stormwater projects.
* Develop new and update existing Stormwater Pollution Prevention Plans.
* Prepare regulatory technical reviews and reports.
* Provide subject matter expertise around Best Management Practice (BMP) design and implementation.
* Conduct periodic QAQC site visits to verify site compliance.
* Provide mentoring and training to field inspectors and less experienced staff.
* Coordinate the investigation of prohibited non-stormwater discharges, water quality problems, permit exceedances, and non-compliance issues that may arise for client-permitted facilities.
* Interface with project databases and tools to measure project performance and KPIs.
* Collaborate with project team members across the country.
* Adhere to all safety protocols while working in the field.
* Executing various work scopes, while meeting project schedules and budgets.
* Work efficiently and collaboratively within a large project team.
* Monitor applicable regulatory requirements and stay abreast of regulatory trends.

**Basic Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's Degree in related field (civil engineering, geology, environmental sciences) desirable.
* 15 plus years of experience providing stormwater related services to customers.
* Stormwater certification(s) desired.
* Possess a history of and competence in implementing SWPPP requirements.
* Firm understanding of storm water management and erosion control BMPs, including field implementation and maintenance requirements.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills required.
* Team player mentality with demonstrated history of meeting project deadlines and achieving client satisfaction .
* Must be competent using Microsoft Office, particularly Word and Excel. Must be comfortable manipulating information using tablets.
* Motivated and capable of working independently and as part of a team.
* ability to interact with clients, various project consultants, contractors, and team members.

**Who we are and what we do:**

APTIM is a global industry leader headquartered in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. With more than 4,000 employees worldwide, APTIM specializes in critical infrastructure, technical and data solutions, program management, environmental services, resilience, as well as sustainability and energy solutions. Our dedicated people have the proven experience and expertise to provide integrated services and solutions to government agencies, commercial, industrial, and energy customers. APTIM is committed to accelerating the transition toward a clean and efficient energy economy, building a sustainable future for our communities and the natural world, and creating an inclusive equitable environment that celebrates the diversity of our people.

Watch our video:

Aptim Making a Difference

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

description:

title: TraCS Software Support Representative, Civil and Environmental Engineering - OPS
description:
**Department**
--------------

  


College of Engineering – Civil and Environmental


**Responsibilities**
--------------------

  


This position is responsible for providing front line software support to law enforcement agency points of contact. This will involve answering the main support telephone line, responding to support emails and text messages, and responding to work orders entered by and on behalf of users and staff in an online issue tracker. Regardless of the medium in which support requests are received, this position is responsible for ensuring every agency contact is ultimately entered in the online issue tracker.


Beyond just responding to and tracking issues reported and features requested, this position requires independent problem resolution and debugging. This position is responsible for using good judgement to solve complex problems that require a high level of general knowledge of law enforcement activities and systems. Must possess the ability to relay proper documentation to development staff, such as steps to recreate, screen shots, log files, and additional information. Must also possess the ability to relay general law enforcement standard operating procedures to development staff to ensure the software package’s bug fixes and features meets law enforcement needs and changes do not inhibit use of the software in the field. Must communicate with the team when there is an influx of support requests to ensure all requests are handled in under 1 business day. Ability to identify high priority customer requests and ensure these requests are handled before all others.

* Responsible for assisting with updating and creating training materials and documentation for end users. This includes but is not limited to Wiki article, PowerPoints, Word documents, PDFs, and helping to build scripts for YouTube training videos.
* Responsible for assisting with the onboarding of new law enforcement agencies. Responsible for training new agencies onsite or remote, at the preference of the agency.
* Responsible for attending conferences and/or training symposiums and operating a vendor booth.
* Responsible for assisting with updating agency contact information in the customer relationship management system.


**Qualifications**
------------------



* Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Management Information Systems, or other appropriate degree plus two years’ experience or a combination of appropriate post high school education and experience equal to six years.
* Must have a valid driver’s license and obtain a Criminal Justice Information Services certification within the first 30 days of employment.
* Ability to effectively communicate verbally and in writing.
* Ability to convey technical information to technical and non-technical users.
* Must be proficient in documenting existing and new processes.
* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
* Ability to prioritize, organize, and perform multiple work assignments.
* Ability to utilize problem solving skills.
* Knowledge of and the ability to interpret and apply related University policies, procedures, principles, and practices.
* Knowledge of applicable computer software and operating systems.
* Knowledge of standard concepts, practices, and procedures for computer support.
* Must be able to work independently.


**Preferred Qualifications**
----------------------------



* May offer preference to those with Traffic and Criminal Software system experience.
* May offer preference to those with experience with training law enforcement on industry related software systems.
* May offer preference to those who are currently or were previously employed with a law enforcement agency.
* May offer preference to those with current or previous Criminal Justice Information Services certification.


**University Information**
--------------------------

  


One of the nation's elite research universities, Florida State University preserves, expands, and disseminates knowledge in the sciences, technology, arts, humanities, and professions, while embracing a philosophy of learning strongly rooted in the traditions of the liberal arts and critical thinking. Founded in 1851, Florida State University is the oldest continuous site of higher education in Florida. FSU is a community steeped in tradition that fosters research, encourages creativity, and embraces diversity. At FSU, there’s the excitement of being part of a vibrant academic and professional community, surrounded by people whose ideas are shaping tomorrow’s news!  

  

Learn more about our university and campuses.


**Anticipated Salary Range**
----------------------------

  


$25/hour


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If qualified and interested in a specific job opening as advertised, apply to Florida State University at https://jobs.fsu.edu. If you are a current FSU employee, apply via myFSU > Self Service.  

  

Applicants are required to complete the online application with all applicable information. Applications must include all work history up to ten years, and education details even if attaching a resume.


**Considerations**
------------------

  


This is an OPS/temporary job.


Based on the duties, this position may require completion of a criminal history background check.


M - F 8am to 5pm for general work week. Other hours outside of this range will be required to meet customer needs, including nights and holidays. Some travel will be required.


Possibility of remote work location


**Equal Employment Opportunity**
--------------------------------

  


An Equal Opportunity/Access/Affirmative Action/Pro Disabled & Veteran Employer.


FSU's Equal Opportunity Statement can be accessed at: https://hr.fsu.edu/sites/g/files/upcbnu2186/files/PDF/Publications/diversity/EEO\\_Statement.pdf.

title: Environmental & Sustainability Manager - APG National - Remote
description:
Job ID: 492547  

  

Oldcastle APG, a CRH Company, is the leading provider of outdoor living solutions in North America with an award-winning portfolio that enables customers to Live Well Outside. Inspiring endless possibilities with enduring performance, its collection of premier building products create inviting outdoor spaces where people connect, reflect and recharge. The manufacturer's signature brands include Belgard® and Echelon® hardscape and masonry materials; Barrette Outdoor Living® and MoistureShield® fencing, decking and railing; Sakrete® and Amerimix® packaged concrete and mortar; Techniseal® sands, jointing technologies and surface protectors; PebbleTec® pool finishes; plus popular brands of landscape and gardening materials.
  

  

**Job Summary**  

  

Working within Oldcastle APG's National division, the Environmental & Sustainability Manager is responsible for overall Environmental compliance as well as Sustainability initiatives. Represents the organization's compliance and sustainability initiatives to the larger organization. Champions, communicates, and trains on all functional aspects of the roll to the organization. Implements procedures and programs to minimize environmental, health and safety (EHS) risks and ensures compliance with regulatory requirements by performing the following duties:  

* Manage environmental project activities including scheduling, tracking, and planning for environmental assessments, site investigations, feasibility studies, and remedial action plans.
* Interprets data and observations to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry guidelines and advises management accordingly.
* Participate in all Sustainability initiatives and represent those initiatives to the larger organization.
* Negotiate settlements of all citations and responses to environmental compliance issues.
* Oversee the development and implementation of sampling and monitoring plans which may include installing, operating, and maintaining equipment which monitor air, land, and/or water pollution levels.
* Work with Maintenance, Engineering, and any other related department on all compliance requirements.
* Prepares and submits to the relevant regulatory agencies permit applications to obtain operating permits for new installations and modifications to existing permits.
* Evaluate current and proposed codes, standards, regulations, and guidelines to determine the impact on current and future programs and activities.
* Support Regions/OpCos in annual regulatory reporting to state and federal agencies.
* Other duties and responsibilities related to the nature of the job may be assigned on a temporary or permanent basis as needed.

  

**Requirements**  

* Bachelor's Degree, preferred in Environmental field, plus 5+ years related experience and/or training in related functions, or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
* Ability to lead, provide direction, coach and mentor and problem-solve.
* Working knowledge of OSHA, MSHA, DOT and EPA regulations.
* Must be willing to spend a considerable amount of time in the field identifying potential issues through frequent observation and soliciting individual input at the sites to verify root cause.

  

**What CRH Offers You**  

* Highly competitive base pay
* Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs
* Group retirement savings program
* Health and wellness programs
* A diverse and inclusive culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion

  

**About CRH**  

  

CRH has a long and proud heritage. We are a collection of hundreds of family businesses, regional companies and large enterprises that together form the CRH family. CRH operates in a decentralized, diversified structure that allows you to work in a small company environment while having the career opportunities of large international organization.  

  

If you're up for a rewarding challenge, we invite you to take the first step and apply today! Once you click apply now, you will be brought to our official employment application. Please complete your online profile and it will be sent to the hiring manager. Our system allows you to view and track your status 24 hours a day. Thank you for your interest!
  

  

Oldcastle APG, a CRH Company, is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer.  

  

EOE/Vet/Disability-

Mar 6, 2024  

  

**Nearest Major Market:** St Louis

Maintenance Engineer, Temporary, Environmental Engineering, Engineer, Manager, Engineering, Contract, Management

title: Senior Stormwater Environmental Scientist/Engineer (Subject Matter Expert)
description:
At **APTIM**, we come to work each day knowing that we are making an impact on the world. Our work spans from safeguarding and maintaining critical infrastructure to helping communities recover from natural disasters, from empowering our armed forces and first responders to reducing carbon and energy use, and from making cities more resilient against the threats of climate change to restoring contaminated ecological systems.


**Job Overview:**



APTIM is seeking a Senior Environmental Scientist/Engineer who will be responsible for the planning, development, management, and implementation of storm water pollution prevention projects throughout the United States. The candidate will be responsible for leading industrial stormwater support activities that include but are not limited to: Preparing and implementing Stormwater Pollution Prevention Plans (SWPPs), overseeing monitoring, sampling and inspections performed by field staff, supporting the preparation and submittal of permit applications to regulatory agencies, performing regulatory technical reviews, and conducting periodic field audits. The candidate will specialize in storm water management, erosion and sediment pollution control, and water quality compliance.



**What you can expect from APTIM:**


* Work that is worthy of your time and talent
* Respect and flexibility to provide adequate work/life balance
* Unwavering determination to deliver quality products to our clients and communities
* A voice in making our company better
* Investment into your personal and professional development


**Key Responsibilities/Accountabilities:**


* Provide technical expertise on storm water services for clients within the power, retail, transportation, state and local government, heavy industry and solid waste sectors.
* Plan, organize and administer permitting, inspection, monitoring and data management for industrial stormwater projects.
* Develop new and update existing Stormwater Pollution Prevention Plans.
* Prepare regulatory technical reviews and reports.
* Provide subject matter expertise around Best Management Practice (BMP) design and implementation.
* Conduct periodic QAQC site visits to verify site compliance.
* Provide mentoring and training to field inspectors and less experienced staff.
* Coordinate the investigation of prohibited non-stormwater discharges, water quality problems, permit exceedances, and non-compliance issues that may arise for client-permitted facilities.
* Interface with project databases and tools to measure project performance and KPIs.
* Collaborate with project team members across the country.
* Adhere to all safety protocols while working in the field.
* Executing various work scopes, while meeting project schedules and budgets.
* Work efficiently and collaboratively within a large project team.
* Monitor applicable regulatory requirements and stay abreast of regulatory trends.


**Basic Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's Degree in related field (civil engineering, geology, environmental sciences) desirable.
* 15 plus years of experience providing stormwater related services to customers.
* Stormwater certification(s) desired.
* Possess a history of and competence in implementing SWPPP requirements.
* Firm understanding of storm water management and erosion control BMPs, including field implementation and maintenance requirements.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills required.
* Team player mentality with demonstrated history of meeting project deadlines and achieving client satisfaction .
* Must be competent using Microsoft Office, particularly Word and Excel. Must be comfortable manipulating information using tablets.
* Motivated and capable of working independently and as part of a team.
* ability to interact with clients, various project consultants, contractors, and team members.

**Who we are and what we do:**



APTIM is a global industry leader headquartered in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. With more than 4,000 employees worldwide, APTIM specializes in critical infrastructure, technical and data solutions, program management, environmental services, resilience, as well as sustainability and energy solutions. Our dedicated people have the proven experience and expertise to provide integrated services and solutions to government agencies, commercial, industrial, and energy customers. APTIM is committed to accelerating the transition toward a clean and efficient energy economy, building a sustainable future for our communities and the natural world, and creating an inclusive equitable environment that celebrates the diversity of our people.



**LI-REMOTE**
=============

Aptim Making a Difference

title: Senior Process Engineer
description:
Position Type: **Permanent Full Time**

Job Title: **Senior Process Engineer, RNG Industry**

What makes BerQ RNG great? Our People! Each employee contributes to creating a clean and safe environment, improving the lives of people around the world. Come join us on this exciting journey as we work towards a more sustainable future!

**About Us**  
BerQ RNG builds and develops renewable natural gas projects in addition to buying and selling renewable natural gas. BerQ RNG is structured to contribute positively to the environment by using biogas that is currently flared into the atmosphere. Throughout North America, thousands of locations are flaring biogas because it is not pure enough or economical enough to use. We consider this a waste of resources and aim to eliminate this practice in North America. We have developed a business model that can use these resources economically and, as such, can earn money for our investors while cleaning up the environment. For more information on BerQ RNG, please visit our website at *www.berqrng.com*.

**About the Job**  
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Process/Operations Engineer with 5-10 years experience to join our growing RNG (Renewable Natural Gas) company. In this role, you will play a critical part in helping to optimize existing operations by collecting and analyzing information and acting on it to drive tangible improvements to RNG production and reducing costs.

We are looking for a dynamic team member with a positive attitude, excellent interpersonal skills and strong analytical skills using Aveva PI and AI. You should be proficient at working on multiple projects simultaneously and be equally comfortable working independently and in a team setting.

**Responsibilities:** 

* Monitoring and assessing operational systems, analyzing data, identifying trends, and proposing corrective actions to maintain optimal process performance, reduce downtime, and enhance overall productivity.
* Monitoring and assessing facility processes on an ongoing basis to ensure they are operating in accordance with safety, environmental, quality, output, and efficiency targets.
* Identifying opportunities for process improvement, proposing innovative solutions, and leading or contributing to process optimization projects to drive efficiency, cost savings, and environmental sustainability.
* Collaborating with operators, maintenance personnel, and other stakeholders to troubleshoot issues, optimize process performance, and ensure safe and efficient operations.
* Helping to investigate and troubleshoot process problems, identifying root cause failures and developing remedial solutions.
* Investigating and deploying new technology to improve facility production and reliability.
* Working with consultants and contractors to obtain proposals, establish work plans/schedules and safe work requirements.
* Project management for implementation of process upgrades and major maintenance (e.g. procure and install a new H2S removal system or manage a digester cleanout).
* Writing/editing operational summaries and providing technical summaries of data analyses.
* Develop and implement plant-level specific systems such as SOPs, or updates to existing plant documentation.
* Participate in Corporate Health and Safety meetings and training as required.
* Perform other related administrative or project-based duties as assigned.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field. Professional Engineering Designation is preferred.
* 5-10 years of work experience as an Operations/Process Engineer or in a similar role, preferably in the renewable natural gas industry.
* Must have experience in anaerobic digestion and the biogas (digester, landfill) industry.
* Experience with process optimization, process control, and AI/machine learning data analysis.
* Experience with Aveva PI would be an asset.
* Experience with SCADA systems, ladder logic, Factory Talk and Ignition is an asset.
* Experience in working with P&IDs, PFDs, General Arrangement, Shop drawings, Instrumentation and Electrical drawings.
* Field experience is an industrial setting, preferably Energy or Wastewater treatment asset.
* Analytical and problem-solving skills: Ability to analyze technical challenges, propose innovative solutions, and make informed decisions. Strong troubleshooting abilities to address project-related issues and mitigate risks effectively.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, contractors, and stakeholders. Proven ability to present technical information in a clear and concise manner.
* Familiarity with codes and standards particularly as they apply to the natural gas industry.
* Proficient use of Microsoft Office and ability to use CAD and other engineering tools.
* Health and safety oriented.
* Excellent organization and time management skills, including the ability to balance multiple priorities and stay focused on priorities in a fast-paced environment to meet deadlines.
* Must be a strong team player who is able to collaborate with colleagues on complex assignments.
* Flexibility to do what needs to be done with a roll-up-the-sleeves attitude.
* Ability to travel within the US and Canada as needed.
* Valid driver’s license.

**Job Location**

Open to remote working in addition to offices in Oakville, Ontario Canada, and Pittsburgh, PA US. Ability to travel to visit project sites, suppliers, meetings, and conferences up to 25% of time.

Compensation:

**In addition to a collaborative and supportive work environment Berq RNG offers:**

* Competitive salary.
* Annual performance incentive bonus opportunity.
* Comprehensive Medical, Dental health coverage for you and your family.
* 401k Retirement Plan with company match.
* Paid time off and holidays.
* A culture that values teamwork, collaboration, and opportunity for growth and development.

BerQ RNG is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to promoting a work environment that embraces diversity, equity, inclusion, and respect. BerQ RNG provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals without regard to race, religion, age, sex, national origin, veteran status, or other legally protected classification in accordance with applicable Federal, state, and local laws.

**Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the US or Canada with no restrictions.**

**How to Apply:**

Please send you resume and cover letter with the subject heading “ Senior Operations Engineer” to **hr@bergrng.com.**

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Environmental Engineer - Remote
description:
We are recruiting for a Senior Environmental Engineer. This role manages projects and processes to ensure compliance with environmental regulations and programs. Projects and processes that will improve the energy utility efficiency of the company are also managed. Engineering support is provided to the Live Operations Group. Additional engineering support is provided to company operations and disaster team activities as needed. Support other project managers as needed.

This position may be remote mid-Atlantic to southeast regions within 2.5 hours of Perdue Locations. Travel Requirement: 50% - 75%.

**Principal and Essential Duties & Responsibilities**

* Provides a safe, secure and productive work environment for our associates at all Company sites.
* Manages all construction sites and contractors in accordance with OSHA guidelines.
* Determines the environmental needs for new and existing company facilities.
* Manages the design and construction of these additions and modifications.
* Assists Environmental Managers in the areas of wastewater, water supply, sludge management, air quality, solid waste, hazardous waste, storm water and recycling.
* Conducts engineering review of SPCC, SWPPP, and NESHAP plans.
* Provides engineering support to the Live Operations group.
* Works with feed mill managers, hatchery managers, and grow out associates to improve the processes and supports their capital plan as needed.
* Provides guidance to the Directors of Operations and their management teams in developing solutions and budgets for improving processes, maintaining facilities, and innovative problem solving related to environmental compliance.

**Minimum Education And Experience Required**

BS degree or equivalent related work experience in Mechanical, Agricultural, Civil or Environmental Engineering or related discipline plus 6-8 years related work experience is required.

* Technical experience in construction, environmental regulations, and poultry processing equipment, feed mill equipment, hatchery equipment project management, and energy utility consumption is a must.
* Demonstrated competency in problem solving, negotiating, managing people, and establishing and meeting schedules is required.
* Must be able to travel to remote facilities and/or offices for meetings. Frequent plant and project site visits are required; travel is extensive.
* Must have adequate computer skills with AutoCAD and Microsoft Office.

**Experience Preferred**

Professional Engineer License, Water and Wastewater Operations Experience, Certified Energy Manager

**Environmental Factors and Physical Requirements**

This position is active. Work activity is at the project and plant sites. On the floor activities such as troubleshooting and re-design of existing systems are routine. May need to move equipment occasionally. May need to access files, supplies and equipment. Work activity may take place at any company facility. Work environment includes, but is not limited to, a normal office environment and construction site as well as climate extremes found in a poultry processing operation, feed mill, hatchery and a waste water treatment facility. Position requires an associate to have the ability to move throughout the complex and all facilities. Must be able to work in confined spaces, permitted areas, and at heights over 100 feet. Must be able to work on and or around operating equipment. Must be trained and use Lockout/Tagout. When in a plant environment: Exposure primarily consists of wet and moist floors which include metal and plastic grating surfaces. May be exposed to temperatures of 28 degrees to 100 degrees Fahrenheit with both ambient and 100% humidity. May handle product 25 degrees to 50 degrees Fahrenheit. May be exposed to noise ranges of 50 db to 110 db. May be exposed to all chemicals used in poultry, food, and processing functions. Must wear and use protective and safety equipment required for the job, as directed by the Company

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

* Health insurance

* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

* 6 years

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

* Travel
