title: Environmental Engineer
description:
**Description**  

  

Alliance Technical Group's Environmental Consulting Division is GROWING!  

  

We are looking for an **Environment Engineer** to join our environmental consulting team. If you have 8 - 15+ years of experience and are looking for an opportunity to take your career to the next level, then APPLY today! One of our Talent Acquisition Advisors will contact you immediately. This position can be remote or can be located at one of our ATG Environmental Consulting locations throughout the United States.  

  

At Alliance, we are committed to fostering a workplace and community that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion as core values. We believe that a diverse and inclusive environment not only enriches our organization, but also strengthens our ability to innovate, collaborate, and succeed.  

  

The primary function of this position is to support our water resources projects and environmental engineering efforts. Key disciplines will include hydrologic and water quality/watershed assessment and modeling, data management and analysis, wastewater treatment analysis and design, water resources related permitting support (NPDES, 404/408, water quality standards, SPCC, etc.), and stormwater quality/management.  

  

**Role and Responsibilities**  

* Prepare technical documents and review/edit the work products of other employees.
* Create documents to support pollution prevention and spill preparedness in accordance with State and Federal regulations.
* Stamp plans as required by regulatory authorities.
* Provide engineering support for wetlands/stream restoration projects.
* Perform hydrologic/hydraulic analysis and modeling of stream and river systems.
* Setup and run water quality and watershed models and provide support for other modeling efforts.
* Support the environmental compliance efforts for municipal and industrial clients.
* Contribute to engineering designs for stormwater controls, wastewater/water treatment systems.
* Direct the development of Civil/Environmental design documents (conceptual, preliminary, final).
* Develop capital construction cost estimates using regional indices and vendor-provided information.
* Communication with project teams, clients in the office and on-site and regulatory agencies.
* Participation in information gathering at industrial facilities.
* Personal management of time and tasks including clear communication with team.

  

**Required Education and Experience**  

* Education: Bachelor's degree (B.S.) in Engineering (Chemical, Mechanical, and/or Environmental/Civil Engineering) from ABET Accredited, four-year college or university or foreign equivalent
* Registered **Professional Engineer (PE)** from an accredited State Program is a **MUST**
* Proficient computer skills with Microsoft Suite (Word, MS Excel, Outlook), and AutoCAD
* Experience: 8 - 15+ years with hydrologic and water quality/watershed assessment and modeling, data management and analysis, wastewater treatment analysis and design, water resources related permitting support (NPDES, 404/408, water quality standards, SPCC, etc.), and stormwater quality/management.

  

**Preferred Skills:**  

Qual2 modeling (or similar), Wastewater Treatment Troubleshooting and design, statistics, npdes permitting, stormwater management, lid, swat modeling, hydrological analysis of rivers and streams, HEC-RAS hydraulic modeling.  

  

**Salary Range:** negotiable  

  

**Location:** Bryant, AR  

  

**Physical Demands**  

Some field work will be required  

  

**Limited Travel:** to client sites  

  

**Additional Notes**  

The ideal candidate may not have experience in all listed preferred skills but will have some understanding of each category.

title: Water/Wastewater Construction Support Engineer
description:
Responsibilities:

Mead & Hunt has an exceptional opportunity for a highly motivated construction support engineer to work with our water/wastewater group in Texas. Responsibilities include monitoring construction while documenting and verifying conformance with contract documents and applicable standards; receiving, resolving and responding to field concerns within water/wastewater systems; preparing and processing pay applications and change orders; receiving, reviewing and processing submittals and RFIs; monitoring contractor-provided documents (quality control, materials testing, etc.); preparing field directives; assisting with constructability reviews. This position requires heavy lifting, working outside in a variety of conditions on a regular basis, and ability to perform work independently. Travel to construction sites is an essential function of this position; a valid driver’s license is required. The position will support multiple construction projects, several of which have owner-employed personnel serving in daily inspection and resident roles. Extended hours and occasional overnight stays may be required.


Qualifications:

Successful candidates will have all of the following a bachelor’s degree (or higher) in civil engineering, construction management or related field AND at least four years of relevant work experience.

  

Ideal candidates will have any/all of the following:

* Knowledge of construction methods applicable to water/wastewater systems including field experience related to multiple disciplines (earthwork, concrete, piping, coatings, equipment installation and startup)
* Experience working with differing construction management and documentation needs of multiple owners
* Experience using safety and construction equipment
* PE License or EIT Certification


If you have strong communication and organizational skills, are someone who takes initiative, and can work well both independently and as part of a team, complete the online application process for this job posting at www.meadhunt.com/careers. Interviews are awarded on our review of your ability to meet the qualifications in the paragraphs describing the “successful” candidate and “ideal” candidate.

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

title: Senior Environmental Mergers and Acquisitions Consultant
description:
**About the job**
Antea USA, Inc. (Antea®Group) is seeking an Experienced Environmental Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) Consultant to help grow its M&A practice both domestically and globally. The ideal candidate will be experienced in directing and managing sophisticated acquisition and divestiture projects, as well as have an established record of developing new client relationships and growing existing client relationships. Antea Group is particularly focused on growing its M&A practice within the financial and investment communities but will also be focusing on new and existing corporate clients.  

﻿Antea Group is flexible with respect to the location for the selected candidate (U.S.).  

As a Senior M&A Consultant, you will help lead Antea Group’s M&A practice area, bringing a diverse set of skills focused on client development, marketplace brand development, conferences and speaking engagements, monitoring market trends, providing project direction, providing project-specific senior M&A advisory, project scoping designs, proposal development, mentoring staff, and ensuring the highest quality of work for our clients.  

You will support multinational clients by managing complex deal teams, executing a broad spectrum of due diligence work: subsurface risks (e.g. Phase I ESAs and Phase II ESAs); operational risks (e.g., permit reviews and EHS material compliance reviews); contaminated infrastructure; PFAS issues; Environment, Social Governance (ESG) risks; business risks; post-acquisition planning and advising; as well as investment thesis advising (e.g., value creation). We desire an experienced candidate that is capable of working complex deals and transactions ranging from large strategic corporate acquisitions/divestitures to private equity and financial investments throughout a variety of sectors including Oil & Gas, Technology, Chemical, Manufactured Goods, Retail, and Food & Beverage.  

The position is full-time with up to 10% travel anticipated.  

Typical job assignments may include but are not necessarily limited to:  

* Client account development and leadership, opportunity generation, and delivery of the full spectrum of Antea Group’s consulting services to our clients, with a genuine approach to do what is right for the client.
* Be a leader in growing Antea Group’s M&A services.
	+ Investment thesis advising and consultation.
	+ Due diligence including desktop reviews, Phase Is, Phase IIs, risk and liability assessments, EHS material compliance reviews, PFAS reviews.
	+ Environment, Social Governance (ESG) due diligence, including Antea Group’s Sustainability Transaction Assessment Report (STAR) solution, and post-acquisition value creation workshops stemming from the STAR due diligence work.
	+ Post-acquisition integration services, including gap analyses, corrective actions, and onsite support through Antea Group’s RaaS program.
	+ Deal negotiation support, including support with insurance underwriters or other stakeholders, is integral to the success of the deal.
	+ Actively develop commercial strategies to pursue and win new business opportunities that result in significant revenue growth with target clients aligned with Antea Group’s global strategy.
	+ Develop relationships at the top levels of client organizations, raising the profile of Antea Group’s capabilities within key client organizations.
	+ Develop new client relationships and expand existing relationships by delivering strategic consulting advice, genuine value, and quality service.
	+ Understand M&A marketplace, providing insights to Antea Group’s M&A practice area on activity and strategic focus.
	+ Design due diligence programs for clients, and write proposals including content, budgets, presentations, and contracting.
	+ Lead complex due diligence consulting engagements involving multi-site portfolios and multi-person project teams locally, nationally, and globally.
	+ Work with clients to find solutions to transaction-driven issues.
	+ Assist Antea Group’s practice lead with building and growing a high-performance M&A team, providing mentoring and guidance to less experienced colleagues.
	+ Support the growth and development of Antea Group’s ESG M&A solutions and actively collaborate with its domestic colleagues as well as its proprietary network of associates around the globe (e.g., Inogen, https://www.inogenalliance.com/).
	+ Assist with driving innovation within the business to stay ahead of client needs and to differentiate Antea Group in the market.
	+ Work in a collaborative, cross-functional team environment to build Antea Group’s global business, as well as to lead client and technical teams.
	+ Meet business financial targets, overall project budget and schedule, client satisfaction and expectations, and internal metrics.

**DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS**  

* Minimum of 15 years in the Environmental, Health, Safety, and Sustainability (EHS&S) consulting industry, 10 years M&A experience, and a degree in environmental science, geology, environmental engineering, or related field as applicable. Advanced degrees preferred, particularly an MBA.
* Thorough understanding of the M&A life cycle from investment thesis advising, to acquisition due diligence, integration assistance, post-acquisition corrective actions, and advising on exit strategies.
* Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain client relationships within the financial investment and corporate client communities through consultative sales techniques.
* Experienced with managing complex deal teams.
* Solid understanding of ESG, and how businesses are incorporating ESG into their programs and investment theses, particularly with clients in the financial sector.
* Capable of advising clients at the C-suite level regarding EHS risks, designing a due diligence program around a client’s risk profile, and catering to a client’s comfort levels and specific deal requirements.
* Assisting clients with deal negotiations, supporting financing requirements, supporting insurance underwriting, and navigating risk valuations and monetizing issues within the context of the deal.
* Strong organizational skills, as well as exemplary written and verbal communication skills are a must.
* It will be essential to be able to communicate with a high level of expertise with deal teams including investment bankers, private equity firms, M&A legal counsel, and insurance underwriters.
* Self-sufficient with excellent proposal writing and report writing skills, capable of producing high quality client-ready documents.
* Potential employees must pass a company-paid physical examination, drug-screen and have a valid driver's license.

**Qualifications considered as a “Plus”:*** Extensive experience with Private Equity and intimate knowledge of the PE life cycle.
* Experience with Oil & Gas (O&G) portfolio M&A projects is helpful (e.g., large downstream O&G acquisitions and divestitures, such as convenience stores/gas stations, as well as mid-stream O&G experience such as refineries and terminals).
* Aptitude and inclination for speaking engagements.
* Team player, with an inclination for leadership, team management, coordination, and direction.
* Responsive by nature, with a willingness to perform as necessary based on client needs and expectations.
* Active engagement with M&A industry associations and thought leadership forums


Antea®Group focuses on safety in all aspects of our operations, in the field, the office, and while traveling. The successful candidate must likewise consider safety as paramount and demonstrate a commitment to safety in all aspects of the job. *Physical Requirements / Work Environment - Maintain physical condition appropriate to the performance of assigned duties and responsibilities, which may include the following:** Sedentary to light work (typical office or administrative work)
* Frequently required to stand, sit, and walk for extended periods of time
* Occasional lifting and carrying of low (under 25lbs) to moderate (25-49lbs) weight objects
* Repetitive motions: substantial movements (motions) of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers (including reaching)
* Subject to inside environmental conditions (protection from weather conditions but not necessarily from temperature change)
* Operation of a motor vehicle

**COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS**
The annual salary range for this position is $150,000.00 - $180,000.00. Compensation will vary depending on the applicant’s job-related knowledge and skills, education, and work experience.  

Antea Group offers its full-time and part-time employee’s excellent benefits, including health, dental, and vision plans; life insurance; disability benefits; paid time off; 401(k); and a leading-edge wellness program. **EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER**
Antea Group is an EEO/AA employer committed to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, and any other protected status. **NO RECRUITERS PLEASE****NO VISA SPONSORSHIP AT THIS TIME**

title: Environmental Compliance Consultant (Open Call for CVs)
description:
Environmental Incentives' purpose is to create the conditions for human and natural communities to thrive. We design performance-driven approaches to conservation that empower public and private sector leaders to multiply their impact. We are environmental thought leaders pioneering a new wave of conservation, helping people get the most from their investments in the environment. Since our establishment in 2004, we have become a leading advisor on natural resource programs and policies across the country and internationally. Environmental Incentives is a certified B-Corporation with three offices across the United States (South Lake Tahoe, CA; Washington, DC; and Denver, CO).



Environment and Social Safeguarding (ES3) is a global USAID mission support mechanism providing technical assistance for environmental and social safeguards implementation and for related environmental and social requirements over the USAID program cycle. ES3 services are available to any operating unit on a buy-in basis. ES3 is implemented by The Cadmus Group LLC (Cadmus) as prime contractor and its subcontractors, including major subcontractor Environmental Incentives.


**OPPORTUNITY**



Environmental Incentives seeks to contract several junior, mid-level, senior, and expert consultants (Bachelor's and/or Master's; 3-20+ years of experience) to support USAID's Environment and Social Safeguarding project. This includes providing technical expertise of environmental regulations such CFR Regulation 216, preparing Environmental Monitoring and Mitigation Plans (EMMPs), Pesticide Evaluation Report and Safe Use Action Plans (PERSUAPs), and climate risk management analyses, among others.



The consultant will conduct technical reviews and editing of Reg. 216 documents, Initial Environmental Examinations (IEEs), Scoping Statements, and Environmental Assessments (EAs). Additionally, the consultant will provide recommendations on including climate considerations in project design documents and provide technical support to USAID and Mission staff.



Environmental Compliance consultants will be contracted based on work assignments from USAID. This is a remote assignment. The expected level of effort can range from 5 –10 hours a week and can fluctuate depending on USAID demand.


**RESPONSIBILITIES**



Provide Expert Technical Expertise


* Conduct technical reviews and editing of the following, but not limited to:
* Reg. 216 documents—including but not limited to IEEs, EAs, and/or amendments to same;
* Pesticide Evaluation Report and Safe Use Action Plans (PERSUAPs), amendments, and initial consultations and/or support for development of new mission-wide PERSUAPs. (Note: actual PERSUAP development would be undertaken as a separate ES3 activity.)
* Other documentation or analyses satisfying environmental requirements over the program cycle; e.g., climate risk screening documentation, FAA 118/119 Tropical Forest and Biodiversity Assessments.
* Provide technical assistance to USAID staff and partners developing and strengthening Reg. 216, CRM, or subsidiary documentation, including:
* Providing recommendations on including climate considerations in project design documents;
* Supporting the development of activity descriptions and other applicable solicitation documents to include CRM; and
* Assisting the inclusion of CRM into Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning (MEL) processes (e.g., MEL plans), as needed, to ensure climate risks are adaptively managed and that learning is captured and shared
* Develop Reg. 216, CRM, and subsidiary documents (e.g., EMMPs, SERFs, ERCs):
* Conduct Multilateral Development Bank (MDB) Project Reviews. ES3 may conduct short-format (~1 person- day) sustainability reviews of MDB projects as requested by the USAID AM or designee.
* Develop Training and Guidance; Materials Translation and/or Reproduction.


As requested, the consultant will support ES3 to:


* Develop environmental compliance/ESDM training materials, resources, and guidance;
* Deliver environmental compliance/ESDM training to Bureau, Mission staff and/or implementing partners;
* Translate, reproduce and/or print environmental compliance/management documentation, and/or environmental compliance/ESDM training and guidance materials. ES3 will procure resource and reference materials as needed; and
* Provide one-to-one training and capacity building on selected topics to BEU or additional Bureau staff, as directed.


**QUALIFICATIONS**


**Minimum Qualifications**


* Bachelor's or Master's in relevant subjects such as Environmental Science, Environmental Engineering, Engineering, Conservation Science or other related fields.
* 3-20 years of experience for a variety of junior, mid-level, and senior roles.
* Experience developing Environmental Monitoring and Mitigation Plans (EMMP) and Initial Environmental Examinations (IEE).
* Experience reviewing and amending Pesticide Evaluation Report and Safe Use Action Plans.
* Experience verifying Reg.216 compliance.


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Experience with USAID environmental compliance requirements, Reg. 216.
* Experience providing recommendations of climate considerations in project design documents.


**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**


* Clarity of thought and effective communication (verbal, written, visual) in English required.
* Demonstrated communication and coordination techniques that are appropriate to the nature, complexity, and scope of the issue at hand.
* Proven interpersonal and teamwork skills in a fast-paced multicultural setting as well as the ability to engage effectively and diplomatically in multi-cultural and politically complex environments.
* Ability to attend conference calls and virtual meetings with international clients outside of regular business hours.
* Proficiency with MS Office suite and Google Applications.


**ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS**


* Legally authorized to work in the United States with no restrictions.
* Eligible for USAID facility clearance.


**BASE STATION**



The position will be fully remote within the United States.


**HOW TO APPLY**



On a rolling basis throughout the application period, we will review applications and contact qualified candidates for additional information.

title: Application Engineer Air Quality
description:
This position is **NOT** an IT Position. It is specific to Air Quality Instrumentation.

**APPLICATIONS ENGINEER - AMBIENT AIR QUALITY INSTRUMENTS**

Met One Instruments, Inc. provides high performance instrumentation for regulatory compliance monitoring of ambient air quality according to global regulatory (i.e. US EPA and many others) standards. Our products measure criteria pollutant gasses and particulate matter, as well as meteorological parameters.

We are seeking a skilled applications engineer to provide technical applications and instrumentation support for our customer base, who are typically government regulatory agencies, engineering and consulting companies, and global systems integration and distribution partners.

**Position Summary**

Most of the applications engineering work is performed remotely at the customers’ site, or in one of our laboratory or factory locations. The remainder of support work will be handled remotely to support customers by email, phone and video conferencing. Strong technical aptitude and excellent customer facing skills are essential to succeed in this role. Established understanding of these applications and global understanding of ambient air monitoring regulations are a significant plus.

50-75% travel should be expected.

**Essential Functions**

⮚ Assists in research and development, calibration, repair, evaluation, experimentation, testing and assembly of mechanical/electromechanical prototypes & current products - including methods and materials. Analyze data, complete reports and support marketing material development.

⮚ Works closely with sales, marketing, engineering, and customer service team members to recommend product concepts, design changes or modifications to existing instrumentation, that help support customer needs.

⮚ Assist or lead the creation, review and/or revision of technical drawings, manuals, plans, specifications, including manual development for new products.

⮚ Assures system and product quality by following various and often changing testing methods to test finished-product, system capabilities and more

⮚ Perform detailed documentation by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information.

⮚ Keeps equipment operational by coordinating maintenance and repair services.

⮚ Collaborate with multi-disciplinary engineering, manufacturing, vendors and sales teams domestically and internationally as assigned.

⮚ Maintains systems and products databases.

⮚ Liaison and oversight with regulatory entities such as (not limited to) TUV, ROHS, Conformity European (CE).

⮚ Oversight of equipment field testing, liaison with site operators and provide service as needed.

Education & Experience

⮚ Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or a related field or an equivalent combination of education & experience.

⮚ 5+ years’ experience working in an engineering position with increasing responsibilities, preferably in manufacturing.

⮚ Superior computer skills, with proficiency in MS Word and MS Excel. Experience with Google Workspace a plus.

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:** 

⮚ Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills.

⮚ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

⮚ Strong understanding of ambient air quality measurement and instrumentation.

⮚ Excellent time management skills and ability to work with minimal supervision.

Met One Instruments Powered by Acoem is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

**All Agencies:** Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of Met One Instruments or any of our subsidiaries about this opening. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at Met One Instruments via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of Met One Instruments unless such search firms/employment agencies were officially engaged by Met One Instruments’ Human Resources team for this opening and has a valid agreement in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of Met One Instruments’ applicant process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $95,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Ambient Air Quality: 5 years (Preferred)

Willingness to travel:

* 50% (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Sr Civil / Wastewater Engineer
description:
What would it feel like to be part of a company guided by engaged and empowered employee-owners? To have the encouragement to run with innovative ideas? To know your opinion is valued and your voice is heard? Wouldn't you love to work in an atmosphere of transparency, respect, and accountability?

  

  

**Then you belong at SEH.**


**SEH is currently searching for a talented Sr Civil Engineer / Project Manager to join our Wastewater Engineering team!** This position would ideally be located within our Minnesota, Iowa, Nebraska or Wisconsin markets.Qualified candidates from other states may be considered, depending on skills and experience.


When you join SEH’s Wastewater team, you’ll be amongst a group of award-winning engineers who design facilities to meet the capacity of our communities and keep our lakes, rivers and waters clean. Our wastewater experts blend leading-edge technology with trusted solutions to maximize treatment performance and capacity. Join a dedicated team of wastewater experts who incorporate practicality and real-world wisdom into every project.


**Selling Points:**


* Our ESOP provides you an opportunity to own part of the company – 100% of our profits are re-invested in our Employee Owners!
* SEH supports you living your best life! We offer flexible work arrangements and schedules, so you have options that work for you.
* We want you to have options to celebrate the holidays important to you and your family through our flexible paid holiday program.
* Our Paid Family Leave benefit allows you to be there for the people you love - whether it’s the family you were born into or the family you chose.


**What you will be doing:**


* Plan and develop project scopes, objectives, and deliverables, in collaboration with stakeholders and team members.
* Define project requirements, identifying necessary resources, and establishing project timelines.
* Lead and manage project teams, providing guidance, direction, and support throughout the project lifecycle.
* Implement effective project management methodologies, tools, and processes to ensure efficient project execution.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to identify and mitigate project risks.
* Prepare and present project updates, reports, and recommendations to senior management.
* Foster positive relationships with clients, vendors, contractors, and other stakeholders to facilitate project success.
* Ensure the implementation of quality control procedures and continuous improvement initiatives.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies relevant to wastewater treatment.


**Required Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in civil or environmental engineering, or a related field.
* Ten (10) years of experience designing and/or managing wastewater or conveyance projects
* Proven experience as a Project Manager, specifically managing wastewater projects.
* Strong understanding of project management methodologies, tools, and best practices.
* Solid knowledge of wastewater treatment systems, equipment, and regulations.
* Licensed Professional Engineer in Minnesota, Iowa, Nebraska, Wisconsin or other Midwest state.


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Residence in Minnesota, Iowa, Nebraska or Wisconsin markets.Qualified candidates from other states may be considered, depending on skills and experience.
* Excellent leadership and team management skills, with the ability to motivate, guide, and mentor team members.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail.
* Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
* Proficiency in project management software and tools.


**Who we are**


Better Places. Clean Water. Renewing Infrastructure. Improving Mobility. Together with clients, we’re simplifying the world’s most complex challenges. And we’ve been doing this since 1927. SEH is employee-owned and our 900+ engineers, architects, planners, scientists and a wide array of professionals unite behind our core purpose of Building a Better World for All of Us®. You’ll find our employee-owners located across the U.S. and evidence of our work in nearly every state.


Base compensation is expected to be in the range of $125,000 and $145,000 based on skill set and experience. Check out our full benefits package at, SEH Hiring Journey


**The selected candidate must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. without requiring visa sponsorship now or in the future. We are unable to provide or take over sponsorship of an employment visa for this role.**


For confidential consideration, apply online or send your resume and salary requirements via fax to 651.490.2138. Please refer to the job title if you choose to fax.  

  

Short Elliott Hendrickson Inc. is committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees according to all applicable equal opportunity and affirmative action laws, directives and regulations of federal, state and local governing bodies and agencies. In keeping with this commitment, it is the policy of Short Elliott Hendrickson Inc. to base all employment decisions only on valid job requirements without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, genetic information, marital status, familial status, status with regard to public assistance, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or status as a covered veteran. Women and minorities encouraged to apply.


**Notice to Third Party Agencies:** SEH does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters, staffing services, or other employment agencies. If a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed Service Agreement by SEH’s Director of Talent Attraction expressly requesting recruitment/staffing services for specific position(s), SEH reserves the right to pursue and hire these candidates without any financial obligation to the recruiter, employment agency, or other staffing service. In such cases, any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers or other business leaders, are deemed to be the property of SEH.

description:
In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!
When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. title: Senior Coastal Engineer
description:
Date Posted: 1/15/24
Job Description:
We have an exciting full-time opportunity for a well-rounded and experienced Senior Coastal Engineer to support our Pacific operations. The preferred location for this position will be in close proximity to an EA office in either Anchorage or Fairbanks, Alaska. Alternate locations on the west coast or Hawaii, and potential for remote work accommodation will be considered for the right candidate.


**What you will do:**



The Coastal Engineer will lead and provide technical support on a wide variety of projects including assessment of vulnerability and risk related to sea level rise, design and permitting for nature-based solution and ecosystem restoration efforts, climate adaptation/resiliency relating to natural resources and built infrastructure, sediment management, wetland assessments, coastal process and sea-ice modeling, and/or dune/beach management plans. Experience designing coastal projects using nature-based solutions is preferred, but not required. Specific responsibilities will include:


* Management and oversight of design projects including development of specifications, cost estimating, and close coordination with restoration ecologists.
* Development of data collection strategies to support project goals.
* Oversight and coordination of field activities and subcontractors.
* Technical direction and review of technical documents and reports.
* Interfacing with a variety of regulatory agencies and other project stakeholders during all phases of project work.

**What you will need:**


* Bachelor of Science in coastal or ocean engineering, civil, environmental, or other related degree. Masters or PhD degree preferred.
* Professional Engineer license (Alaska preferred). Additional professional certifications are a plus (CFM, PMP, etc.)
* Ten or more years of experience in the following fields: coastal, ocean, civil, and/or environmental engineering. Varied experience with wide ranging geographies is preferred, including experience working in the Arctic and remote project locations.
* Activity in industry and trade associations (ASBPA, ASCE/COPRI, SAME, etc.) with regular presentation of professional papers/presentations is preferred.
* Extensive knowledge of Federal, State, and local permitting requirements for tidal and nearshore projects.
* Demonstrated project management experience with exceptional leadership, cost control, and oral/written communication skills.
* Ability to effectively collaborate across multiple geographies/operations with all levels of staff.
* Experience working with native Alaskan communities is a plus. Ability to clearly convey information at an appropriate level for contractors, clients, project team members, and project stakeholders across various geographic areas.
* Comfortable working in both office and field environments, including flexibility to meet short term travel requirements.


**What we provide:**


* EA prides itself on servant leadership, career development for staff in all areas, and maintaining work-life balance including flexible schedules. We have a tremendous base of positive client relationships. This has resulted in a stable backlog of projects and opportunities for growth. We also offer a fantastic benefits package!



#hybridremote


What We Offer


* 401k with Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP)
* Competitive Salary
* Low deductible health coverage for you and your family through Medical, Dental and Vision plans

Why Join EA?



At EA, our core values are openness, balance, and challenge and we strive to improve the quality of the environment in which we live, one project at a time. title: Early Career Environmental Engineer/Scientist/Geologist
description:
If you're looking for a fast-paced and dynamic work environment where you can apply your academic know-how, develop superior technical skills, and collaborate with top-notch industry professionals on a variety of exciting environmental projects, then GSI Environmental is the place for you!


At GSI, we seek the best and brightest talent and provide a supportive environment for career development. Our company culture is built on excellent service, teamwork, and technical collaboration to solve the most challenging environmental problems. We have an immediate opening for an entry-level Environmental Engineer/Scientist/Geologist. Come join our team!


**Responsibilities:**


* Perform fieldwork to support site characterization, environmental assessment, remediation, and restoration projects. Fieldwork may include conducting hydraulic tests, overseeing drilling, collection of groundwater, soil, and/or surface water samples and other field efforts (e.g., wetland delineation and biological surveys).
* Assist Project Technical Leads in the preparation of high-quality technical presentations, reports, letters, plans, and proposals.
* Coordinate with vendors, subcontractors, and analytical laboratories and independently perform subcontractor oversight.
* Support study designs for site characterization, assessment programs, and remedial options for site cleanup, as well as environmental due diligence, regulatory compliance, and permitting activities.
* Assist in the management, analysis, and interpretation of environmental data using statistical and data visualization tools.
* Perform data entry and QA/QC of data tables, maps, reports, and other work products.
* Independently perform research tasks with input from technical experts.
* Contribute to a team atmosphere through collaboration with technical experts, project managers, colleagues, and subcontractors.


**Job Perks:**


* Competitive salary and benefits.
* Quarterly and year-end bonuses.
* Flexible work environment with potential for remote work.
* On-the-job training, mentorship, and professional development.
* Participation in conferences, technical presentations, and papers.
* Teamwork atmosphere.

title: Mid-level Environmental Engineer/Scientist/Geologist
description:
If youre looking for a fast-paced and dynamic work environment where you can apply your academic know-how, develop superior technical skills, and collaborate with top-notch industry professionals on a variety of exciting environmental projects, then GSI Environmental is the place for you!


At GSI, we seek the best and brightest talent and provide a supportive environment for career development. Our company culture is built on excellent service, teamwork, and technical collaboration to solve the most challenging environmental problems. We have an immediate opening for a mid-level Environmental or Civil Engineer/Scientist/Geologist. Come join our team!

  


**Responsibilities:**


* Support study designs for site characterization, assessment programs, and remedial options for site cleanup, as well as environmental due diligence, regulatory compliance, and permitting activities.
* Manage, analyze, and interpret environmental data using statistical, data visualization, and/or modeling tools.
* Scope, coordinate, and perform fieldwork to support site characterization, environmental assessment, remediation, and restoration projects. Fieldwork may include conducting hydraulic tests, overseeing drilling, collection of groundwater, soil, and/or surface water samples and other field efforts (e.g., wetland delineation and biological surveys).
* Permitting and regulatory compliance support.
* Develop and track project budgets.
* Prepare high-quality technical presentations, reports, letters, plans, and proposals with minimal senior GSI staff oversight.
* Regularly interact with senior GSI staff, clients, and regulators to communicate project status.
* Coordinate with vendors, subcontractors, and analytical laboratories and independently perform subcontractor oversight.
* Perform and oversee data entry and QA/QC of data tables, maps, reports, and other work products.
* Independently perform research tasks with input from senior staff and technical experts.
* Contribute to a team atmosphere through collaboration with technical experts, project managers, colleagues, and subcontractors.


Qualifications:


* A Bachelors degree or higher in the Geosciences, Civil/Environmental Engineering, or related scientific field is required.
* Between 3 and 10 years of relevant professional work experience is preferred.
* Required skills and qualifications include:
* Experience with data management, database and office software, and data analysis.
* Excellent organizational, verbal, and written communication
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and organize complex datasets
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Valid drivers license and clear driving record
* Ability to travel domestically.


**Additional preferred skillsets and qualifications include:**


* Working knowledge of modeling programs (e.g., Leapfrog, MODFLOW, and MODFLOW-USG).
* Working knowledge of database platforms (e.g., EQuIS and PostgreSQL).
* Experience in water resources studies, infrastructure design, and management.
* Working knowledge of state and federal environmental regulations is preferred (e.g., RCRA and/or CERCLA, NEPA).
* 40-hour OSHA HAZWOPER certification
* MSHA certification


**Job Perks:**


* Competitive salary and benefits.
* Quarterly and year-end bonuses.
* Flexible work environment with potential for remote work.
* On-the-job training, mentorship, and professional development.
* Participation in conferences, technical presentations, and papers.
* Collaborative atmosphere.

title: Senior Environmental or Civil Engineer/Geologist/Scientist
description:
At GSI, our company culture is built on excellent service, teamwork, and technical collaboration to solve the most challenging environmental problems in our communities and throughout the world. We have an immediate opening for a Senior Environmental or Civil Engineer, Scientist, or Geologist. Come join our team!


**Responsibilities:**


* Directing and managing small to regional multi-disciplined projects
* Developing technical approaches for completing site characterization activities
* Preparing written proposals, managing project budgets, and communicating with client and project stakeholders
* Providing technical training and support to associate staff to ensure field tasks are completed with precision and consistency
* Working directly with clients to identify specific project needs and communicating results


**Qualifications/Requirements:**


* 10 or more years of related work experience required
* Bachelor's Degree or higher in Geology, Civil/Environmental Engineering, or related scientific field desirable
* Professional registration as applicable to one’s technical background
* Extensive experience overseeing environmental field investigations, including sampling various environmental media
* Experience in water resources studies, infrastructure design, and management
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Experience managing projects/tasks, including the preparation of proposals, cost tracking, and maintaining budgets
* 40-hour OSHA HAZWOPER certification
* Valid driver’s license and clear driving record
* Ability to travel


**Job Perks:**


* Competitive salary and benefits
* Quarterly and year-end bonuses
* Flexible work environment with potential for remote work
* On-the-job training, mentorship, and professional development
* Participation in conferences, technical presentations, and papers
* Collaborative atmosphere

title: Senior Engineer - Water/Wastewater
description:
TYLin is a globally recognized, full-service infrastructure consulting firm committed to providing innovative, cost-effective, constructible designs for the global infrastructure market. With over 3,000 employees throughout the Americas, Asia, and Europe, the firm provides support on projects of varying size and complexity. Together, we enhance conventional designs with smarter, more resilient systems. We provide people with better mobility. We steward precious resources by finding more sustainable solutions.
Job Summary
Join TYLin's dynamic Greeley and Hansen Water Solutions Team as a Senior Engineer and dive into impactful projects that shape the world of water. This role entails managing various projects, providing expertise in project delivery and fostering team growth while upholding our core values.
Responsibilities & Qualifications* Develop and maintain client relationships, understanding their needs to ensure expectations are met.
* Manage multiple technical assignments, leading teams to deliver projects to client satisfaction within schedule and budget constraints.
* Exhibit technical excellence in planning studies, designs, program management, procurement/bid assistance, and design services for water/wastewater systems.
* Lead business development pursuits, preparing proposals, building new relationships, and contributing to team growth goals.


Qualifications* Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field.
* P.E. license in IL, WI, IN, OK, KY, or MI, with a minimum of 10 years of relevant experience in water/wastewater treatment and climate/flood resiliency.


Embark on a rewarding career with TYLin, where your contributions will impact communities and create lasting change in the world of water.  

Additional Information
We believe in recognizing the unique value that each individual brings to our team. As such, the job title and ultimate compensation for this role will be thoughtfully aligned with the depth of your experience, the breadth of your skills, and the genuine enthusiasm you bring to the position. We are committed to fostering an environment where your contributions are both acknowledged and rewarded appropriately. Join us in shaping a rewarding future together!  

#water #wastewater #LI-Hybrid #LI-Remote
TYLin offers a comprehensive total rewards package. Our benefits include extensive medical, disability and life insurance coverage, continuing education benefits, paid time off, employee assistance program and a retirement savings plan with company matching contributions.  

We encourage all candidates to explore our total rewards offering.  

TYLin is an equal opportunity employer, and we prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type as protected by federal, provincial, state or local laws. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. The company and its employees are required to comply with all local health authority, legal or lawful client requirements.

title: Project Engineer - Water
description:

With over 3,000 employees throughout the Americas, Asia, and Europe, the firm provides support on projects of varying size and complexity. Job Summary
TYLin is seeking a Project Engineer to join our TYLin | Greeley and Hansen Water Solutions Team. The Project Engineer will support project teams and the firm’s key regional clients in the planning, design and construction of complex and innovative combined sewer, wastewater conveyance, and wastewater treatment projects. Projects may also include water distribution and storage, reclaimed water, and stormwater management systems.
Responsibilities & Qualifications

* Experience in the preparation of contract documents, including drawings and specifications, for complex water and wastewater projects.
* Experience in the study and design of water and wastewater conveyance systems including potable water conveyance, wastewater conveyance, pump stations and preparation of hydraulic design calculations.
* Experience in site design associated with urban infrastructure projects.
* Experience working on and coordinating with an interdisciplinary team with other engineers, including structural, geotechnical, electrical, mechanical, instrumentation and control, architecture, etc.

  

Additional Information
We believe in recognizing the unique value that each individual brings to our team. As such, the job title and ultimate compensation for this role will be thoughtfully aligned with the depth of your experience, the breadth of your skills, and the genuine enthusiasm you bring to the position. title: Water Resources Engineer
description:
A.D. Marble is looking for talented individuals to join our team. Why A.D. Marble? Here are the top five reasons:

1. We offer an excellent benefits package, which includes a flexible and autonomous work environment and long-term hybrid work policy. This position also has the option of being 100% remote.

2. We foster a close-knit collaborative culture. Our success is never the work of just one person; it is always a team win. If you are tired of being a number, this is the company for you.

3. We are committed to Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion (ED&I) as we build our team. We are proud to support H-1B visas.

4. We believe that challenges and lessons learned are necessary to truly grow and shape who you want to become, personally and professionally.

5. We know how to have FUN and support our local communities.

For more details, go to www.admarble.com.

A.D. Marble is seeking a Water Resource Engineer with 5 to 10 years of experience in the Transportation, Land Development, or Floodplain industries to fill a full-time or part-time position. This position allows for a flexible/hybrid work environment from our Pennsylvania or Maryland offices, or to be fully remote if elsewhere in the United States.

Applicants require the ability to perform a variety of assignments, including hydrology and hydraulics of roadway structures, hydrology and hydraulics of stream mitigation sites, stormwater management and erosion and sediment control plan development, NPDES permits, water obstruction permits, drainage design, watershed assessments, and associated reporting with all tasks. Check our website for example projects in which you could be involved: https://admarble.com/projects/.

Duties will include:

· Hydrology and Hydraulic Analysis using HEC-RAS

· Stormwater Management Design

· Erosion and Sediment Pollution Control Design

· Stream Mitigation Design

· Drainage Design

Skills and abilities should include:

· B.S. in Civil Engineering, Environmental Engineering, Water Resource Engineering, or related discipline

· E.I.T certification is required; P.E. is a plus

· MicroStation or AutoCAD experience is required

· HEC-RAS experience is required

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills

· Ability to manage multiple tasks, take initiative, and work in a team environment

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Relocation assistance
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Application Question(s):

* Have you used HEC-RAS within the past 2 years? Applicants who do not answer yes to this question will not be considered.

Experience:

* Civil engineering: 5 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* PE or EIT license? (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: HSSE Engineer
description:
JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally.
  
  

Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.
  
  

This role is remote within the US
  
  

What this job involves –
  
We are currently seeking an HSSE Environmental Compliance Engineer to join one of our Work Dynamics Account teams. The HSSE Environmental Engineer position is a key member of the Account Team that supports environmental needs for managing environment related management services. This position will also assist the HSSE Manager in overall Safety Culture growth. This position has the option of being hybrid or remote, however there will be some travel requirements (primarily to the Eagan, MN client facilities - est. 10-20% travel). JLL and client require the successful candidate have previous experience with air permitting, and water management programs (wastewater/stormwater), preferable at both federal and state levels. Familiarity with Minnesota's environmental compliance practices is a plus.
  
Develop, implement, monitor, modify, and document environmental compliance programs including but not limited to: Solid & Hazardous Wastes, DOT Hazmat, Water Quality, Air Quality, RICE NESHAP, Community Right-to-Know, Pollution Prevention, and applicable Employee Training.
  
Prepare or oversee the preparation of environmental reports, permit applications and other submittals as required by law. Serve as the focal point for all environmental inspections by regulatory authorities.
  
Monitor and ensure all applicable Environment permits/certificates/licenses/approvals are valid, current, and in place.
  
Manage, supervise, and direct non-recurring environmental issues and projects as they arise, including all related regulatory requirements.
  
Ensure that incidents, injuries, spills or releases, good catch/near miss, and other events are captured, and the data is managed and reported per JLL and client requirements.
  
Assist the other members of the HSSE Team to provide support to other sites as appropriate.
  
Oversee and work with the JLL Hazardous Waste Technician on hazardous / regulated waste storage, disposal, and transportation compliance issues, ensure that applicable environmental requirements are adhered to. Become the primary point of contact for Environmental requirements and activities for the account. Communicate HSSE needs and results to the Account Leadership and client Team.
  
Maintain documentation describing the HSSE program (playbooks, procedures, etc.) and records required by JLL, regulation, and the client.
  
Play a lead role in the continued development and refinement of JLL’s HSE culture and training programs on the account.
  
Prepare / Update all monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting requirements on HSSE aspects and activities to the client.
  
Provide review and feedback on performance.
  
  

Desired experience and technical skills
  
  

**Required:**  

8-10 years of proven history of implementation of environmental, health, and safety systems and processes
  
JLL and client require the successful candidate have previous experience with air permitting, and water management programs (wastewater/stormwater), preferable at both federal and state levels. Familiarity with Minnesota's environmental compliance practices is a plus.
  
Good communication skills, both verbal and written, with ability to deal with all people at all organizational levels, internally and externally.
  
Knowledge of technology tools such as Word, Power Point, Excel, SharePoint, etc.
  
  

**Preferred:**  

Bachelor’s degree in safety management, industrial hygiene, environmental science, chemical, environmental engineering, or relevant field.
  
Good English writing and speaking capability (ability to speak Spanish or Portuguese also a major positive).
  
  

**Salary Range:** $80-86k annually with bonus potential
  
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!
  
  

Personalized benefits that support personal well-being and growth:
  
  

JLL recognizes the impact that the workplace can have on your wellness, so we offer a supportive culture and comprehensive benefits package that prioritizes mental, physical and emotional health.
  
  

About JLL –
  
  

We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities.
  
  

Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.
  
  

Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.

title: Senior Environmental Technologist
description:
#### **FTD Solutions**


FTD solutions is redefining the way industrial facilities approach solving problems and driving sustainability performance. FTD solutions leverages patented digital twin technology to efficiently provide insight that enables maximizing capacity utilization, optimizing resource efficiency, and reducing costs. FTD's water management application (WMA), employed by leading semiconductor companies, plays a catalytic role in every manufacturer's sustainability journey. It is evolving into a complete facility management application (FMA). The solution enables digital transformation of what was previously one of the most underserved areas of facility data management and decision-enabling. The FMA helps industries' environmental aspirations become reality.


For these same clients, FTD provides solutions to their most challenging water and wastewater problems. We have an engineering team that does troubleshooting, model analysis, strategy development, solution definition and conceptual development of solutions.

#### **Job Description**


The Senior Environmental Technologist would be a critical member of the FTD team primarily responsible to lead technically in projects with a focus water management, and wastewater treatment. This leadership will be supported by the CTO. The Senior Environmental Technologist will work with the CEO and CTO and Project Managers to facilitate the contribution of FTD team, laboratories, and External Experts into projects as needed. This person will be responsible for technical leadership, engineering team leadership, research, analysis, report writing and technical presentations. The Senior Environmental Technologist will also work with project engineers in support of the development of models, calculations, presentations and reports.


The Senior Environmental Technologist reports to the CTO.

*If you consider yourself the Water Expert, interested in making positive environmental impact worldwide as part of the great team of experts in the company with strong culture and no politics, join us for this exciting journey!*

#### **Minimum Qualifications**


M.S. or Ph.D. Degree in Environmental or Chemical Engineering.


Extensive experience in water technology, including MBR and RO.


15 years of work experience is preferred.

**Integrity | Expertise | Creativity | Collaboration**


#LI-Remote

title: Environmental Remediation Engineer
description:
**ABOUT THE TEPA COMPANIES**


The Tepa Companies are wholly owned subsidiaries of the Paskenta Band of Nomlaki Indians. They deliver comprehensive and sustainable solutions to federal, state, local and private-sector clients throughout the United States. The tribally owned companies work independently and collaboratively to provide wide-ranging construction, engineering, environmental, industrial, staffing and technology services. Established in 2005, the Tepa Companies employ people in offices across the United States, including California, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Missouri, and Texas.


When you join Tepa Companies, you have the opportunity to expand your entrepreneurial skill set while growing professionally alongside the best in the industry. You will have the opportunity to impact your team, the organization as a whole and subsequently, our Tribe.


We seek out top talent to provide the best services for our clients. We focus on being a responsible company for our employees and their families by creating a culture that reflects our core values and offering competitive pay and benefits packages. Tepa Companies is an equal opportunity employer and encourages diversity in the workforce.

 **LOCATION -** Hybrid or Remote

 **ABOUT THE JOB**


Tepa Companies is seeking an Environmental Remediation Engineer to support multi-year environmental remediation projects for various federal agencies. Remediation engineering expertise will be applied to the investigation/characterization, remedial design, remedy implementation/construction, operations and maintenance and/or long-term monitoring phases of the CERCLA, RCRA Corrective Action and/or state regulatory program processes.


Essential Job Functions:

* Engineering support to environmental remediation projects.
* Preparation of planning documents, designs, reports and as-builts.
* Remedial alternative evaluation and design of various in-situ and ex-situ treatment approaches.
* Prepare design calculations, specifications, and cost estimates.
* Preparation of subcontractor scopes of work and specifications.
* Solicitation, evaluation, and procurement of subcontractors for investigation or remediation projects.
* Lead or support in-house field teams conducting remediation activities.
* Oversight of subcontractors conducting remediation activities.
* Ability to support multiple projects and tasks concurrently, while adhering to cost and schedule.
* Support proposal efforts.

**WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR**

* Bachelor’s degree in an engineering discipline (a master’s degree is preferred).
* Ability to obtain a Professional Engineer (PE) license within 2 years.
* Minimum of 3 years of environmental remediation experience providing engineering support to projects under CERCLA, RCRA Corrective Action and/or state regulatory programs.
* Excellent time management and organization skills, including the ability to handle multiple tasks, prioritize and keep organized to ensure timely and accurate work.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to work in a team setting and individually.
* Strong self-motivation and initiative.
* Experience and/or familiarity with the following environmental remediation practice areas:

* Treatment technologies for a variety of contaminants to include in-situ aerobic and anaerobic enhanced bioremediation, in-situ chemical oxidation, ex-situ treatment systems (e.g., pump and treat, air sparge, SVE, etc.) and remedial excavations.
* Identification, selection and design of remedial technologies and approaches.
* Remedial alternative cost estimate development.
* Remedy implementation oversight.
* Operations and maintenance and performance monitoring evaluation and optimization.
* Investigation and/or remediation of PFAS impacted sites.
* Various multi-media investigative techniques to include high resolution site characterization (HRSC).
* Screening levels and the risk assessment process.
