title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
**Senior Manager: Sustainability**


**Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges.**


Honeywell’s deep roots in solving the world’s most difficult environmental, social and governance (ESG) challenges stem from our team’s strong foundation as an industrial technology innovator and leader. But it is not just about what we have done with our innovation. It is about what we are doing now and what we will do next.


“The future is what you make it.”


When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers that are developing sustainable technologies that will accelerate the energy transition to net-zero carbon.

  

  

**Are you ready to help us shape the future? Become a #futureshaper!**

We have an immediate opportunity for a **Senior Manager, Sustainability** to join Honeywell Sustainability Center of Excellence (HS-CoE) in Madurai. The mission of the CoE is to drive sustainability regulatory compliance, process excellence through the application of best-in-class tools and practices and build world class domain expertise in Life Cycle Assessments (LCA) and Sustainability Engineering. The Senior Manager role is responsible for driving the strategies for the COE aligned to the business sustainability priorities, customer and regulatory requirements.

  

**Roles and Responsibilities.**

* Drive the deployment of Life Cycle Analysis (LCA) and Sustainability engineering practices for HON across buildings and industrial automation portfolios.


* Collaborate with the R&D, engineering, supply chain teams across businesses to drive the LCA priorities based on the customer asks and regulatory requirements.


* Establish an industry partnership with the LCA and EPD suppliers for capability development and productivity.


* Partner with HON internal PLM teams and IT to identify synergies and develop databases and workflows for automated sustainability assessments.


* Closely follow emerging sustainability regulations, business and technological opportunities and challengesfor HON


* Plan and execute Annual Operating Plan (AOP) aligned to business goals.


* Ensure sustainability programs meet all quality metrics, timelines and budgets.


* A leader with strong interest and knowledge on Honeywell’s sustainability priorities, industry standards and regulatory requirements.
* Leading continuous improvement efforts through the institutionalization of productivity practices that can accelerate assessments and reduce cycle time.


* Responsible to define and execute the competency development plans.
* Responsible for the Honeywell Performance Development (HPD), Global Compensation Planning (GCP), Management Resource Reviews (MRR), Succession planning, Technical Resource Reviews (TRR) and rewards and recognition for the engineers in the COE


* Driving effective people practices through effective hiring strategy, rewarding, motivating & retention strategy and talent differentiation for high performance.


* A good people leader, quick to identify people problems, fosters teamwork and ensures transparency and fairness in all actions.


* Good communicator of vision, ideas and work requirement. Should have demonstrated transformational results (Innovation, Productivity, Technology) through cross collaboration.

**Education / Job Requirements:**


* Engineering degree with 15 plus years of experience in product and application development, consulting and sustainability practice


* Experience in managing large engineering teams.


* Proven record of successful cross functional experiences


* Strong program management, process management, technology & strategy management skills
* Excellent executive communication and leadership skills


* Strong sustainability mindset: Ability to anticipate changes in customer's needs and regulatory requirements


* Strong people skills with the ability to facilitate diverse groups, help negotiate priorities, and resolve conflicts.


* Ability to work in highly matrix environment and manage constant change and evolution


* Strategic thinking and effective management implementation on complex projects

### **Additional Information**

* **JOB ID:** HRD224431
* **Category:** Engineering
* **Location:** ELCOT- SEZ, PLOT NO.1, ILANDAIKULAM RING ROAD,NEAR : PANDIKOIL, KARUPPAYURANI POST,Madurai,TAMIL NADU,625020,India
* Exempt

title: Software Engineer
description:
As an employee at Thomson Reuters, you will play a role in shaping and leading the global knowledge economy. Our technology drives global markets and helps professionals around the world make decisions that matter. As the world’s leading provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career. Our Service Management function is transforming into a truly global, data and standards-driven organization, employing best-in-class tools and practices across all disciplines of Technology Operations.

**About The Role**
------------------

* Leads multiple and/or significant projects, programs and business initiatives, demonstrating creativity and ingenuity
* Delivers end-to-end technical solutions and solves complex problems that may be ambiguous in nature
* Determines work priorities based on general direction from managers
* May manage budget for projects or programs within area
* Influences multiple cross functional project teams to execute and adopt a point of view for ideas and initiatives
* Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience
* Trains and mentors colleagues including Sr. Software Engineers
* Strategic focus
* Plans, designs, develops and tests software systems or applications for software enhancements and new products
* Writes code that establishes and enhances coding specifications, typically for software programs and systems that have little or no precedent.
* Delivers software features with exceptional quality, meeting designated release plans and delivery commitments.
* Works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors.
* Owns a functional area. Breaks large requests down into sub-tasks, gives higher-level status updates. Writes test plans.
* Takes operational responsibility. Sets measurable goals and meets them. Performs code reviews
* Participates in developing technical / business approaches and new or enhanced technical tools.
* Sets software engineering project schedules, defines project parameters and tasks and monitors project tasks.
* Develops and keeps the "vision" of the project, leading others toward its completion.
* Resolves a wide range of issues in creative ways.
* Owns the development and rollout for an entire product, or large project.
* Leads the daily work of assigned work group / team. Recommends modifications to the daily operations of the assigned work group / team. Makes needed adjustments to short-term priorities.
* Networks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise. Interacts with direct team of accountability, peers and/or managers in other teams. May interact with vendors and/or customers to share information and improve workflow processes.

  

**About You*** Contributes to the development of new principles and concepts and Business Unit strategy
* Develops and maintains strong relationships and negotiates with internal and external customers to identify future needs
* Has extensive knowledge and skills gained through wide-ranging experiences in a field that requires diverse practices or procedures.
* Recognized expert in their functional area or geography
* Deep knowledge of complex product, market and function in own area
* In-depth understanding of a Business Unit or function
* Works on issues of a diverse scope where analysis of situations requires skills and understanding of current industry trends
* Participates in developing technical / business approaches and new or enhanced technical tools.
* Contributes to recommendations where technology transformation can spark growth.
* Explores applying new technologies and approaches in innovative ways to software solutions and provides recommendations.
* Determines operational feasibility by evaluating analysis, problem definition, requirements, solution development, and proposed solutions.
* Breaks down business requirements into functional requirements considering security and operational efficiency of the solution
* Supports and develops software engineers by providing advice, coaching, and educational opportunities.
* Leads significant projects, programs and business initiatives, demonstrating creativity and ingenuity
* Determines work priorities based on general direction from managers
* Provides specialist advice to middle and senior management to resolve complex issues.
* May informally lead the daily work of assigned work group / team. Recommends modifications to the daily operations of the assigned work group / team. Makes needed adjustments to short-term priorities.
* Networks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise. Interacts with direct team of accountability, peers and/or managers in other teams. May interact with vendors and/or customers to share information and improve workflow processes.
* Shows passion for efficiency and collaboration, with a history of establishing great relationships
* Shows commitment and drive for quality, technical excellence and results
* Models curiosity and displays passion to constantly learn new things
 **What's in it For You?**  

  

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

**Hybrid Work Model:** We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected

**Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country, Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.

**Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.

**Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.

**Social Impact:** Ten employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.

**Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

*Optional* - compensation. Compensation may only be relevant for certain positions and is recommended for use primarily by Sales:

 **Compensation** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success.


=========================================================================

 **Other notes about the job description:**  

  

**Important note! Workday automatically adds the Thomson Reuters boiler and accessibility statement.** You do not need to add those in.  

  

**Questions?** Click for Job Ad Best Practices, Gender Neutral Guidelines and Gender Decoder for Job Ads posted on the Global TA Atrium Page. For additional support, please contact the Employer Branding Team or review hiring and recruiting policies in Workday. For TR2 roles and above in Zug, please remove this language from the "Wellbeing section" - work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country.

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
As an employee at Thomson Reuters, you will play a role in shaping and leading the global knowledge economy. Our technology drives global markets and helps professionals around the world make decisions that matter. As the world’s leading provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career. title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**About the Role**


In this opportunity as **a Senior Software Engineer**, you will be responsible for successfully implementing the software package and solutions for clients across geographies. This position is ideally suitable for a candidate with knowledge of .NET development.


KEY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES -

**Implementation**

* Identify customer needs, tailor a proposed solution to meet such needs & implement the solution.
* Design, develop, configure, test & deploy the product.
* Maintain good working relationships with stakeholders throughout the end-to-end process.
* Engage from project kick off to the project closure.
* Train the customer on product functionality and on how to use it meaningfully.
* Assist in production preparation and conduct project go-live activities.
* Provide go-live support and ongoing support for escalated problems.
* Plan and organize handover to product support team after production go-live.

**Collaboration**

* Work with different teams within Thomson Reuters (development, support, product management) collaboratively for product/solution improvements, enhancements and resolution of issues.


KEY DELIVERABLES -

* Deliver projects successfully within scope according to schedule individually and as a team.
* Manage key stakeholders and strive to achieve excellence in customer satisfaction.
* Provide support to other groups within TR (customer support, technology and product dev teams)
* Contribute to Practice / Competency building initiatives.
* Mentor junior engineers.

**About You**


You’re a fit for the role of **Senior Software Engineer** if your background includes:

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or software engineering
* Relevant experience of 3 to 10 years of software development knowledge; Experience in the areas of Implementation, Product Development, Support.
* Competent with all Microsoft Office applications
* Technical knowhow of SQL.
* .NET/ C# development experience is an advantage.
* Knowledgeable on TRs products or competitor products is an advantage.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills – written and verbal.
* Detail oriented, good planning and organization skills, time management
* Experience working in and collaborating with a globally distributed team environment.
* Hands on problem solver, excellent communication, analytical and presentation skills.
* Possess a positive learning attitude.

**What’s in it For You?**


You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country, Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.

**Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.  

  

#LI-AD1

  

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.


We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

**Accessibility**


As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.


We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
**Description**
---------------


As an employee at Thomson Reuters, you will play a role in shaping and leading the global knowledge economy. Our technology drives global markets and helps professionals around the world make decisions that matter. As the world’s leading provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career. Our Service Management function is transforming into a truly global, data and standards-driven organization, employing best-in-class tools and practices across all disciplines of Technology Operations.

**About The Role**

* Leads multiple and/or significant projects, programs and business initiatives, demonstrating creativity and ingenuity

* Determines work priorities based on general direction from managers

Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Rf Engineer
description:
As an RF (Radio Frequency) Field Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, maintaining, and optimizing wireless communication systems. Your primary focus will be on radio frequency and microwave systems, ensuring optimal performance, coverage, and reliability. You will work in the field, collaborating with a multidisciplinary team, and may be required to travel to various locations to install, troubleshoot, and maintain RF equipment.

Key Responsibilities:

* **RF Design and Optimization:**
* Design and optimize RF networks for maximum coverage, capacity, and performance.
* Conduct site surveys to assess the physical and environmental factors affecting RF propagation.
* **Site Installation and Commissioning:**
* Install and commission RF equipment, antennas, and associated hardware at designated sites.
* Ensure proper integration with existing systems and adherence to technical specifications.
* **Troubleshooting and Maintenance:**
* Identify and resolve RF-related issues through thorough troubleshooting and diagnostic procedures.
* Perform routine maintenance activities to ensure the ongoing functionality of RF systems.
* **Interference Management:**
* Investigate and mitigate RF interference issues, ensuring minimal impact on communication systems.
* Implement measures to minimize external interference and maintain optimal signal quality.
* **Documentation:**
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of RF network configurations, installations, and modifications.
* Prepare technical reports, including signal strength measurements, interference analysis, and system performance evaluations.
* **Collaboration and Communication:**
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including network engineers, project managers, and technicians, to achieve project goals.
* Communicate effectively with clients, providing technical support and addressing their concerns.
* **Training:**
* Provide training and support to other team members or clients on RF equipment operation, maintenance, and troubleshooting.
* **Regulatory Compliance:**
* Ensure compliance with regulatory standards and guidelines related to RF communication systems.

Qualifications and Skills:

* Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Telecommunications, or a related field.
* Proven experience in RF design, installation, and troubleshooting.
* Proficient in the use of RF testing equipment and tools.
* Strong understanding of wireless communication principles and protocols.
* Familiarity with regulatory requirements and standards in the RF field.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: ₹10,000.00 - ₹40,000.00 per month

Benefits:

* Provident Fund

Work Location: In person

title: Project Engineer
description:
**Job Description: Project Engineer**

We are seeking a dedicated and skilled Project Engineer to join our dynamic team. The Project Engineer will play a crucial role in planning, executing, and completing various engineering projects within our organization. This role involves coordinating and collaborating with cross-functional teams, ensuring project timelines, budgets, and quality standards are met, and contributing to the successful delivery of projects.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**1.** **Project Planning and Cordination:**

a. Collaborate with project stakeholders to define project scope, objectives, and requirements.

b. Develop detailed project plans, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation.

c. Coordinate with various teams, including design, procurement, construction, and quality assurance, to ensure smooth project execution.

d. Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to minimize project disruptions.

**2.** **Technical Expertise:**

a. Provide technical input and guidance throughout the project lifecycle.

b. Review and analyse project designs, specifications, and drawings to ensure compliance with industry standards and project requirements.

c. Collaborate with design teams to optimize project designs for efficiency and cost-effectiveness.

d. Stay updated on industry trends, technological advancements, and best practices to enhance project outcomes.

**3.** **Budget and Resource Management:**

a. Monitor project budgets, expenses, and resource utilization to ensure adherence to financial constraints.

b. Identify opportunities for cost savings without compromising project quality.

c. Work closely with procurement to source necessary materials, equipment, and services in a timely manner.

**4.** **Quality Assurance:**

a. Implement quality control procedures to maintain project deliverables' high standard.

b. Perform regular inspections and quality checks to identify and address any deviations from specifications.

c. Collaborate with quality assurance teams to conduct necessary testing and validation activities.

**5.** **Communication and Reporting:**

a. Maintain clear and consistent communication with project stakeholders, including clients, team members, and management.

b. Provide regular project status updates, reports, and presentations detailing progress, challenges, and solutions.

c. Address any concerns or inquiries from stakeholders promptly and professionally.

**6.** **Health Safety and Environment Compliance:**

a. Ensure all project activities adhere to relevant health, safety, and environmental regulations.

b. Identify potential hazards and develop safety protocols to minimize risks to personnel and the environment.

c. Collaborate with safety officers to conduct safety assessments and implement necessary measures.

**Qualification and Requirements:**

a. Bachelor's degree in Engineering (Civil, Mechanical, Electrical, or related field).

b. Proven experience as a Project Engineer or similar role in engineering project management.

c. Strong understanding of engineering principles, project management methodologies, and industry standards.

d. Proficient in project management software tools and Microsoft Office Suite.

e. Excellent communication, leadership, and teamwork skills.

f. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

g. Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively.

h. Knowledge of relevant health, safety, and environmental regulations.

**Preferred Qualification:**

a. Professional Engineer (PE) certification.

b. Master's degree in Engineering or Project Management.

c. Experience with relevant project management software (e.g., Microsoft Project).

d. Familiarity with codes, regulations, and permitting processes.

e. Previous experience in a construction/manufacturing/mechanical environment.

**Location: Raipur and Ranchi**

If you are a dedicated and proactive engineering professional with a passion for delivering successful projects on time and within budget, we invite you to apply for.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From ₹25,000.00 per month

title: Structural Engineer
description:
* nalyse configurations of the basic components of a structure
* calculate the pressures, stresses and strains that each component, such as a beam or lintel, will experience from other parts of the structure due to human use or environmental pressures such as weather or earthquakes
* consider the strength of various materials, e.g. timber, concrete, steel and brick, to see how their inclusion may necessitate a change of structural design
* liaise with other designers, including architects, to agree on safe designs and their fit with the aesthetic concept of the construction
* examine structures at risk of collapse and advise how to improve their structural integrity, such as recommending removal or repair of defective parts or rebuilding the entire structure
* make drawings, specifications and computer models of structures for building contractors
* work with geotechnical engineers to investigate ground conditions and analyse results of soil sample and in situ tests
* liaise with construction contractors to ensure that newly erected buildings are structurally sound
* apply expert knowledge of the forces that act on various structures
* use computers and computer-aided design (CAD)

title: Site Engineer
description:
Job Listing: Site Engineer Intern at Zet Realty

Location: Chennai, India

About Zet Realty:

Zet Realty is a visionary residential construction and development company in Chennai, committed to delivering sustainable, innovative, and high-quality living spaces. We emphasize exceptional craftsmanship and environmental stewardship in all our projects. As part of our mission to nurture the next generation of construction professionals, we are offering an exciting opportunity for a Site Engineer Intern to join our team and gain hands-on experience in the field.

Job Description:

The Site Engineer Intern will support our site engineering team in overseeing various aspects of our construction projects. This internship is designed to provide practical experience in construction management, project planning, and on-site supervision. You will work under the guidance of experienced professionals and participate in a range of activities to ensure the successful execution of our residential projects.

Key Responsibilities:

* Assist in overseeing daily construction activities, ensuring they comply with project plans, specifications, and safety standards.
* Support in coordinating with contractors, architects, and project managers to resolve any site issues.
* Help in monitoring project progress and report any discrepancies or delays to the senior site engineer.
* Participate in site meetings and contribute to discussions on project planning, execution, and problem-solving.
* Assist in maintaining project documentation, including site reports, logs, and progress updates.
* Learn to interpret construction drawings and plans, gaining insight into the technical aspects of residential construction.

Requirements:

* Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Diploma program in Civil Engineering or a related field.
* Strong academic record with a keen interest in construction management and engineering.
* Basic knowledge of construction practices, project management, and relevant software (e.g., AutoCAD).
* Excellent communication, teamwork, and problem-solving skills.
* Eager to learn, with a proactive attitude towards work and professional development.
* Availability to commit to a full-time internship for a duration of 6 months.

What We Offer:

* A structured internship program with exposure to various aspects of residential construction.
* Mentorship from experienced site engineers and construction professionals.
* The opportunity to apply theoretical knowledge in a practical setting, contributing to real-world projects.
* A stipend to cover daily expenses during the internship period.

How to Apply:

If you are an enthusiastic and dedicated engineering student looking to kickstart your career in construction, we encourage you to apply for this exciting internship opportunity.

Join us at Zet Realty for an enriching internship experience that will pave the way for your future in construction and engineering. We look forward to your application!

title: Engineer
description:
R&D - Mech
 Navi Mumbai (On-Site)
 Executive
  
Job Description


As a Hardware Verification and Validation Engineer at our drone company, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality, reliability, and performance of the hardware components and systems used in our unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs). You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, and manufacturing, to develop and execute comprehensive verification and validation plans and processes. Your expertise in hardware testing and analysis will contribute to the successful development and deployment of our drone products.


Responsibilities:

* Develop verification and validation plans: Collaborate with the engineering and design teams to define and develop comprehensive plans for verifying and validating the hardware components and systems used in UAVs.
* Conduct hardware testing: Design and execute test procedures to verify the functionality, performance, and reliability of hardware components, such as flight control systems, sensors, communication devices, power systems, and other subsystems.
* Perform functional and performance testing: Conduct tests to ensure that hardware components meet design specifications, functional requirements, and performance targets. Evaluate the system''s behaviour under normal and extreme operating conditions.
* Design and implement test setups: Develop test fixtures, equipment, and setups to facilitate efficient and accurate hardware testing. Ensure test setups simulate real-world usage scenarios and environmental conditions.
* Document and report test results: Record detailed test data, observations, and outcomes. Prepare comprehensive reports summarising the test results, including any identified issues, deviations, or improvements needed. Communicate findings to relevant stakeholders.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Work closely with the engineering, design, and manufacturing teams to address hardware issues and provide input for design improvements. Participate in design reviews, root cause analysis, and failure investigations.
* Ensure compliance and quality standards: Ensure that the hardware components and systems meet industry standards, safety regulations, and quality requirements. Stay updated on relevant standards and regulations related to drone hardware.
* Develop and maintain test documentation: Create and update test procedures, test cases, and test protocols. Maintain accurate records of testing activities, test configurations, and test equipment.
* Support manufacturing processes: Collaborate with the manufacturing team to develop production test plans and procedures. Assist in the setup and calibration of test equipment and fixtures.
* Continuously improve testing processes: Identify opportunities to enhance test methodologies, streamline processes, and improve efficiency. Propose and implement changes to optimise the verification and validation activities.


Requirements:

* Education and Experience:
* Bachelors in Mechanical/Aerospace/Aeronautical Engineering.
* Proven experience in hardware verification and validation, preferably in the aerospace, robotics, or drone industry.
* Hardware Testing Skills:
* Strong understanding of hardware testing methodologies, techniques, and best practices.
* Experience with test equipment and tools such as oscilloscopes, multimeters, signal generators, and power supplies.
* Familiarity with test automation frameworks and scripting languages is a plus.
* Knowledge of Drone Hardware:
* Solid understanding of UAV hardware components and systems, including flight control systems, sensors (e.g., GPS, IMU), communication devices, power systems, and payload integration.
* Familiarity with drone architectures, protocols, and interfaces.
* Analytical and Problem-solving Skills:
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to identify and troubleshoot hardware issues.
* Ability to analyse test data and identify patterns, trends, and potential areas of improvement.
* Attention to Detail:
* Excellent attention to detail to ensure accurate test execution, data recording, and documentation.
* Ability to identify deviations and anomalies in test results.
* Communication and Collaboration:
* Strong verbal and written communication skills to effectively communicate test results, findings, and recommendations to cross functional teams.

Skills


Verification and Validation (V&V)
Lab Testing
Reliability

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
**Job Title**


QA Engineer 3
Common accountabilities:  

  

* Has the required technical/functional knowledge and experience in own discipline. Knowledge of the Amadeus business and how it is related to own area.
* Works using existing procedures or guidelines and provides inputs to support/influence area decisions. Makes recommendations on new solutions and proposes improvements by analyzing different sources of information.
* Works with a moderate level of guidance and direction from manager.

  

Specific accountabilities:  

  

Test strategy  

* Attend to specification/architecture reviews (also on customer specification reviews when applicable), and provide feedback along with any potential impact, risk, issue or missed gap based on experience,
* Define test strategy and test plan containing test cases (functional and non-functional), ensure traceability with specifications and customer requirements,
* Ensure compliance of test strategy with CI/CD guidelines, Green IT guidelines and all quality guidelines (SDL, STDL), QA best practices/standards from the industry (ISTQB..),

  

Test expertise  

* Design test cases and write test case scripts.
* Prepare test environment, test data, and execute test cases.
* Provide sign-off (go/no-go) on tested features based on defined exit criteria,
* Continuously assess the need to add/update/remove test cases to existing regression and CI/CD pipeline when new product features are delivered and based on metrics (stabilization, deletion of flaky tests...),
* As part of maintenance activities, investigate PTRs, test the fixes, and enrich test suites accordingly,

  

Test automation  

* Assess necessity to automate subset of (or all) test scripts,
* Use test automation framework and contribute to its improvement,

  

Defect management  

* Open defects for software or documentation, assign relevant level of severity based on the importance of the issue, provide relevant investigation and information in order to fix defects,
* Check defect fix, and give go/no-go for the load of production defects,

  

Reporting  

* Report and communicate on test activities to the line organization, software developers and product definitions analysts,
* Provide visibility on testing campaign/milestones to all stakeholders,

  

Support  

* Provide mentoring and adapted support to newcomers,
* Provide adapted support to QAE peers based on experience,

  

Knowledge sharing  

* Share knowledge on a specific topic (technical/functional) and spread it among the QA community as well as other stakeholders,

  

Quality assurance ambassador  

* Show accountability for the project, product or release quality control,

title: Technical Sales Engineer
description:
We are seeking an experienced Sales Engineer to join our team at Logic Ladder. You will be responsible for overseeing sales in various channels, including channel sales, enterprise sales, and government sales. You will play a crucial role in driving revenue growth by providing technical expertise, building strong customer relationships, and understanding client requirements to deliver tailored solutions.Primary responsibilities include (but not limited to):

* Develop and maintain relationships with channel partners to drive revenue and achieve sales targets.
* Provide technical support and training to channel partners to enhance their product knowledge and sales capabilities.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to create effective channel-specific sales strategies.
* Identify and engage with potential enterprise clients to understand their technical needs and business objectives.
* Conduct product presentations and demonstrations to showcase the value of Logic Ladder's solutions.
* Work closely with the sales team to prepare and present technical proposals that align with client requirements.
* Navigate government procurement processes and build relationships with key decision-makers.
* Understand government regulations and compliance requirements relevant to our solutions.
* Develop and submit proposals for government contracts, addressing technical specifications and project requirements.
* Stay updated on the latest industry trends, competitor products, and emerging technologies.
* Provide pre-sales technical support, including responding to client inquiries, conducting product demonstrations, and addressing technical concerns.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their evolving needs.
* Act as a liaison between clients and internal teams to ensure customer satisfaction and successful project implementation.

Requirements

* Bachelor's degree in B Tech, Diploma in Engineering, or a related field; MBA preferred.
* Minimum of 2+ years experience in B2B & Government segment of IT/ product sales and/or enterprise software sales
* Experience in SaaS sales in the sustainability sector and/or enterprise FinTech product firms will be advantageous
* Ability to comprehend and communicate complex technical concepts effectively.
* Proven track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets.
* Strong negotiation and closing skills.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Ability to build and maintain relationships with clients, channel partners, and internal teams.
* Team player with a collaborative approach to problem-solving.
* Excellent negotiation, communication, interpersonal, and customer service skills
* Great Team Management, organizational, and creative thinking skills
* Demonstrated ability to increase sales and penetrate new markets
* Strong computer skills and familiarity with various sales software tools Zoho, (Hubspot, Salesforce, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, MS Office, Google Drive etc.).

Good to have :

* Skilled in environmental monitoring, energy management, software, and automation.
* Expertise in crafting persuasive proposals with technical data.
* Excellent problem-solving ability under pressure, especially in telephone interactions.
* Vital collaboration skills for effective communication within the organization and with external vendors.

You are likely to succeed in this role if :

* You are energetic, effective, a self-starter with good communication skills.
* If you are passionate and enjoy working in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.
* Goal-oriented and data-driven
* Affable personality that blends well with an innovative and vibrant startup environment

* Great exposure working on the fastest growing market

description:
**BLUEWING DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION** is a leading construction company specializing in civil engineering projects. With a focus on quality, safety, and innovation, we strive to deliver exceptional results to our clients. We are currently seeking a dynamic and experienced Civil Construction Project Manager to join our team and lead various projects to successful completion.

**Job Description:**

**Position:** Civil Construction Project Manager

**Location:** Ahmedabad On-Site.

**Job Type:** Full-time

**Responsibilities:**

* **Project Planning:** Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, resources, and budgets, in collaboration with the project team and stakeholders.
* **Resource Management:** Allocate resources effectively to ensure project milestones are achieved on time and within budget.
* **Contract Management:** Oversee contract negotiations, review terms and conditions, and ensure compliance with contractual agreements throughout the project lifecycle.
* **Risk Assessment and Management:** Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to minimize project disruptions and financial losses.
* **Quality Control:** Implement quality control measures to ensure that work meets industry standards and client expectations.
* **Communication:** Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, subcontractors, and regulatory agencies, maintaining open and transparent communication throughout the project.
* **Team Leadership:** Provide leadership and guidance to project teams, including engineers, contractors, and support staff, to foster a collaborative and productive work environment.
* **Safety Compliance:** Enforce strict adherence to safety protocols and regulations to promote a safe working environment for all project stakeholders.
* **Progress Reporting:** Prepare and present regular progress reports to clients and senior management, highlighting achievements, challenges, and upcoming milestones.
* **Cost Control:** Monitor project expenses closely, identify cost-saving opportunities, and take corrective action as necessary to ensure projects remain within budget.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.
* Proven experience as a Project Manager in civil construction projects, with a minimum of **10+ years** of relevant experience.
* Strong understanding of construction methods, materials, and techniques, with a focus on civil engineering projects.
* Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with diverse teams.
* In-depth knowledge of relevant regulations and standards, including building codes, zoning laws, and environmental regulations.

title: Program Leader
description:
Are you passionate about shaping the future of data privacy and consent management? If so, we're looking for individuals eager to drive innovation and ensure compliance within our dynamic team. Join us as **Data Program Lead** in crafting seamless integration solutions while championing user consent and regulatory compliance.


**About the Role:**


In these opportunities as **Data Program Lead** you will:

* Engage with technical and business teams and conduct impact assessments to ensure that the privacy by design requirements are carried out throughout TR’s product and technology life cycles.
* Partner with key stakeholders such as the Privacy Office, Operations & Technology, and Product teams to establish appropriate legal and technical safeguards to foster privacy compliance across the company.
* Educate product teams, engineers, and data analysts on privacy by design requirements and privacy guidelines and controls.
* Assist the Operations and Technology teams with ensuring the integrity of TR’s analytics environments from a privacy perspective, including creating data maps and recommending privacy controls for transfers of data in and out of such environments.
* Evaluate market and privacy technology trends and evolutions and research privacy-enhancing technologies and assist TR’s product and technology teams with the validation of technology and analytics controls.
* Collaborate with the Privacy Office to develop ways that Privacy Enhancing Technologies can be leveraged to streamline Privacy by Design and other processes.
* Assist the business in applying essential principles of privacy by design to products and services, including data minimization.

 **About You:**  

You’re a fit for the role of **Data Program Lead** if you meet all or most of these criteria:

* At least 2/ years’ experience implementing and advising on privacy compliance, including privacy by design, preferably within the tech industry with a degree or experience in computer science, data science, engineering, cybersecurity, or related field.
* Demonstrated interest in privacy and data protection as evidenced by completion of IAPP courses and/or relevant certifications or technical background (e.g., CIPT, CDPSE, CISSP, CISM).
* Extensive knowledge of privacy law, regulations, frameworks, and best practices and understanding of global privacy compliance program management.
* Experience with privacy risk management across jurisdictions, with the ability to translate business issues and requirements into actionable plans.
* Provide direct support to business functions and product teams on how to operationalize privacy controls while complimenting existing data ethics/governance framework
* Strong technical background with command of IT, software, data analytics, and/or engineering concepts and processes, including development, design, and architecture of IT technology, data handling processes, data flows, and data lifecycle management.

**What's in it For You?**  

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** We've adopted a flexible hybrid working environment for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country, Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.
* **Social Impact:** Ten employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

**#LI-DD3**

  

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.


We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

**Accessibility**


As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.


We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

***Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings*** ***click here*** ***to know more.***


More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on https://thomsonreuters.com.

title: Hardware Engineer
description:
**Job Description**

**About company:**
------------------


Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue of approximately $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving sophisticated analytical challenges, increasing efficiency in their laboratories, improving patient health through diagnostics or the development and manufacture of life-changing therapies, we are here to support them. Our global teams of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services, Patheon and PPD. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com

**About team:**
---------------


Providing outstanding product development services to Thermo Fisher scientific global business units, is one of the critical objectives India Engineering Center (IEC). This global research and development center, established in 2009, located at HiTech City, Hyderabad, with over 150 employees. We are a team committed to develop innovative and groundbreaking technologically advance products ranging from laboratory equipment, analytical instruments, remote monitoring solutions, chromatography and mass spectrometry. We are proud of the work that we do at IEC thereby fulfilling our mission of making the world a healthier, cleaner, and safer place:

**About the Job:**
------------------


Ideal candidate will help bring ownership for a design de-risking of PCBA which may need refresh driven by aging design or supply chain issues. In this position, candidate will work closely with global sites to ensure that electronics product health within this portfolio achieves best in class. Will ensure right design metrics are followed.

**Role Purpose Summary:**
-------------------------


The Hardware Engineer III is a professional level member of a global R&D Team. The role is of a hands-on Electrical/Electronic engineer who is motivated & technically competent of the new product design and update of existing products. The person will play key role in demonstrating engineering knowledge to assist team in its PCBA Risk Mitigation strategy.

**Job Title: Engineer III, Electrical Hardware**
------------------------------------------------

**Roles & Responsibilities:**


As part of a multi-functional development team, major responsibility will include driving PCBA Risk mitigation strategy and execution of projects for Electronics commodities on product level.

* Responsible for technical delivery of all Electrical & Electronics related projects. Review designs and concepts from the team to ensure the technical quality of actions.
* Own & Implement technically exciting projects right from scoping to implementation
* Should have good knowledge on the compliance requirement & should support product regulatory compliance testing.
* Proficient to synthesise specifications of electronic components into product fitment.
* Work with cross function team to understand customer requirement, participate in system / subsystem design review, finalize electronics design requirement by reviewing with systems & global engineering teams
* Design schematic of digital, mix signal & power electronics circuit board that satisfied the design requirement
* Agility to work on multiple simultaneous projects, tasks & programs to suit business needs
* Provide Plan A, Plan B. Drive design options & tradeoff analysis meeting diverse product requirements.
* Build the design documents for design review (HLD, DFMEA, requirements traceability matrix etc.), and verification plan mapping to the key performance & reliability requirement.
* Verify the design performance qualifying requirements, meeting Manufacturability and Serviceability, and achieve the cost/reliability target.
* Collaborate with multi-domain teams assisting product development meeting regulatory, safety, environmental, reliability, thermal and interface standard (Ethernet, USB, etc.) compliance requirements.
* To work with the sourcing team and the supplier to coordinate the manufacturing and provide detailed requirement for FCT of PCBA to make sure the PCBA from production line can meet design requirement.
* Train, mentor and enhance technical capability of team members

**Skills and Proficiencies:**
-----------------------------

* Excellent understanding of Electrical and Electronics Engineering fundamentals
* Ability to drive decision through design and simulation tools. Mentor different tools and intent with hands-on experience
* Can conceptualize design architectures & identify challenges in designs.
* Applies self-learning to derive component functioning
* Independently conceptualize and run design calculations to prove design
* Collaborate & drive concepts, trade off analysis and leads component selection to meet the technical specifications
* Lead and drive design analysis and simulation ensuring design optimization and confirmation to requirements
* Conduct testing as per test plans (including functional and regulatory test cases). Record test results
* Develop and deliver Schematic based on design document and input.
* Build design documents & artifacts as per design process
* Ability to optimally work on the below tasks with mentorship

**Preferred Qualifications:**
-----------------------------

* Bachelor’s degree in Electrical / Electronic Engineering with proven track of over 10 years
* Knowledge of any Circuit design and Simulation tools.
* Handle medium to high complexity projects independently with ability to be a mentor for early talent.
* Build work breakdown structure (WBS) of projects with support from senior project managers
* Engage with project multi-functional teams for reviews to seek inputs under the guidance of Program & design managers

**Desirable:**
--------------

* Exposure to Project Management
* C/C++ Embedded Programming
* Knowledge on FPGA based Design and programming using HDL

title: Senior Environmental Engineer
description:
**Requisition ID: 275137**

* **Relocation Authorized: International - Accompanied**
* **Telework Type: Full-Time Office/Project**
* **Work Location: Various Permanent Bechtel Office Locations**

**Bechtel:**


Since 1898, we have helped customers complete more than 25,000 projects in 160 countries on all seven continents that have created jobs, grown economies, improved the resiliency of the world's infrastructure, increased access to energy, resources, and vital services, and made the world a safer, cleaner place.


Differentiated by the quality of our people and our relentless drive to deliver the most successful outcomes, we align our capabilities to our customers’ objectives to create a lasting positive impact.


We serve the Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; Mining & Metals, and the Manufacturing and Technology markets. Our services span from initial planning and investment, through start-up and operations.


Core to Bechtel is our Vision, Values and Commitments. They are what we believe, what customers can expect, and how we deliver

 **The Project:**


Bechtel is seeking to work with a major Indian corporation to provide Project Management Consultant (PMC) Services and Engineering Procurement and Construction Management (EPCM) Services for offsites and utilities (OSBL) for a multi-billion-dollar upgrade / expansion of their existing petrochemical facilities in India. The PMC Services will be led out of India with personnel deployed in Mumbai region, the project sites in India, as well as several key contractor locations across India. The EPCM Services for OSBL will be led out of Bechtel’s India offices.

  

You will bring your experience and expertise to the PMC role while working within the customer’s organization as part of an integrated team. As part of this team, you will commit to supporting the client’s goals while promoting our values of fairness, diversity, inclusion, trust, and collaboration guided by our Vision, Values and Commitments.

 **Position Summary**


Excellent career growth opportunity for a technically strong environmental engineer seeking a new challenge in a fast-paced environment.


Responsible for assigned activities within environmental engineering discipline on the project. Applies broad and diversified knowledge of environmental engineering principles and practices to the project. Makes decisions independently concerning problems within the environmental discipline on the project. Represents the environmental discipline on the project with Contractors and Owner to resolve technical questions and as required to coordinate work.

 **Key Responsibilities**

* Oversee and monitor Contractors’ engineering progress in environmental discipline and reports to project management.
* Review the design scope and deliverables of environmental discipline to ensure Contractors perform all work to agreed standards for safety, health and environment.
* Coordinate with other leaders within the project organization to ensure that multi-discipline interfaces are properly addressed with resolution of technical issues in a timely manner.
* Coordinate and participate in reviews of Contractors’ engineering documents/deliverables within environmental discipline to ensure compliance with the contract requirements, including project procedures, project specifications and applicable codes and standards. Monitor status of Contractor documents reviews for environmental discipline.
* Actively participate in design reviews and HAZOP, HAZID/ENVID, etc. studies.
* Work with other PMC lead discipline engineers to ensure that all interfaces between disciplines are clearly defined and recorded.
* Promote the creation of a work environment supported by leadership which fosters openness, trust, communication, teamwork, empowerment, innovation and satisfaction.
* Participate in project technical reviews, progress and review meetings.
* Prepare environmental engineering deliverables relating to regulatory compliance, air emissions and water/wastewater treatment.
* Prepare, coordinate, and review designs, studies, reports and proposals.
* Take the initiative to coordinate the design development of a system with other engineering disciplines while managing workload and meeting schedule due dates.
* Show knowledge of and perform standard discipline engineering activities on projects with minimal technical oversight.
* Interface with overall project team and client on a regular basis showing excellent communication skills.

**Responsibilities**

* Review of and input to OSBL environmental engineering scope including water & industrial wastewater treatment, process flow diagrams, equipment datasheets and drainage philosophy.
* Review of and input to Licensor deliverables including equipment datasheets, effluent and emission summaries and drawings.
* Ensure that project is compliant with federal and state environmental legislation and regulations.
* Review permit material for air and effluent emission compliance.
* Compile technical lists and inventories such as emissions and effluents summaries including calculations as required.
* Deliver excellent quality work, showing thoroughness and rigour in checking and attention to detail.

**Qualifications and Skills**

**Basic Qualifications**

**Essential:**


The following are considered as prerequisites for this role:

* Hold a recognized degree in environmental, chemical/process or mechanical engineering from an accredited college or university.
* Display excellent knowledge of technical theory, engineering principles, good engineering practices and how to apply them for design execution.
* Demonstrate ability to work independently with minimal supervision showing a high degree of professionalism.
* Have familiarity with major regulations and industry codes and standards affecting standard design, quality, or processes.
* Be a Chartered Engineer (or equivalent) or shows willingness to complete.
* Have experience in EPC industry and with large-scale project execution.
* Have experience as previous PMC / Owners’ Engineer.

**Desirable:**


Any of the following experience is considered as important for this role:

* Previous Chemical or Petrochemical experience.
* Previous experience of working in India.
* Expertise in assessing of air emissions from industrial sources.
* Expertise in designing of water/industrial wastewater systems.
* Experience of managing 3rd party contractors for ESIA/EIA, air dispersion modelling, effluent dispersion modelling, etc.

***Shaping tomorrow together***

***Bechtel is one of the most respected global engineering, construction, and project management companies. Together with our customers, we deliver landmark projects that foster long-term progress and economic growth. Since 1898, we’ve completed more than 25,000 extraordinary projects across 160 countries on all seven continents. We operate through four global businesses: Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; and Mining & Metals. Our company and our culture are built on more than a century of leadership and a relentless adherence to our values, the core of which are safety, quality, ethics, and integrity. These values are what we believe, what we expect, what we deliver, and what we live.***  

***www.bechtel.com***

***Bechtel is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, disability, citizenship status (except as authorized by law), protected veteran status, genetic information, and any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.***

***In accordance with Bechtel's duty to provide and maintain a safe workplace for our employees and to safeguard the health of our families, customers, and visitors, we have adopted mandatory COVID-19 safety protocols for each work location, which may include a vaccination or testing requirement. Please speak with your Bechtel recruiter to determine which protocols apply to the work location for the job you are seeking.***

title: Junior Engineer
description:
**Job Description Summary**
===========================

**Job Description**
===================

**Job Description Summary**


Performing operations related to Aerospace assembly components. Accountable for the quality of own work. Subject to direct operations supervision/prescribed work instructions/systems checking. Executes within a well-defined operations framework. There is generally a step-by-step sequence of standard operational tasks which need to be followed to achieve a result.

**Essential Responsibilities:**

* Diploma in mechanical engineering with minimum of 2-3 years’ experience in Aviation Tubes and Ducts, Fabrication Industry.
* Shall have experience in fabrication & fasteners assembly. Capable of validating and ensuring customer specification compliance, knowing GE, RR, Boeing requirements will be an added advantage.
* Shall have experience in assembly process. Capable of establishing different riveting, insulations, inserts, links, clips assemblies.
* Shall have experience in drawing evaluation and providing inputs essential for assembly process establishment.
* Ability to analyse defects, identify root causes and provide efficient solution and implement CAPA.
* Basic knowledge of stainless steel and Inconel tube and sheet fabrication in aviation industry.
* Working experience with GE Aviation P Specifications.
* Ensure that manufacturing procedures follow safety and environmental regulations.
* Must be familiar with EHS practices inside workshop as well as on site.
* Responsible for FAI prove outs and creating new assembly procedures/MOS’s for the same.

**Qualifications/Requirements:**

* Should Have Minimum of 2-3 years’ hands on experience in aerospace assembly components.
* Should have good communication and interpersonal skill.

**Desired Characteristics:**

* Strong oral and written communication skills. Ability to document, execute new assemblies.
* Humble: respectful, receptive, agile, eager to learn
* Transparent: shares critical information, speaks with candour, contributes constructively
* Focused: quick learner, strategically prioritizes work, committed
* Problem solver: analytical-minded, challenges existing processes, critical thinker.

**Additional Information**
==========================

**Relocation Assistance Provided:** No

title: Senior Process Engineer
description:

* **Relocation Authorized: International - Accompanied**
* **Telework Type: Full-Time Office/Project**
* **Work Location: Various Bechtel Project Locations**

**PMC Senior Process Safety Engineer**

  

Bechtel is seeking to work with a major Indian corporation (Owner) to provide Project Management Consultant (PMC) Services as well as Engineering Procurement and Construction Management (EPCM) Services for offsites and utilities (OSBL) for a multi-billion-dollar upgrade / expansion of their existing petrochemical facilities in India.


The PMC Services will be led out of India with personnel deployed in Mumbai region, the project sites in India, as well as several key contractor locations across India. The EPCM Services for OSBL will be led out of Bechtel’s India offices.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Makes decisions independently concerning problems within the Process Safety discipline on the project. Represents the PMC Process Safety discipline on the project with EPCM Contractor and Owner to resolve technical questions and as required to coordinate work.
* Oversees and monitors EPCM Contractors’ engineering progress in a specific Process safety discipline and reports to PMC management.
* Coordinates and participates in reviews of Contractors’ engineering documents/deliverables within discipline to ensure compliance with the contract requirements, including project procedures, project specifications and applicable codes and standards. Monitors status of Contractor documents reviews for discipline
* Actively participates in design reviews and HAZID, HAZOP/LOPA, etc. studies
* Coordinates with other leaders within the project organization to ensure that multi-discipline interfaces are properly addressed with resolution of technical issues in a timely manner

* Promotes the creation of a work environment supported by leadership which fosters openness, trust, communication, teamwork, empowerment, innovation and satisfaction
* Participates in project technical reviews, progress and review meetings.
* Identifies design safety issues (problems, value improvement opportunities) with contractor’s design and helps clarify areas of complexity during all phases of the engineering design work.
* Understands multi-disciplinary technical issues and can advise on innovative technical solutions to resolve these issues.

 **Qualifications:**

* BSc, BEng or equivalent with extensive relevant experience
* Minimum 15 years in Design HSE management and process safety engineering experience in the Oil and Gas industry, specializing in onshore major projects detailed engineering.
* Excellent knowledge of technical theory, engineering principles, good engineering practices and how to apply them for design execution.
* Demonstrate ability to work independently with minimal supervision showing a high degree of professionalism.

title: Language Specialist
description:
We’re AtkinsRéalis, a world-leading Design, Engineering and Project Management organization. Created by the integration of long-standing organizations dating back to 1911, we are a world-leading professional services and project management company dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. The breadth and depth of our capabilities are delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital.


News and information are available at www.atkinsrealis.com or follow us on LinkedIn.


Our teams are proud to deliver on some of the most prestigious projects across the world. It's thanks to our talented people and their diverse thinking, expertise, and knowledge. Join us and you'll be part of our genuinely collaborative environment, where everyone is supported to make the most of their talents and expertise.  

When it comes to work-life balance, AtkinsRéalis is a great place to be. So, let's discuss how our flexible and remote working policies can support your priorities. We're passionate about are work while valuing each other equally. So, ask us about some of our recent pledges for Women's Equality and being a 'Disability Confident' and 'Inclusive Employer’.


Support and assist Canadian French speaking Technical and Project Management teams to manage and control their documentation of customers and vendors i.e., proposals, product related issues and drawings/documents, manage project performance in a timely and efficient manner.

**Roles and Responsibilities**

* Maintain a Master Document Register (MDR) consisting of drawings, specifications, procedures and plans.
* Examine documents such as blueprints, drawings, change orders, and specifications to verify completeness and data accuracy.
* Follow-up with all the stakeholders to monitor and closure as per the schedule of due dates for drawings, specifications, software, technical manuals, and other documents.
* Prepare and maintain a filing system in various collaboration platforms e.g. Aconex, SharePoint as per project requirements. This filing system allows management team to get an updated Customer & Supplier issued documents as receiving, recording, and processing for internal and external organizations review and approval.
* Manage the flow of correspondence in and out of the company through proper transmittals; ensure outgoing documents are accurate, comply with company standards and policies, route correspondence to correct associates; and protect and secure confidential and proprietary information.
* Copy or scan materials; organize, maintain, and safeguard files and database.
* Review and verify project documents for completeness, format, and compliance with contract requirements.
* Submit project documentation to management team for their approval and transmit approved documents to customer.
* Distribute documentation to the project team and customers for their review and comments.
* Receive, distribute, and track comments received from customers.
* Liaise with engineers, managers, customers, and other stakeholders to discuss the project, prepare documents, or modify contract schedules.
* Liaise with document originators or engineer’s liaison personnel to resolve discrepancies and compiles required changes to documents.
* Update changes of computerized or manual control records; release documents and notify the affected departments.
* Provide support to other departments within the framework of the project e.g., assisting flow of company info.
* For Project Support role, ability to analyse project financials and budgets, ability to prepare purchase requests and purchase orders; Troubleshoots and resolves errors or issues with attention to detail; Processes receipts, accruals, and invoices as part of the purchasing process.

**Minimum Qualification and Experience**

* Graduate in any discipline preferably in Commerce / Finance.
* French language proficiency certificate (DELF B2 or higher) with excellent oral and written communication skills in French.
* Prior experience in engineering, manufacturing or construction is preferred.

**Key competencies / Other skills**

* Adaptability to cope with diverse systems and procedures applicable to a variety of projects.
* Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
* Willing and proactiveness to work under tight deadlines and taking ownership of the tasks assigned to him or her.
* Must be customer service oriented - willing and proactiveness to work under tight deadlines and take ownership of the tasks assigned.
* Strong ability to multitask, prioritize, and work independently with minimal supervision.
* Ability to manage the discussions and documentation process independently.

**Preferred Tools**

* MS Office tools: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.
* Aconex, SharePoint, EDMS and DEMACS.

**What We Can Offer You**

* Varied, interesting and meaningful work.
* A hybrid working environment with flexibility and great opportunities.
* Opportunities for training and, as the team grows, career progression or sideways moves.
* An opportunity to work within a large global multi-disciplinary consultancy on a mission to change the ways we approach business as usual.

**Why work for AtkinsRéalis?**  

We at AtkinsRéalis are committed to developing its people both personally and professionally. Our colleagues have the advantage of access to a high ranging training portfolio and development activities designed to help make the best of individual’s abilities and talents. We also actively support staff in achieving corporate membership of relevant institutions.

**Meeting Your Needs**  

To help you get the most out of life in and outside of work, we offer employees ‘Total Reward’.  

Making sure you're supported is important to us. So, if you identify as having a disability, tell us ahead of your interview, and we’ll discuss any adjustments you might need.

**Additional Information**  

We are an equal opportunity, drug-free employer committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive community - a place where we can all be ourselves, thrive and develop. To help embed inclusion for all, from day one, we offer a range of family friendly, inclusive employment policies, flexible working arrangements and employee networks to support staff from different backgrounds. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we value applications from all backgrounds, cultures and ability.


We care about your privacy and are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.


Link: Equality, diversity & inclusion | Atkins India (atkinsrealis.com).
